Job Summary:
Citylitics delivers predictive intelligence on local utility & public infrastructure markets.

The U.S. needs to invest $4.5 Trillion over the next 5 years to upgrade its infrastructure, including water, energy, public transit, roads, airports, and more. Citylitics is the only source of predictive intelligence on where, how, and why these infrastructure investments will be made. Our Data Engine transforms over a billion documents buried in 31,000+ cities & utilities data sources into high value intelligence for targeted business development. The largest infrastructure industry leaders rely on Citylitics for external datasets and intelligence reports.
Our company is focused on delivering the intelligence platform that will enable a faster, more transparent, and more efficient marketplace. It will enable solution providers to connect with cities with relevant infrastructure needs in a faster and more digital way than historic market channels. And it will enable cities & utilities to access solutions that deliver on the promise of moving towards a more resilient, sustainable, and equitable infrastructure future.  
 
We are looking for a product-centric Full Stack Developer who enjoys building both frontends and backends, and has prior exposure to large-scale cloud web services. You will make a major impact on the success of our platform as we expand rapidly and unlock new use cases for our users.

Most of our team is based out of Toronto but we are working remotely due to COVID-19. We are open to fully remote candidates but have a preference for candidates based in Toronto, Kitchener/Waterloo, or Milwaukee. We have offices in Toronto, Milwaukee, WI, and Austin, TX.

We are open to both 4 month and 8 month terms (with a preference for 8 months).

Our Tech Stack

Frontend: Javascript (React, Redux, Material-UI, and Styled Components) comprise our main Single Page Application
Backend: A Django Application serves our frontend and APIs. A Kubernetes cluster for our data ingestion and processing which feeds a MySQL database and an Elasticsearch cluster.
Infrastructure: We deploy a number of Docker containers to the Google Cloud Platform and use various services like Cloud Vision, Cloud Functions, and Cloud Pub/Sub. Our deployments are coordinated with Cloud Build. Logs are maintained via Kibana.

Our Team includes several Waterloo alumni and former co-ops.  We know how to design a great co-op experience and build up the skills you need while working on critical path, impactful projects.  You can even ask our alumni questions prior to applying or before your interview: waterwaterwater@citylitics.com.
Job Responsibilities:
Work closely with a cross-functional team including product managers, developers, client success managers, and intelligence analysts to understand requirements for our data infrastructure and develop solutions to improve product delivery and end-user experience.
Execute on our Product Roadmap by building & implementing new features and developing solutions to our most pressing technical and user challenges.
Design, implement, build and maintain our large and distributed, high availability microservices, internal tools, user interfaces, and deployment systems.
Live Outside The Box: You are empowered by Team Leaders to seek out and adapt the latest software technologies to develop the functionality that will improve our user experience and product quality. Previous co-ops have introduced key python libraries, CI/CD tools, and even designed and deployed platform functionality that is used daily by our Analyst team.
The impact you will make extends beyond just the success of our platform but the improvement of the world's public infrastructure. During your term, you will hear about infrastructure projects that our customers were successful on, due to the data and software you created.
Required Skills:
Experience with React, Python, Javascript, HTML, CSS, and SQL.
You're evidence-driven and data-driven. You make decisions because they have shown to be effective and they cater to the people you're developing for.
Be comfortable in a quickly changing environment, with a lot of responsibility.
A passion for quality, an obsession with automation and a love for writing clean, effective code + documentation.
A drive to be involved in the entire development cycle, from planning through monitoring in production.
A familiarity with the underlying principles of agile software development in a production environment.
An understanding of effective testing strategies and how to develop automated integration and deployment pipelines.

Bonus:


Experience with web scraping and crawlers.
Experience with front-end design.
Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform.
Experience working with large unstructured data sets from multiple sources.

Job Summary:
Are you passionate about what you do? Do you love design, writing, and marketing? Do you like bringing fresh ideas to the table, then making it all happen, and seeing how much of an impact it makes? 


Clear Spider is looking for a highly creative individual to join our Marketing & Sales team as a Digital Marketing Co-op. You will work with marketers, salespeople, as well as software and website developers.  This position is also referred to as: Marketing Coordinator Co-op, Marketing Representative Co-op, Marketing Specialist Co-op, Marketing Strategist Co-op. 


In this position, you will be engaged in key projects and initiatives to drive new revenues and improve marketing and sales processes. The prospective leads generated for the sales team include organizations of all sizes, from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies. 


We are looking for somebody with a can-do attitude, someone who wants to be innovative, and will take the extra steps necessary to develop the best content and designs. We are looking for someone who wants to assist in crafting the overall marketing strategy for a business, and help see it through to get amazing results. 


Clear Spider is an open and welcoming space. We value your creativity and we will give you the platform to showcase your talents and opportunities to develop your skill set and add to your portfolio as well. We encourage our co-ops to put together end of work term portfolios to showcase their work with us, and to take with them for future job searches. 


Even though we are a software company, this job does not require any software development or coding. While this position is with the sales and marketing team, there will be no cold-calling required, as most of our leads come to us through inbound marketing channels, and you will be focused on the marketing side of the business. You may interact with businesses who are currently using Clear Spider as part of their day-to-day operations. 


Examples of past portfolios are linked here: 

https://bit.ly/CS_CoOpPortfolios. 


We are open to 4 or 8 month co-op terms. Please state whether you are available for 4 or 8 months on your cover letter.
Job Responsibilities:
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Digital Marketing Co-op at Clear Spider, your core responsibilities include the following: 


Clear Spider Online Presence and Content Creation

Generate written and visual content for the clearspider.net website and blog
Grow social media presence through Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram
Develop creative and engaging marketing and sales materials such as whitepapers, thought leadership articles, infographics, case studies, and online advertisements
Strengthen the company's corporate brand by creating internal and external documents such as a branding packages, style guides, and marketing strategies

OTHER PROJECTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  

Depending on your skills and experience, as well as interest, there may be suitable projects in other areas of marketing as well:
 

Marketing Data and Analytics (Google Analytics and SEO)
Paid Search Strategy (ads on Google and Bing, ads on social media such as LinkedIn and Facebook)
Website Improvements (Clear Spider homepage, landing pages, other webpages)
Website Conversion Optimization (forms, chatbots, other conversion funnels)
Increased Lead Generation (optimizing for quantity of organic and paid leads)
Marketing Campaigns (develop digital marketing strategy and customer acquisition channels)
Market Research (perform research and analysis to improve competitive positioning)
Required Skills:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Co-op student in Marketing, Arts & Business, Communications, or Design
Strong desire to learn about all aspects of B2B marketing
Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop)
Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Gmail)
Strong performance working with others on group projects
High quality and quantity of work in completing assigned tasks and individual projects

Experience in Marketing or Sales
Wordpress, Blogging, Social Media Management
Knowledge of Concepts in Operations, Inventory Management, and Supply Chain

Job Summary:
ClearCalcs makes design calculations the easiest part of an engineer's job. We're a rapidly growing engineering software company already helping hundreds of engineers on five continents. We offer simple, easy to use online engineering calculations that help automate structural and geotechnical calculations for residential and light commercial building design. 


We're looking for a motivated 3rd or 4th year student to help us on our mission to automate and simplify structural calculations for engineers across the world. You'll be reporting to our North American Structures Lead (in our Ottawa office) to assist in creating and updating engineering calculators, producing help content and going through our quality assurance process. This role is perfect for someone who's proud of their spreadsheets and comfortable with theory, and who wants to challenge themselves to develop and take more responsibility. 


At ClearCalcs, we can offer you a unique insight into how engineering calculations are performed, whether that's in Canada, the US or around the world. You'll get to see and learn how hundreds of engineers, architects, and designers each go in their own way from a simple idea to a fully designed structure. You can expect to come out of this internship with a deep understanding of engineering tools, principles, and standards that'll serve you through your entire career. 


Given current restrictions, the role will likely be fully remote, with the possibility of in-person work at our Ottawa office if convenient and if COVID restrictions allow. In either case, we have always supported remote working and have a rich online messaging and video chat culture you can partake in as an integral and supported member of our team. 


As an established startup, we're not a conventional engineering practice. Our role is to help other firms be the best they can be. Our small, driven team is entering an exciting phase of growth as we add to the team and target a larger international market. We believe you can do your best work from anywhere, and so provide flexible work conditions.
Job Responsibilities:
As an integral member of our team, you can expect to take part in many aspects of our engineering process. In particular:
 

Familiarizing yourself and interpreting various design codes and implementing design calculations into the ClearCalcs platform (e.g. strength and serviceability calculations for a steel beam)
Finding engineering data on various construction materials and implementing them in our database of products
Creating validation examples and test cases for ClearCalcs' calculators 
Producing engineering help and training content for our users
Occasionally supporting our customers with technical questions and concerns
Assisting with consulting projects involving the creation of client-specific calculators
Whatever else you like - think you can help out in other ways? Let's try it out!
Required Skills:
There are a few skills and qualities that will make this work term most valuable both to you and to us.
 

Experience producing engineering calculations in Excel, MathCad, MATLAB, or similar programs
A good understanding of engineering standards and how they apply to practical engineering
Comfortable with technology and quick to learn new software
Attention to detail and diligence in your work
Self-motivated and confident working independently
Due to the time zone difference with our head office in Australia, you may be asked occasionally to join meetings in the evenings
You will need to provide your own computer
Any real-world design experience will be a very strong asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Architecture and Design
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Clearcos co-founders Michele Romanow and Andrew D'Souza knew there had to be a better way to fund your business than staking your house or sacrificing ownership of your company.  


Michele and Andrew deeply understand the pains of building a business; Michele bootstrapped five companies, one which was acquired by Groupon, and sits on the other side of the table as a judge on "Dragon's Den," Canada's equivalent of "Shark Tank." Andrew, meanwhile, has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for multiple startups and is an investor and advisor to many others.  


They've seen the broken funding process from all sides, and the idea for Clearco was inspired by their own experiences and struggles building companies and working with other entrepreneurs.  


Clearco has invested in thousands of companies using data science to identify high-growth funding opportunities. This data-driven approach takes the bias out of decision making. Clearco has funded 8x more female founders than traditional VCs, and has invested in 43 states in the US in 2019. 


WHY WORK WITH US? 


We're a company built by founders for founders, and we're laser focused on our mission to help entrepreneurs succeed. You'll get the chance to work closely with people who have built, scaled and sold companies before.  


While we're obsessed with our vision, we don't take ourselves too seriously. We don't know all the answers, so we're constantly experimenting and learning together.
Job Responsibilities:
What your day-to-day will look like: 

  - Creating new business solutions for our entrepreneurs 
 
- Utilizing systems for onboarding customers 
 
- Using data visualization and BI features (both internal and customer-facing)  
 
- Working on data integrations with third-party data sources 
 
- Gathering technical requirements, software designs, development, QA and deployment 
 
- Delivering working software in an agile environment with weekly sprints  
 
- Working on security including authentication, authorization, encryption etc.
Required Skills:
You will thrive if you: 

 

  - Believe that software is a team sport that requires discipline and accountability 
 
- Are committed to communication through documentation, testing and pairing 
 
- Think outside the box to come up with creative solutions to improve our systems and processes 
 
- Are motivated with lots of initiative and hunger to learn  
 
- Work effectively with cross-functional teams to help with current products and the rollout of new products 
 
- Are not afraid to take on new challenges 
 
- Understand that we don't have all of the answers and are comfortable and able to seek out the answers yourself and ask for guidance as needed 


Technical Requirements: 

  - Vue.js (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)  
 
- Node.js (TypeScript)  
 
- Complied Language 
 
- Google Cloud Platform or AWS 
 
- Docker / Kubernetes 
 
- PostgreSQL, MySQL or other relational databases 
 
- Kafka 
 
- RabbitMQ 
 

Experience with our particular tool-belt is not necessary, but the ability to adapt to it quickly is
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management

Clearco co-founders Michele Romanow and Andrew D'Souza knew there had to be a better way to fund your business than staking your house or sacrificing ownership of your company.  


Michele and Andrew deeply understand the pains of building a business; Michele bootstrapped five companies, one which was acquired by Groupon, and sits on the other side of the table as a judge on "Dragon's Den," Canada's equivalent of "Shark Tank." Andrew, meanwhile, has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for multiple startups and is an investor and advisor to many others.  


They've seen the broken funding process from all sides, and the idea for Clearco was inspired by their own experiences and struggles building companies and working with other entrepreneurs.  


Clearco has invested in thousands of companies using data science to identify high-growth funding opportunities. This data-driven approach takes the bias out of decision making. Clearco has funded 8x more female founders than traditional VCs, and has invested in 43 states in the US in 2019. 


WHY WORK WITH US?


We're a company built by founders for founders, and we're laser-focused on our mission to help entrepreneurs succeed. You'll get the chance to work closely with people who have built, scaled and sold companies before.  


While we're obsessed with our vision, we don't take ourselves too seriously. We don't know all the answers, so we're constantly experimenting and learning together.
Job Responsibilities:
The Data Team consists of Engineers and Scientists empowered to pursue Clearco's business objectives. We use Data Science and Machine Learning to provide data-driven solutions across the organization. 


We value speed, responsibility, and independent thinking. Specifically, in the context of Data Science, this translates into assisting in conducting reproducible research that improves our business metrics, while being constrained by tight deadlines. 


We are open to applicants from all walks of life, as long as you are willing to present a compelling case for the relevance of your core competencies to our business goals. 


Fundamentally, we are looking for somebody who is excited about learning new things and exhibits a healthy amount of skepticism towards, well, just about everything. 

While we will be there for you to help you grow, we also expect you to be comfortable working independently. 


What your day-to-day will look like:

  - Assisting in conducting reproducible research and iterate over machine learning pipelines to improve our business metrics while being constrained by tight deadlines 
 
- Working with a team of data scientists to help transform complex data into meaningful conclusions in a digestible format 
 
- Presenting data using data visualization techniques 
 
- Using Statistics and Data Science to provide data-driven solutions across the organization 
 
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams
Required Skills:
You will thrive if you:

  - Are comfortable with SQL 
 
- Can use Python, including pandas 
 
- Have exposure to analysing data and conducting analyses 
 
- Are familiar with common regression and classification algorithms 
 
- Are familiar with the notions of variance and statistical significance 
 
- Are comfortable with software engineering including cloud and code versioning

Job Summary:
Clearco's mission is to empower founders around the world with the tools required to grow their business. We help founders write their stories by providing them with the capital, insights, and resources they need to accelerate their trajectory. Our core product, a merchant cash advance, is positioned as a tailor-made, fast, and affordable option for eCommerce entrepreneurs looking to scale their companies. We offer funding up to $10M for a flat fee of 6-12.5%, recouped through a revenue share model. In addition to other financial solutions, we also provide founders with data-driven insights to understand their current position amongst their competitors and utilize their capital in a growth-optimized manner. 


Clearco co-founders Michele Romanow and Andrew D'Souza knew there had to be a better way for entrepreneurs to have the funding and insights they need to scale their business. 


Michele and Andrew deeply understand the pains of building a business; Michele bootstrapped five companies and sits on the other side of the table as a judge on "Dragon's Den," Canada's equivalent of "Shark Tank." Andrew has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for multiple startups and is an investor and advisor to many others. The idea for Clearbanc was inspired by their own experiences and struggles in building companies and working with other entrepreneurs. 


Clearco has provided capital to thousands of companies using proprietary software and data science models to identify high-growth funding opportunities. This data-driven approach takes the bias out of decision making. Clearco has funded 8x more female founders than traditional VCs, and has invested in over 3,300 eCommerce companies across Canada, the USA, and the UK.  


Why work with us?

We're a company built by founders for founders, and we're laser-focused on our mission to empower the next generation of entrepreneurs. You'll get the chance to work closely with people who have built, scaled and sold companies before. While we're obsessed with our vision, we don't take ourselves too seriously. We don't know all the answers, so we're constantly experimenting and learning together. 


Clearco is going through an exciting growth phase. This year, we've continued to grow our main capital product while rolling out Valuation and Runway and other financing options, and we're looking for the right people to join #TeamClearco. This is a unique opportunity for an ambitious person looking to make an impact while getting exposure to fintech and learning what it takes to build a successful startup.
Job Responsibilities:
What your day-to-day will look like: 

- Assist with full-cycle recruitment, including application review, phone screens, and scheduling 

- Research & compile lists of prospective universities and programs that Clearco should target 

- Be involved in our Campus Scout program and evaluate what campus events Clearco should be present at across Canada 

- Create a strong social connection with your co-op group by planning and leading events internally 

- Research funding opportunities for national and international students 

- Work with hiring managers and students to ensure we have the necessary documentation for funding and term evaluations 

- Assist in building out internal processes for campus recruitment 

- Attend campus recruitment events throughout the term with the talent team
Required Skills:
- Have completed a previous co-op term in recruitment or HR 

- Are a leader in your program/faculty at your campus  

- Can juggle multiple priorities and competing deadlines 

- Enjoy building relationships and are passionate about providing a stellar candidate experience

Job Summary:
Estimator Co-Op

Toronto, Ontario 

CLEARWAY - Ordinary People Extraordinary Results! 

  

A team of dedicated professionals 

  

At Clearway we are committed to every project.  We pride ourselves on a keen work ethic and more importantly, the talent and skill of our people.  In fact, the Clearway Staff is the reason why so many organizations turn to us for the most complex construction assignments.  That is how we have evolved from a sewer and watermain contractor, to one of Canada's most reputable construction companies with as many capabilities as there are needs. 

  

Since 1973 Clearway has worked on local and international construction projects including sewer and watermain, construction management, heavy civil, roadway construction, earth works, and design/build.  

  

If you are looking to work for a growing company who values the contribution of its employees and you demonstrate creativity, ingenuity, initiative, and a high-level commitment then we are the company for you. 

  

Summary

  

Reporting to the Estimating Manager, The Estimator Co-Op incumbent will be responsible for reviewing data on bids and successful wins working with excel and macro programming.
Job Responsibilities:
Analyze tender drawings and specifications
Review project costs and compare estimates to won bids
Perform data analysis and extraction
Prepare complete tenders including all requirements
Organize activities and respond effectively and efficiently with the business objectives set by the manager
Prepare estimates based on probable costs of materials, labour and equipment, and subcontractors for construction projects based on contract bids, quotations, schematic drawings, and specifications
Maintain directory of suppliers, contractors, and subcontractors
Ensure good quality and accurate record keeping
Ensure project team are provided with proper documentation related to project
Provide and maintain unit pricing and database for material and labour costing
Formulate cost break down from estimates in Heavybid software
Assist in Heavybid system updates
Review bid advertising websites and report leads
Analyze market trends and make recommendation on bidding targets
Required Skills:
Pursuing studies in Math 
Detail oriented and able to multi-task under the pressure of deadlines
Able to conduct moderately complex technical communications in English with internal and external parties, both written and verbal
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada - no work permit sponsorship is available for this position
Ability to work independently or as part of a team
Ability to work with MS Office programs including word, excel, macros, and outlook
Experience with Heavybid software is an asset
Ability to read civil blueprints is an asset

  

We offer challenging and rewarding opportunities to grow, learn and excel.

Job Summary:
Are you looking for a crash course in Growth Marketing at one of Canada's most successful technology companies? 


Growth Marketing at Clio is at the intersection of marketing, data, and experimentation. You will have an opportunity to learn from experts, work on projects that drive growth, and make a real impact. 


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.  


We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Canada's Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies.  In line with our mission, we've been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative, and most recently, securing a  US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation. 


This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you've ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you. 


Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. 


Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. 


Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers
Job Responsibilities: We are looking for a four-month co-op to join us January 2022 through April 2022. You will be working on a variety of marketing initiatives to support revenue goals. Your work will give you an inside look at drive business growth. You will be collaborating with other members of the marketing team, as well as other departments in the company and across our global offices.
Required Skills:
Who You Are:

-You are a co-op student with a passion for marketing, growth and experimentation. 

-You have had previous co-ops in marketing and/or side projects that demonstrate your experience and skills. 

-You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. 

-You have a positive, can-do attitude with a strong desire to get things done!

Job Summary:
Cloudworks (a part of Accenture), who are we? 


Trusted business advisors helping organizations implement tomorrow's Cloud-enabled business and technology solutions. Winner of the Globe & Mail 2021 Top Employer for Recent Graduates as well as Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers! 


Cloudworks is a leading technology consulting firm working with organizations to leverage cloud-based platforms and software services for enabling and enhancing business processes. From technology strategy to solution implementation to business process reengineering, Cloudworks assists organizations in realizing the value-add potential of industry leading enterprise cloud technology. Cloudworks' executes our comprehensive, market leading implementation advisory offerings through five main practices which encompass Human Capital Management (HCM), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Enterprise Performance Management (EPM), Application Management Services (AMS) and Robotic Process Automation (RPA). 


Our team is made up of experienced consulting professionals who hold a unique combination of deep technical expertise and extensive business insight. This dual focus of technical and functional know-how puts Cloudworks in a position to support our clients in solving some of their most challenging business problems through the use of technology. 


Cloudworks is looking for ambitious, forward thinking co-op candidates for our Technical Analyst role!  We are looking for those eager to join our technology advisory teams and become an active contributor in supporting our clients in their journey to cutting edge enterprise solutions. Join us today and begin building your technology advisory career with a rapidly growing firm who is eager to invest in your skillset and long-term personal development!
Job Responsibilities:
Who are you?


Cloudworks (a part of Accenture) believes you may be a good candidate for the Technical Analyst role if: 
 

You are interested in understanding and using technology to solve business problems. You have sound judgement, attention to detail and tenacity for solving challenging problems
You have strong analytical skills, are intellectually curious and have strong technical skills
You bring a positive energy to a team-based work environment, and thrive on collaboration
You strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways
You are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint
You know or want to know more about technology consulting
You are dedicated, organized and can prioritize tasks to meet deliverable deadlines
You are interested and willing to learn both the functional and technical side of the implementation advisory business (why to do it, how to do it)

Role Responsibilities


In the Technical Analyst role, the successful candidate will:
 

Participate in technical aspects of software solution design and configuration processes, and leverage that training to support the development of best in class solutions for clients

Job Summary:
Cloudworks (a part of Accenture), who are we?

Trusted business advisors helping organizations implement tomorrow's Cloud-enabled business and technology solutions. Winner of the Globe & Mail 2021 Top Employer for Recent Graduates as well as Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers!

Cloudworks is a leading technology consulting firm working with organizations to leverage cloud-based platforms and software services for enabling and enhancing business processes. From technology strategy to solution implementation to business process reengineering, Cloudworks assists organizations in realizing the value-add potential of industry leading enterprise cloud technology. Cloudworks' executes our comprehensive, market leading implementation advisory offerings through five main practices which encompass Human Capital Management (HCM), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Enterprise Performance Management (EPM), Application Management Services (AMS) and Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

Our team is made up of experienced consulting professionals who hold a unique combination of deep technical expertise and extensive business insight. This dual focus of technical and functional know-how puts Cloudworks in a position to support our clients in solving some of their most challenging business problems through the use of technology.

Cloudworks (a part of Accenture) is looking for ambitious, forward thinking co-op candidates to fill our Functional Analyst role with our Oracle Cloud - EPM, ERP, HCM and AMS  technology advisory teams and become an active contributor in supporting our clients in their journey to cutting edge enterprise solutions. Join us today and begin building your technology advisory career with a rapidly growing firm who is eager to invest in your skillset and long-term personal development!
Job Responsibilities:
Who are you?

Cloudworks (a part of Accenture) believes you may be a good candidate for the Functional Analyst role if: 

You are interested in understanding and using technology to solve business problems. You have sound judgement, attention to detail and tenacity for solving challenging problems
You have strong analytical skills and are intellectually curious
You bring a positive energy to a team-based work environment, and thrive on collaboration
You strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways
You are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint
You know or want to know more about technology consulting
You are dedicated, organized and can prioritize tasks to meet deliverable deadlines
You are interested and willing to learn both the functional and technical side of the implementation advisory business (why to do it, how to do it)

Job Summary:
At Clutch, we are reinventing the way people buy and own cars. Our mission is to provide customers with a delightful car buying experience by offering high-quality cars at great prices with ultimate convenience while making a positive impact on our communities. Our culture is rooted in 11 core values: 1) We Deliver Incredible 2) We Do The Right Thing 3) We Look for the Assist 4) We Are Owners Not Renters 5) We Focus on Fundamentals 6) We Promote Autonomy 7) We Embrace Hard Things 8) We Are Underdogs 9) We Speak Up 10) We Take Bold Bets 11) We Are Optimistic Leaders. 

  

We pride ourselves on being a technology-first company and believe we can fundamentally change the way people buy and own cars. We were tired of traditional dealerships that take advantage of customers and wanted to build something better. We offer high-quality certified vehicles at great prices through a fully online customer experience. We invite customers to browse our inventory online, buy the car that's right for them, and enjoy effortless at-home delivery.  

  

We have a deep passion for building and bringing teams together. We value individuality, diversity of thought and embrace a problem-solving culture. Clutch is backed by a number of world-class investors including Real Ventures, BrandProject, Azure Capital Partners, FJ Labs and Global Founders Capital. 


Clutch is looking for a financial analyst to join the finance team. As a financial analyst, you will work directly with the Controller and Director of Finance on a variety of accounting and ad-hoc finance projects.
Job Responsibilities:
Prepare forecasts and budgets used by key stakeholders to monitor business performance
Help implement and maintain a proper cost accounting framework to produce accurate and timely margin reporting
Work in a team of 5 through day to day transactions and month close
Aid preparation of accurate and timely financial reporting on a weekly and monthly basis
Assist annual audit compliance work
Prepare HST and other government remittances 
Assist in the development and implementation of internal controls. Assist in identifying inefficiencies and revamping processes to eliminate them in addition to providing training and support to finance staff
Work on a variety of ad hoc finance projects that will have an impact on all areas of the business
Required Skills:
Have the ability to prioritize and meet multiple deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
Possess strong organizational skills
Are detail-oriented and meticulous - you take pride in knowing the details and are obsessed with accuracy
Are able to communicate effectively to both internal and external stakeholders
Possess excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Can deliver results independently and while working with a team
Strong proficiency in Excel and the full Office Suite of products
Are excited about the opportunity to work in a fast-moving and growing company
Experience with VBA, SQL or other programming languages is a plus
Ideally, you have interest in the automotive industry

Job Summary:
Coactuate is a strategic design consultancy obsessed with helping organizations transform complexity into clarity. Our team of strategists, foresight experts, design thinkers, social scientists and biomedical communicators combine management strategy with design thinking approaches to build strategies that get implemented. We are a fast-paced, highly collaborative studio environment driven by tackling difficult and large-scale challenges.

Placement Responsibilities:
We are looking for a creative Intern to join the Coactuate Elevation Internship program! We hope that by giving emerging designers space to experiment, we will be able to provide our clients with more innovative and exciting solutions.
 
The Coactuate Elevation Internship is a paid placement geared towards students interested in applying design to strategy. The Elevation Internship is a short-term project with a clear objective: to help us rethink how we interactively present complex information. We're looking for someone who loves working through ideation, prototyping, and execution.

By the end of your placement, you'll work with our team to help create an interactive platform that helps a broad range of users understand and explore a complex topic.
Job Responsibilities:
Key activities:

Develop prototypes that present information in compelling ways
Test prototypes with team members and gather feedback
Iterate and refine prototypes into final solutions
Present explorations to the broader organization, communicating your process and the benefits of your solutions
Check in daily to discuss progress and next steps with our Design Director, Design Associate, and other team members as necessary
Required Skills:
Our ideal candidate:

Loves translating complexity into clarity, generating creative approaches to convey information in an engaging way
Can pull wireframes through to interactive prototypes. It doesn't have to be beautiful, but we want it to be functional
Has the ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach
Is comfortable generating and testing multiple solutions to a problem
Is curious to learn from and work with strategists, researchers, and other people outside their specialty area 
Has experience using prototyping tools such as Figma or Adobe XD

Job Summary:
Databases are the beating heart of every business in the world! 

Cockroach Labs is the team behind CockroachDB, an open source, distributed SQL database. We strive to build infrastructure that keeps pace with the world, so developers can focus on what matters most: building the best products. Come and join us on our mission to Make Data Easy.

Are you ready to aim high and build to last?
Job Responsibilities:
The Role

We are looking for extraordinary Backend, Full-stack, and Frontend Engineering Interns to join our team! 
Design, code, and test the web frontend for CockroachCloud or the backend for our distributed, open source database, CockroachDB. You will bring your expertise to the table to provide the best user experience to our users, partners, and customers.
You will collaborate with web designers, product managers, and customers to create user friendly experience to deploy, manage, monitor CockroachDB.
A huge bonus is that even after your experience at Cockroach Labs ends, your code will live on in our open source GitHub repo, CockroachDB. Come help us on our mission to enable every developer to build world-changing applications! 

The Expectations

In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. During this time, you will work on a starter project that allows you to gain confidence in navigating the code base and gain familiarity with our engineering environment. We believe that it's important for you to take this first month to become familiar with our technology and our company. 
For the next 3 months, you will contribute to our codebase for CockroachDB, CockroachCloud, or our developer infrastructure. After wrapping up your starter project, you will work with your manager to focus your efforts on a project that aligns with your interests and the product roadmap.
Required Skills:
You are pursuing or have recently completed studies in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between December 2022 and May 2024.
You have had exposure to coursework on subjects like distributed systems, concurrency control, data replication, file systems, or SQL processing.
Comfort using programming languages like Javascript, React, Redux, Go, C/C++, Java, and Python/Django. We use React.js, Redux, and Typescript on the client side and use Go on the server side. If you don't know any of these languages, you'll learn them while you're here.
You love building relationships with your colleagues. You enjoy being part of the code review process and partnering with your teammates on challenging problems.
You have past experience working on production-level code.
You are genuinely interested in Cockroach Labs' mission and are excited to use CockroachDB in your projects.
Our interview process consists largely of programming in a real environment, and we'll be evaluating you on the skills listed above.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé

Job Title: Embedded SW and Algorithm Developer (Computer Vision)
Job Summary:
Coherent Logix is a leader in low power, high performance, C-programmable massively-parallel processors for the embedded systems market.

Coherent Logix is seeking a creative individual to design and implement high-performance computational modules for HyperX processors, integrate them into a computer vision system, test and benchmark them.

The position is suitable both for undergraduate and master students.  Working in the office is preferred (assuming allowed per health guidelines) and can also be performed remotely.
Job Responsibilities:
The candidate will have an opportunity to:

Research and understand the math and logic of selected OpenCV, BLAS and Machine Learning algorithms
Implement selected OpenCV, BLAS and Machine Learning functions using C and possibly assembly language on the massively-parallel HyperX Processor
Develop testbenches that will serve as platforms for functional verification and performance benchmarking
Develop new features for computer vision applications.
Required Skills:
Required

Programming: C, Assembly, Python.
Ability to learn and work independently.
Familiar with Linux, including scripting.

Desired

Experience with OpenCV, BLAS and Machine Learning libraries.
C/C++ and assembly programming for embedded systems (DSP, ARM, etc).
Familiar with version control systems, e.g. SVN, Git.

Job Summary:
CCF seeks to bring the future of digital currency globally and in Canada. We are looking for a hardworking individual who loves numbers, accounting, and analysis to join our finance team as an Accounting Intern.


Reporting directly to the Finance Director, you will work in close collaboration with an external accounting firm and the Operations. You will be responsible for supporting the upholding of accuracy and completeness of the general ledger, reviewing and controlling the company's flow of cash and crypto, interacting with banks to effect payments and transfers, maintain users, and supporting our accounting and finance policies and procedures, as well as supporting the prep of monthly financial close. 


If you enjoy problem solving, working with large financial datasets, managing a wide array of financial deliverables and working in a fast-paced environment, this opportunity could be a great fit.
Job Responsibilities:
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

Review daily the schedule of invoices. Take measures to find the invoices which are not yet received/booked. Examples include cash and crypto position reports, weekly A/P schedules, banking, crypto payments.
Carry out certain bank and crypto transactions when/where required. Approve certain transactions up to a limit. Retrieve bank statements and transaction lists.
Perform A/P and A/R aging schedule analysis and ensure favourable payment terms.
Assist the Finance Director in establishing and upholding controls and review procedures for flow of cash and virtual currencies. Liaise with IT/Development and operations teams to update reporting, reconciliations, systems and controls
Prepare schedules, working papers, and analysis to support the Finance Director and external accountants with various financial reporting matters. Prepare documents, presentations and spreadsheets for review and discussion
Assist with creating or improving review, approval, reporting, and decision-making procedures for purchase orders, expense reimbursements, contracts/agreements, loans and leases
Support the closing of monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial results. Support reconciliation processes between multiple sub-ledger systems.
Supplier creation and amendments as needed
Creation of orders and ensure that cost centres and GL accounts are correct
Monitoring of vendors reliability in relation to outstanding orders, and cancellation of vendors, if necessary, along with finding a replacement
Other analysis and ad-hoc work as required by the Finance director
Required Skills:
THIS IS YOU

Working towards a bachelor's degree or higher in Accounting and/or Finance
High degree of professionalism, active listening, and proactive issue monitoring
You are a problem solver and an analytical thinker
Can easily communicate and collaborate with multiple contacts 
Able to adhere to deadlines and can multitask on multiple deliverables at once
Very good proficiency in Microsoft and Google Suite, Advanced in Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot Table, VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, Formula Audit, Error resolution)

THIS IS GOOD-TO-HAVE 

Some experience in an Accountant role, ideally supporting full-cycle accounting and the general ledger, reviewing data sets, assisting in preparing financial statements, processing bank wires and other payments
Experience in A/P and A/R.
Accounting experience in the fintech or cryptocurrency industries
Accounting and financial reporting experience, using QuickBooks Online
Studying towards a CPA certification

Job Summary:
Coinsquare is Canada's leading and most secure digital asset trading platform for trading Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and other digital currencies. 

  

We built the most secure trading platform, and since our founding in 2014 we've never lost a coin. We're FINTRAC regulated as a money services business, meaning we keep all our clients' money in Canada and use bank-level security measures on our platform. 

  

Coinsquare's Security team is looking to add a highly skilled Software Engineering Intern with 12-18 months of experience for the Winter term 2022 (January - April) term. You will help drive implementation and delivery of solutions to challenging technical problems.  

  

As a Coinsquare Security Engineer Intern, and part of Coinsquare's Security Operations Team, you will work closely with the IT and DevOps / Infrastructure teams to maintain and improve the security measures for Canada's largest and most secure digital currency exchange. In this role you will help ensure that Coinsquare's infrastructure and endpoints are actively monitored and incidents are thoroughly investigated.  

  

You'll understand the risk landscape and research potential vulnerabilities to Coinsquare's employees, clients and infrastructure. 

  

The candidate will have an aptitude for researching, investigating and working with large data sets. They will be dedicated to self learning, and perfectly comfortable with online self-paced courses.  If they don't have the answer they'll know how to find it.
Job Responsibilities:
Actively monitor network, infrastructure and endpoint security
Assess vulnerabilities and perform penetrations tests
Take an active role in Incident Response and investigations
Build, deploy and maintain tools to help with security intrusion detection
Investigate and resolve incidents, while continuously improving security processes
Required Skills:
You have had experience in a variety of scripting languages
You have had experience with multiple operating systems
You have had experience resolving or researching security vulnerabilities
You have a track record of continuous learning related to modern network security
You demonstrate an understanding of Cloud Infrastructure Security
You have strong organization skills, and attention to detail 
You have experience with incident response
You have a genuine interest in blockchain, cryptocurrency, fintech

Job Summary:
Coinsquare is Canada's leading and most secure digital asset trading platform for trading Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and other digital currencies.  


We built the most secure trading platform, and since our founding in 2014 we've never lost a coin. We're FINTRAC regulated as a money services business, meaning we keep all our clients' money in Canada and use bank-level security measures on our platform.  


Coinsquare's Product & Engineering team is looking to add a highly skilled software developer to our Exchange Product Team.  We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern with 12-18 months of experience to join our growing product engineering team for the Winter term 2022 (January - April) term. You will help drive implementation and delivery of solutions to challenging technical problems.  


 If you are passionate about your craft then we encourage you to reach out. We value your personal insight and ideas as much as your technical skills. In no particular order, some of the things we look for most in candidates are: a desire to collaborate on complex problems, a willingness and interest in learning from anyone (aka a "growth mindset"), a sense of humbleness, and an appreciation of puns.
Job Responsibilities:
Designing, developing, and testing high performance/scalable services in Go and Python
Supporting production systems
Following a security-first approach to building and deploying secure containerized applications in a cloud based environment.
Write clean understandable code
Add to the neverending number of tests
Working in an agile environment with iterative development and fast feedback
Working in a collaborative environment with product, design, and development to build quality software
Required Skills:
You have had previous experience as a backend developer
You have previously worked with SQL and NoSQL storages such as Postgres, Cassandra, Elasticsearch
You have worked with programming languages such as Go and Python
You have experience working with microservices.
You have some knowledge of containers technologies (ie: Docker, Kubernetes)

Coinsquare is Canada's leading and most secure digital asset trading platform for trading Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and other digital currencies. 

  

We built the most secure trading platform, and since our founding in 2014 we've never lost a coin. We're FINTRAC regulated as a money services business, meaning we keep all our clients' money in Canada and use bank-level security measures on our platform. 

  

Coinsquare's Product & Engineering team is looking to add a highly skilled software developer to our Exchange Product Team.  

  

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern with 12-18 months of experience to join our growing product engineering team for the Winter term 2022 (January - April) term. You will help drive implementation and delivery of solutions to challenging technical problems.  

  

If you are passionate about your craft then we encourage you to reach out. We value your personal insight and ideas as much as your technical skills. In no particular order, some of the things we look for most in candidates are: a desire to collaborate on complex problems, a willingness and interest in learning from anyone (aka a "growth mindset"), a sense of humbleness, and an appreciation of puns.

Writing clean, SOLID, and understandable code
Working daily with a modern frontend stack: React (Hooks & Redux patterns), TypeScript, GraphQL, HTML, CSS and JS.
Working in an agile environment with iterative development and fast feedback
Ensure high quality code by performing code reviews and writing unit and UI tests
Deliver improvements and features to real users and triage/troubleshoot production issues
Working in a collaborative environment with product, design, and development to build quality software

You have had previous experience as a frontend development
You are familiar with a modern web frontend framework or library (we use React)
You have an understanding of React Hooks, Redux and state management in SPAs
You are familiarity with a component management library such as Storybook
Having experience on testing presentational components and unit testing regular JS implementations is a plus
You have a willingness to debug, understand and solve JS and UI issues
You have good communication skills written and verbal in English
You have a genuine interest in blockchain, cryptocurrency, fintech

Job Summary:
Instrumentation Coop Engineer (Internship) 


Overview 

We believe that automated driving promises a new paradigm in road safety, saving more than a million lives annually. 

Collisure is looking for an exceptional co-op student to help develop and test our autonomy intelligence technology and make an immediate impact on our team. Many bright minds are focused on building automated driving technology, but more work is needed to make it market-ready. We've chosen to dedicate our efforts to simplify automated driving insurance to bring this life-saving technology to market as soon as possible. 

In this role, you will be applying cutting edge deep learning research to critical real-world problems to transform road safety and car insurance. You will be helping to build a computer vision product that is state of the art. 

  

Employment Term: Full-time 

Experience: 0 to 2 years 

Education: Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor's/Master's. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics or Mechanical Engineering co-op program. 

Location: Vancouver (Remote or In-office) 

Start date: Winter 2022 

Must be enrolled in a post-secondary education co-op program 

  

About Collisure 

We are a purpose-driven start-up. Our purpose is to simplify road safety. You will contribute to building the foundation of our technology and our culture. You will enjoy a results-driven environment that values purpose, responsibility and curiosity. You are encouraged to contribute your ideas, learn from ours and grow together. You will have an immediate impact: your voice will be heard, your opinion will matter, and your ideas will change things for the better.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Data collection, design and testing of embedded systems.  

Instrumentation and control systems programming.  

Data acquisition of MEMS sensors and algorithm development. 

Must have initiative, and be able to complete complex tasks with minimal supervision
Required Skills:
Requirements

Experience with Python. Good understanding of Git and development in Linux 

Experience in data acquisition, data collection and data analysis. 

Exceptional written and verbal skills to concisely present/summarize experimental results. 

Strong attention to details and well organized with a 'getting things done' mindset 

Self-motivated, purpose-driven, and eager to learn 


Plus: 

Experience working with cloud computing frameworks (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure) 

Experience in at least one of: data structures, machine learning

This co-op position is intended for a student who is continuing their education. The co-op student will be responsible for assisting the Maintenance Department with repairs to production equipment and creating and maintaining drawings in AutoCAD, equipment improvements, and assisting with project implementation. This is intended as a learning position and the student may be assigned to work on projects either individually, with other students, or with other members of the department.
Job Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES


Health & Safety

Follows all Health and Safety policies and procedures; wears required PPE in the plant. Attends scheduled safety training; promptly reports unsafe behaviors or work conditions to the supervisor/department manager or the Joint Health & Safety Committee Representative. 

Provides advice to other staff regarding safe use and maintenance of equipment. 


Housekeeping

Ensures work area is kept clean and orderly, and tools are in proper working condition and put away properly. Ensures that spare parts are in proper storage location. 


Attendance

Demonstrates regular and predictable attendance. Is prompt and punctual. Works various hours as situation requires. Is willing to work overtime on a regular basis. 


Drawings

Updates and maintains building and equipment drawings using AutoCAD. 


Maintenance Software

Inputs equipment and parts information into Maintenance software (MP2); orders and receives parts. 


Documentation

Documents work instructions (Qualtrax) for equipment or start up procedures and updates as required. 


Interaction with External Contractors

Acts as on-site contact with external maintenance contractors, ensures safety rules are followed and accompanies, guides and assists them as needed.
Required Skills:
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES

Ability to Learn New Skills

Tends to learn new skills quickly on his/her own AND apply them both quickly and effectively to work situations.

Application of New Skills

Makes it a point to put new skills and knowledge to use on the job in a timely and effective manner.
Applies new skills on the job before forgeting what was learned, and ensures that these skills are used to create a positive impact on a day-to-day basis.

Seeking Feedback

Tends to seek out feedback for the purpose of improving work performance and listens to such feedback with an open mind.
Leaves those who provide feedback satisfied that they have been heard and that their suggestions will be put to use.

Creativity

Applies creativity and originality in the work setting, when appropriate.
Suggests or applies new ways of addressing ongoing work issues and challenges.
Sees possibilities that others have not yet seen, or combines ideas and approaches suggested by others in a unique manner that results in breakthroughs and improvements.
Understands when to be creative and when to stick with what exists now.

Versatility

Is able to take on a variety of different tasks and roles in the organization.
Can move in a relatively seamless manner from one task or focus to another and can fill in for other team members when they are absent or are experiencing work overload.

Teamwork

Is an effective team player who adds complementary skills and contributes valuable ideas, opinions and feedback.
Communicates in an open and candid manner and can be counted upon to fulfill any commitments made to others on the team.

Quality of Work

Has established a track record of producing work that is highly accurate, demonstrates attention to detail and reflects well on the organization.
Is personally committed to high quality work and encourages others to have similar standards.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Formal training and knowledge required, equivalent to High School Education.
Applies general clerical/trade knowledge and skills. Understands basic methods, records, specifications and/or equipment within own work unit
Actively pursuing a Mechanical or Electrical Engineering Degree Program at a recognized university and enrolled in the coop stream

WORK EXPERIENCE

Requires no prior experience, or less than one year of experience
Experience with AutoCAD required
Prior experience working in a team environment preferred
Willing to work in a manufacturing/plant environment

This is a co-op position intended for a student who is continuing their education. The co-op student will be responsible for assisting the Quality Assurance Department in the safe execution and analysis of quality tests for finished goods, assuring that products meet or exceed customer specifications prior to shipment. This involves testing, keeping accurate records of test results, issuing non-conformance reports and issuing product certificates of analysis. Additionally, coop students are responsible for maintaining a safe, clean, and organized work environment at all times. 


This is intended as a learning position and the student may be assigned to work on projects either individually, with other students, or with other members of the department.
Job Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Health & Safety

Follows all Health and Safety policies and procedures; wears all PPE while in the plant or laboratory. 

Attends scheduled safety training. 

Promptly corrects unsafe behaviors or equipment and notifies the department manager or Joint Health & Safety Representative of unsafe equipment. 


Testing Materials

- Assists the QA Technician in testing in process materials and all finished goods by conducting standard tests including the following:
 

  o Producing film from production samples, and comparing color and dispersion quality to standard and/or 
 
o Producing injection molded chips from production samples, and comparing color to standard 
 
o % solids testing 
 
o Melt Flow Analysis / Melt Index testing 
 
o Specific Gravity 
 
o Bulk Density testing 
 
o Pellet size and geometry analysis 
 
o Moisture testing 
 
o Filter testing 
 
o Visual and Instrumental Color Analysis 
 
o Preparation of samples according to customer requirements to accompany shipment 
 
o Any other specific testing required 
 
o Reviews Certificates of Analysis for all incoming raw materials and compares to internal set specifications. 

- Keeping an open communication with production/QA Technicians/Product Development to determine resolutions if possible. 

- Identifies off-spec. product and promptly communicates error. Students may be required to perform quality color tests of suspect pigments related to quality issues. 


QC Samples

Files retained samples from production and first time run standard concentrate vials, and maintains log of locations. 

Responsible for discarded the samples once they exceed require retention time. 

Sorts and saves all incoming supplier Certificates of Analysis of incoming raw material once reviewed and approved. 

Ensures that files are filed appropriately. 


QC File Maintenance

Reviews the production schedule and pulls files for upcoming production orders to make it available for the QA Technician to review. 

After review, the coop student re-files the QA standards folder. 


Attendance

Demonstrates regular and predictable attendance. Is prompt and punctual. Works various hours as situation requires. Is willing to work overtime on a regular basis. 


Complaint Investigation

Assists Technical and Sales Departments with analysis of final concentrates and/or customer supplied parts as part of the investigation process related to customer complaints, issues or business development (TLR's)
Required Skills:
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES


Respectful of Others

Demonstrates a genuine interest in the thoughts, opinions, values and needs of co-workers and customers and views differences in these areas as both inevitable and acceptable.
Avoids speaking, writing or doing other things that could be seen as disrespectful of people in their absence (or "behind their backs").
Recognizes and shows respect for the strengths and contributions of others.

Teamwork

Is an effective team player who adds complementary skills and contributes valuable ideas, opinions and feedback.
Communicates in an open and candid manner and can be counted upon to fulfill any commitments made to others on the team.

Flexibility

Adjusts quickly and effectively to changing conditions and demands.
Discusses change as a necessary and inevitable aspect of organizational life as well as an opportunity to learn new things.
Has a similar view and approach to potentially stressful situations.
Invests personal energy toward accepting and adapting to change that others use toward resisting or resenting it.

Time management

Prioritizes tasks and manages time to ensure that deadlines are met.
Plans his or her time and sticks to those plans.
Prevents or manages interruptions until the highest priority tasks are accomplished.

Ability to Learn New Skills

Tends to learn new skills quickly on his/her own AND apply them both quickly and effectively to work situations.

Application of New Skills

Makes it a point to put new skills and knowledge to use on the job in a timely and effective manner.
Applies new skills on the job before forgeting what was learned, and ensures that these skills are used to create a positive impact on a day-to-day basis.

Seeking Feedback

Tends to seek out feedback for the purpose of improving work performance and listens to such feedback with an open mind.
Leaves those who provide feedback satisfied that they have been heard and that their suggestions will be put to use.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Formal training and knowledge required, equivalent to High School Education. Applies general clerical/trade knowledge and skills. Understands basic methods, records, specifications and/or equipment within own work unit
Actively pursuing an Engineering Degree Program at a recognized university and enrolled in the coop stream.
Preference is given to students in Chemical, Biological, Nanotechnology or related engineering disciplines

Research and experiment with new technologies for high volume production
Product sample parts using prototype tooling and additive manufacturing

Organization: Community Head Injury Resource Services of Toronto
Job Summary:
Community Head Injury Resource Services is a community-based nonprofit agency that supports adults with acquired brain injury.The Adult Day Services (ADS) team provides recreation/leisure programming across the city, including a drop in and peer mentorship program at the head office (62 Finch Ave West) 


Primarily based at the head office location, the Community Recreation Facilitator works as part of the ADS staffing team to deliver weekly programming and special events with-and-for clients.  Since an ABI can be acquired at any time in a person's life, and since it can also be concurrent with other disabilities, every group will be comprised of people with a wide range of (dis)abilities, offering a unique challenge to anyone interested in developing/honing skills in recreation or therapeutic recreation.
Job Responsibilities:
Each placement has some room for modifications depending on the student's skills, experience and interests, but typically involves opportunities for leading groups independently, coleading groups, planning/delivering special events, and running the drop in with assistance from client volunteers. Duties can also include special projects, and administrative tasks such as publishing a monthly calendar, writing reports and maintaining a registration database. CHIRS is strongly committed to making the placement a positive learning experience for the student, and provides a strong orientation/training framework as well as regular supervisions to provide support and facilitate professional growth. Forty (40) hours per week, flexible, as required.Typically includes one weeknight/week and occasional weekends for special events. 


Responsibilities of the Community Recreation Facilitator (Co-op Student):
 

Implement recreation programs both independentlyand with other staff
Support clients on a one-to-one basis in community programs (community fitness, swimming, etc.)
Provide age and need-appropriate activities
Have the opportunity to plan and implement special events (dances, boat cruise, holiday party, etc.)
Maintain a team work approach
Maintain a positive, respectful attitude towards all individuals receiving service and support
Ensure and respect the confidentiality of all individual and agency information
Assist with the day-to-day operation of the Clubhouse, which may include: staffing the drop-in area, lunch preparation, and ordering supplies
 Act as liaison between CHIRS individuals and community-based resources and services


Administrative Duties May Include:
 

Behavioural and incident reports, staff meeting minutes, quarterly program reports, program planning, etc.
Coordinate own schedule under the direction of supervisor
Participate in staff meeting, training and workshops as possible (eg. Crisis Prevention & Intervention, Brain Behaviour)
Participate in ongoing development of departmental publications such as monthly calendar, newsletter, flyers etc.
Required Skills:
ability to work independently/part of a team
strong communication skills
ability to develop strong working relationships
initiative
organization skills
creativity
flexibility
computer literacy
positive approach to learning/supervision
valid First Aid/cpr certification
proof of Covid-19 vaccination OR valid medical exemption
experience working with persons with disabilities is considered an asset
experience providing recreation/leisure programming is considered an asset

Job Summary:
Compass Community Health (formerly North Hamilton Community Health Centre). 


GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: 

  

The Kinesiology Co-Op Student serves as a champion of the Vision and Mission and promotes an environment that is consistent to Compass Community Health (formerly North Hamilton Community Health Centre)  Statement of Values and Principles.  The Kinesiology Co-Op Student is an essential member of the client-centred health professional team.  The Kinesiology Co-Op Student will work with the other members of Compass's teams to effectively and efficiently serve Compass's clients through traditional, non-traditional and innovative approaches to service delivery within the broad determinants of health framework. 

  

SUMMARY OF FUNCTIONS: 

  

The Co-Op Kinesiology Student will assist in the development and delivery of personal fitness programs for community clients, clients of the Caring for my COPD program, as well as lead a falls prevention class.  The position will work towards increasing the knowledge and skills and capacity of health promotion programs regarding physical activity and personal fitness.  The Co-Op Kinesiology Student's approach to client care is evidenced based and innovative and utilizes current therapeutic techniques within the determinants of health framework.  This position works within an inter-professional team-based model in terms of both the client practice and program planning aspects of its responsibilities.
Job Responsibilities:
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Establish comprehensive fitness assessments, setting appropriate goals for individual clients and health promotion for community clients and/or clients of the Caring for my COPD program
Lead a falls prevention group exercise class twice weekly
Prescribe a suitable exercise program to meet patient's goals.
Educate clients about lifestyle issues and determinants of health.
Provide motivation, monitoring, support and feedback for clients.
Explore opportunities for clients to exercise at home or in the community.
Assist in the development and co-ordination of patient and family education.
Provide motivational support to patients and families regarding long term behaviour modification.
Other duties may be assigned, if necessary.
Required Skills:
QUALIFICATIONS:

Candidate for Bachelor Degree in Kinesiology at the University of Waterloo (co-op placement for 4 months).
Demonstrated interpersonal, organizational and written communication skills.
Understanding of adult teaching principles.
Previous experience with groups an asset.
Hands on experience with computers - preferable with Microsoft Office.
The ability to work well as part of a multi-disciplinary health care team.
CPR and Standard First Aid.

Job Summary:
About Us

Compensation Governance Partners (CGP) is an independent, employee-owned consultancy advising on executive compensation governance for Boards and Management. CGP supports Boards and Management by seeking to understand their challenges and then drawing from a diverse set of experiences, ideas and opinions to offer customized solutions. Located in Toronto, CGP services clients across Canada. For more information please visit: www.compgovpartners.com

  

What You Will Learn

As former co-op students, we believe that the co-op program is a valuable opportunity to gain hands-on learning and working experience, and as such we want to ensure that your work term is productive and meaningful. During your time as a co-op at CGP, you will have the opportunity to assist in all parts of our consulting process from project scoping and background research to data collection, analysis, and recommendation generation. 

  

Additionally, working with our team at CGP means working in a growing business. We encourage collaboration and sharing of ideas, and provide growth opportunities not normally found at a larger consultancy. This position will provide you with unique insight into a highly-specialized area of management consulting and practices of consulting businesses overall.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will do

Assist in a variety of compensation and governance related projects including:
	 
  
Performing industry and financial research on executive and Board compensation strategy and design for corporations, including best practices and governance
Analysis and recommendations on executive compensation levels based on proprietary and third party data
Attending client meetings as required throughout the life cycle of each mandate
Conducting research on corporate governance disclosures and regulations, including designing and administrating targeted market surveys
Analysis of publicly disclosed company documents or client materials
Preparation of summary findings and reports, marketing materials and articles


Gain a thorough and deep understanding of best practices for compensation governance and how corporations utilize incentive payments to realize corporate and shareholder success
	 
  
Designing incentive plans based on the client's business strategy and human resources philosophy
Required Skills:
What will help you succeed

Self-starter and motivated individual who is excited to work for a growing business with a boutique feel
Creative, analytical and results-oriented, demonstrated through the ability to draw conclusions, themes, and trends from data analysis
Diligent and consistent attention to detail, project management with the ability to learn from their mistakes
Ability to adapt and work on multiple tasks or projects simultaneously
Exceptional data and quantitative analysis capabilities
Demonstrates strong written and oral communication skills and the ability to engage clients and colleagues at all levels
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel and PowerPoint

  

What we are looking for

Currently studying for a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Math, or Statistics
Understanding option valuation methodologies is a plus
Prior experience in a consulting firm is a plus
Knowledge of executive compensation and governance matters is a plus
