Job Title: Analyst Intern, M&A Analytic Insights, Financial Advisory - Winter 2022 (Toronto)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
Our Mission is to lead the Canadian market in delivering data driven insights and analytic solutions to help clients increase stakeholder value in their defining moments.
Job Responsibilities:
What will your typical day look like? 
 
As an Analyst Intern, you will work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical fields such Data Mining, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, and much more.  You will experience the growth of a practice totally dedicated to the art and science of using data to help clients drive business decisions related to mergers and acquisitions as well as value creation / business improvement initiatives. You will be able to expand your professional development while working with high profile clients who need analytics support for their top priority initiatives and strategies. You will develop advanced analytical solutions within our analytics team, across service lines at Deloitte, and with clients in multiple industries.
 
About the team 
 
Deloitte's Analytic Insights team transforms data into actionable insights - to support strategic decisions that amplify stakeholder value. The team focuses on three business areas to drive value for clients: i) Leverage analytics to generate deeper data-driven insights and optimize decisions across the M&A cycle, ii) Analytics for operational efficiency, to drive productivity and cost control, and iii) Advanced analytics to identify opportunities for profitable revenue growth. Our team is comprised of a mix of deep technical expertise in the statistical and analytics fields and business professionals with the experience to leverage insights to drive business decisions.
 
Permanent Analysts within Financial Advisory join our two-year Quick Start development program.  Through Quick Start, analysts receive up-front training covering key topics from across our Financial Advisory practice, including advisory and technical skills, quality/risk processes, engagement lifecycle, and project management principles.  Once the training is complete, our analysts are deployed on client engagements, proposals, and strategic initiatives.  A CPA stream is available for analysts who need to obtain working hours for their designation.

The objective of our Quick Start program is to provide analysts with exposure to a broad range of engagements, projects, and initiatives from across all service lines within our Financial Advisory practice.  By developing core skills across multiple dimensions, the program aims to assist our analysts in building their careers as future advisors and agile leaders.
Required Skills:
Enough about us, let's talk about you 
 
In this role, the expected qualifications are:  

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in a quantitative discipline (Math, Commerce, Economics, Data Science, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
A creative and analytical thinker with basic knowledge of technical platforms such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau, or Power BI
An understanding of business needs with a focus on solving business problems using data-driven, analytical solutions

Job Title: Analyst Intern, M&A Divestiture Advisory, Financial Advisory - Winter & Summer 2022
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
The M&A Advisory practice delivers innovative end-to-end services to help our clients achieve their Growth and Succession aspirations at key moments that matter. Are you ready for a challenge? Join our team!
Job Responsibilities:
What will your typical day look like?
 
During your time with us, you will participate in the end-to-end client service lifecycle - from business development to project delivery - while also getting to know the different teams and leaders. You will also benefit from ongoing learning opportunities to further develop and refine your core and technical skills.   

Work in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and interviewing key personnel
Work with clients in creating marketing documents, including teasers, Confidential Information Memorandum and management presentations to be used by potential acquirers and capital providers
Analyzing financial data, reviewing accounting records and develop financial models in order to assist clients in understanding potential transaction valuations
Participate in client presentations
Prioritize your objectives and contribute to project planning and status reporting
Work with high profile clients on a variety of Canadian engagements

About the team
 
Our corporate finance professionals enhance value through the delivery of strategic advice and execution services to owner managed mid-market companies, large corporations and financial institutions who are seeking M&A advice that complement their growth strategies.
 
We work with clients throughout the M&A life cycle from defining our clients' objectives, creating marketing materials, contacting potential acquirers, negotiating agreements with our clients' legal team and closing a transaction.
 
Our strategic advisory services include analysis and development of:

Value realization programs including initial public offerings, recapitalizations, or exits via divestiture for corporations, private equity firms, and family enterprises
Optimal capital structures and financing options for companies at all stages of their capital life cycle
Growth strategies incorporating business partnerships or structured acquisition programs 

Transaction execution services include: 


Divestiture of businesses (non-core, succession, growth)
Raising all forms of long-term financing, including senior debt, mezzanine and subordinated debt, and private equity financing
Management buyouts

Permanent Analysts within Financial Advisory join our two-year Quick Start development program.  Through Quick Start, analysts receive up-front training covering key topics from across our Financial Advisory practice, including advisory and technical skills, quality/risk processes, engagement lifecycle, and project management principles.  Once the training is complete, our analysts are deployed on client engagements, proposals, and strategic initiatives.  A CPA stream is available for analysts who need to obtain working hours for their designation.

The objective of our Quick Start program is to provide analysts with exposure to a broad range of engagements, projects, and initiatives from across all service lines within our Financial Advisory practice.  By developing core skills across multiple dimensions, the program aims to assist our analysts in building their careers as future advisors and agile leaders.
Required Skills:
Enough about us, let's talk about you

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma and is available to complete a Winter or Summer Co-op/Internship
Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams
Demonstrates aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, such as financial analysis or modeling, market research and analysis, project problem diagnosis & solution development
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Excellent problem solving, project management and interpersonal skills and ability to work in an ambiguous environment
High proficiency in Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams etc.)

Canadian travel required, occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments.

Job Title: Analyst, Cyber Risk Services - Winter 2022 Intern/Co-op (National)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
Deloitte Cyber enables clients to build an innovative and connected future by ensuring trust and resilience every step of the way. Deloitte is looking for individuals that enjoy solving complex problems and thrive in fast-paced environments. 
 
What will your typical day look like? 
 
As a Practitioner in Cyber Risk Services, you will be a key part of client engagement teams, with responsibilities including:

Working in a collaborative team environment focused on delivering comprehensive solutions including analyzing client challenges and issues, conducting industry analysis, facilitating workshops/interviews/walkthroughs, developing and presenting solutions, implementing innovative process and technology solutions, etc.
Developing business cases and strategic considerations for client initiatives
Supporting the team on security/controls and risk management solution development and system integration
Supporting the team in identifying risks and controls within business and IT processes for various initiatives
Performing technical deployment activities on systems implementation projects
Assisting with the development of security and privacy strategies, policies and standards
Researching and resolving complex issues and developing innovative solutions for clients
Job Responsibilities:
About the team 
 
Deloitte Cyber advises, implements, and manages solutions across five areas:

Strategy, Defense, and Response: We help clients design and implement transformational enterprise security programs with an emphasis on defending against, recovering from, and remediating major cyberattacks.


Data: We assist clients in developing a better understanding of the personal, sensitive, and confidential information they collect, process, and share.
Application Security: We integrate security activities throughout the software development lifecycle to enable the design, build, and deployment of secure applications.
Infrastructure: We assess, strategize, design, implement, and, in select cases, handle next-generation controls to manage risks and exposure.
Identity: We leverage Deloitte's Identity methodologies and Digital Identity platform to help clients control which employees, partners, suppliers, customers, and citizens access sensitive organizational applications and data.

 
Deloitte Cyber supports clients in the following industries:

Consumer: Our leaders work with global brands to help them create winning strategies in the Automotive, Consumer Products, Retail, and Transportation, Hospitality, and Service sectors.


Energy, Resources & Industrials: Our specialists provide broad integrated solutions to the Oil, Gas & Chemicals, Power & Utilities, and Industrial Products & Construction sectors.
Financial Services: Our industry specialists provide broad integrated solutions to the Banking & Capital Markets, Insurance, and Investment Management sectors.
Life Sciences & Health Care: Our professionals guide traditional health care and life science companies, as well as new market entrants, in navigating the complexities of health care systems.
Government & Public Services: Our team of professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill your mission promise.
Technology, Media & Telecommunications: Our industry practice brings together one of the world's largest groups of specialists respected for helping shape recognized TMT brands and helping those brands thrive in a digital world.

 
Become a cyber leader at Deloitte. Build your cyber expertise in areas that interest you. Check out Deloitte's Cyber Risk Services Portfolio to learn more. Within Cyber Security, there are different personas that exist, and you may be able to identify yourself with one or multiple of these personas. To gain more information about this, please navigate to Deloitte's report on "The changing faces of cybersecurity"
Required Skills:
Enough about us, let's talk about you 
 
In this role, the expected qualifications are:

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions.
An effective verbal and written communicator with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions.
Able to learn quickly and adapt to a changing environment.
Able to travel within Canada and occasionally internationally.

 
 
Our shared values 
 
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
 
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
 
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
 

Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

 


Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

 


Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

 


Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

 


Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

 
The next step is yours
 
Sound like The One Firm. For You?  Apply now! Deadlines to apply:
 

Calgary:  September 19, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST
Toronto: September 20, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST
Montreal: September 22, 2021 at 11:59 PM EST

 
To be considered, you must ALSO submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF document to https://career8.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=78965&company=CADeloitte
 
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively ? that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
 
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!
 
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

We work within various team sizes ranging from 2-3 people up to 100+ team members and collaborate on projects with Oracle, SAP, Workday, Supply Chain, and Human Capital. We lead our clients' exploration and application of emerging digital technologies in order to improve efficiency and provide more accurate and timely information to enable better decision making. You will play a pivotal role on a collaborative engagement team with responsibilities that range from analyzing client issues and interviewing key personnel to developing recommendations and authoring presentations.  You will have the opportunity to leverage your professional background and skills by specializing immediately or by gaining exposure to several industries and competencies during your first few years with the firm.  
As a member of the Enterprise, Technology and Performance offering, you will help clients achieve the maximum possible impact and value from their investments in Supply Chain using a holistic view of key business functions from strategy articulation through process design and technology enablement. 
 
About the team  
The Supply Chain and Network Operations practice helps our clients imagine, deliver, and run their Digital Supply Network to address tomorrow's challenges and opportunities. We tackle complex issues by drawing on global capabilities that span across all areas of business strategy and operations. We employ programmatic approaches and leverage analytics through advisory led transformations to improve top-line growth, lower costs, and gain increased visibility at executive and operational levels. We work with a wide range of industries across Canada and internationally in supply management & digital procurement, planning & fulfillment, and manufacturing strategy & smart operations.
Required Skills:
Enough about us, let's talk about you 
In this role, the expected qualifications are: 

Currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree program and returning to school following completion of this co-op term, pursuing Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Commerce, Economics, Accounting, Finance, Political Science, Business or other relevant Degree 
Comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions 
Able to communicate effectively (both written and verbal) with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions.  
Able to demonstrate strong technical proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project) and learn new systems and methodologies 
For the Montreal office, verbal and written communication in French is required. 

 
Ottawa Only: Employees in the Ottawa consulting practice will be required to obtain "reliability" and/or "Secret" level federal security clearances as a condition of their employment. To be eligible for a "Reliability" status you must have resided in Canada for the last five (5) years and for "Secret" level the last ten (10) years. 
 
Our shared values  
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm. 
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte. 
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values: 

Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. 
Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. 
Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. 
Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. 
Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

Job Title: Analyst Intern, Risk Advisory - Winter 2022 or Summer 2022 Co-op/Intern (National)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
Are you ready for a challenge?  Join our Deloitte's Risk Advisory practice for your coop/internship, where you can help our clients' gain a new view of risk. 
 
What will your typical day look like? 
 
There are no typical days! Working in Risk Advisory offers a dynamic, fast-paced environment, which presents you with the opportunity to continually grow and learn from people with different backgrounds and workings styles. Your days will be filled with impact ? professionally, socially, and personally. Professionally, you will synthesize and communicate complex analyses to senior executives for them to take effective action at their global organizations. Socially, you will work through exciting challenges with peers and colleagues, solving complicated and substantial problems. Personally, you will share your successes and learnings with colleagues that will expand your network and become colleagues for life.
 
About the team 
 
At Deloitte, we believe taking risks is a business imperative. Risk Advisory professionals are advisory specialists that help our clients navigate business risks and opportunities, embrace complexity, accelerate performance and gain competitive advantage
 
As a co-op/intern, you will be aligned to a specific service offering based on the advisory stream of your choosing. The availability of advisory streams and service offerings is dependent on individual business needs and differs per regional office.
Advisory Streams:

Controls and Assurance Advisory (stream available in all offices):

Analysts in this stream have an interest in risk and controls, audit methodologies, business and IT operations, IT risk, analytics and data visualization
Assigned service offering may include: Internal Audit, IT & Specialized Assurance, Extended Enterprise, Digital/AI Controls/Algorithms.


Business Advisory (stream available in Toronto, Calgary, Vancouver, and Montreal offices):

Analysts in this stream have an interest in business operations, facilitation, problem solving, data analysis and data visualization.
Assigned service offering may include: Extended Enterprise, Sustainability, Financial Industry Risk & Regulatory, Crisis and Resilience, Financial Crime.


Technical Advisory (stream available in Toronto office): 

Analysts in this stream have an interest in coding, IT acumen (operating systems/databases/applications), artificial intelligence and machine learning, data analytics and data visualization.
Assigned service offering may include: Digital/AI Controls/Algorithms, Crisis and Resilience, Financial Industry Risk & Regulatory, IT & Specialized Assurance and Internal Audit.



Please note that available service offerings within each advisory stream differ for each region to align to their specific business needs and resourcing requirements. Candidates pursuing their CPA designation should select the Controls and Assurance Advisory stream to obtain experience that will count towards their CPA designation requirements.

Enrolled in a post-secondary degree
An inclusive team player who is passionate and motivated
Excellent communicator and relationship builder
Proficient in spoken and written English; Bilingualism in English and French is required for the Quebec Region
Self-starter and able to conceptualize creative approaches and solutions
Curious and comfortable with ambiguity
Dedicated to providing meaningful service to our clients
Some level of travel may be required

 
Our shared values 
 
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
 
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
 
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
 

Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

 


Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

 


Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

 


Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

 


Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

 
The next step is yours
 
Sound like The One Firm. For You?   

To be considered, you must submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF document to https://career8.successfactors.com/sfcareer/jobreqcareer?jobId=78769&company=CADeloitte

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Title: Accountant, Accounting Services Group - Winter 2022 Co-op/Intern - Ontario
Job Summary:
Our Purpose

  

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization. 

  

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters. 

  

Are you a current student looking to pursue either a Coop term or Internship- At Deloitte, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of clients, while leveraging a diverse and powerful network to solve our clients' most pressing concerns and complex challenges. 

  

  

What will your typical day look like? 

 
 

Preparation of compilation engagements including preparation of financial statements, working papers and supporting schedules
Performing tax compliance work, such as personal income tax returns (T1, corporate income tax returns (T2), Trust returns (T3), T4, and T5
Completing other duties, as required

  

Your role as junior staff member at Deloitte: 

 
 

Learn Deloitte's audit & assurance innovations and methodology - you're not just reading numbers, you're understanding them.
Interact and develop global and cross-service line relationships at every level - build a network that lasts a lifetime.
Engrain yourself in a culture that fosters excellence - a place for you to learn, to grow, to create, to lead.
Understand the what, how, and why of change - always be ready to act ahead.
Explore the world with our clients - help them connect the dots.

  

With this said, no two days are the same.  Our clients evolve and so do we.
Job Responsibilities:
About the team

  

Deloitte's Accounting Services Hub has the feel of a small firm, but has all the advantages of being part of one of Canada's leading professional services firms. Our clients range in size and include some of Canada's top private companies. 

  

Co-op & Intern students interested in pursuing their CPA designation are key members from day one. They are responsible for creating and nurturing positive relationships with key client contacts at every level. We know that we perform better when we connect with our clients. 

  

Within your service areas, you will work with strategic team members to develop an understanding of the firm's business and the clients that you are serving. You will support organizations in different industries of all sizes to help them perform better and adapt to an ever-evolving future.

Working towards the completion of an undergraduate degree and pre-requisites for entry into the CPA Professional Education Program. You also have the intention to pursue a CPA designation.

Experience with MS office suite

The Assurance practice's value statement, or more simply, the reason we exist, is to "Build and elevate trust to help create a more resilient and sustainable tomorrow." Our Assurance team focuses on enabling CFOs and their Finance teams for success. Our core services include new standards implementation services, accounting framework conversion, securities offering services, IPO readiness, accounting and reporting for transactions, CFO / Finance Effectiveness Workshops, Finance Operating Model Assessments, Finance Process Mapping / Redesign, and "Fix Finance" projects (designed to remediate or upgrade finance processes, controls, documentation, systems and tools), and  Technology Advisory. We are looking for professionals with strong problem solving skills (diagnostic and solution development), a breadth of knowledge with respect to the operational aspects of financial reporting and strong facilitation skills.

Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

Are you ready to launch your career in a fast-growing and challenging environment with like-minded people? We are looking for sharp minds to join our growing team, offering you the opportunity to implement economic theory in an advisory context while providing value to our clients.
 
What will your typical day look like?
 
The successful candidate will provide research, analytic, modelling and writing support to the Deloitte Economics team for client proposals, reports and various other Deloitte Economics publications and initiatives. 
 
Key responsibilities will include:

Supporting the execution of economic advisory engagements by conducting research, quantitative analysis, modelling, and drafting reports

Economic impact analysis, cost-benefit analysis and business case development
Economic development and investment attraction strategy
Economic and socio-economic market research and analysis
Industry / sector profiling, analysis and strategy
Policy analysis and strategy

 
Permanent Analysts within Financial Advisory join our two-year Quick Start development program.  Through Quick Start, analysts receive up-front training covering key topics from across our Financial Advisory practice, including advisory and technical skills, quality/risk processes, engagement lifecycle, and project management principles.  Once the training is complete, our analysts are deployed on client engagements, proposals, and strategic initiatives.  A CPA stream is available for analysts who need to obtain working hours for their designation.

Job Title: Analyst Intern, eDiscovery, Financial Advisory - Winter 2022 (Toronto)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
The Discovery team is a leading provider of electronic discovery services in Canada and provides end-to-end solutions to clients. Join us to challenge yourself by being part of domestic and international investigations!
 
What will your typical day look like? 
 
Computer Forensics engagements include complex domestic and international investigations pertaining to litigation, corporate fraud, class action lawsuits and regulatory matters, to name but a few. On a typical day, you will be working closely with Discovery Forensics team in a support role that includes:
 

Data collection and preservation,
Recovering and analyzing electronically stored information,
Support digital evidence preservation, chain of custody protocols and forensic analysis,
Maintaining case management systems and workflows,
Preparing and packaging data for eDiscovery production to clients,
Compiling, normalizing and analyzing electronic data for investigation and litigation purposes.
Ongoing communication of results and work product to team members for review.
Job Responsibilities:
About the team 
 
With the proliferation of electronic data, companies are finding it increasingly difficult to identify the documents required to comply with regulatory requests, conduct investigations or resolve business disputes. As a leading provider of electronic discovery services in Canada, the Discovery team offers a full end-to-end solution for clients, from the collection, through document review, to the final production of documents.
 
We work on a variety of matters, including:

Civil litigation
Class actions
Competition Bureau inquiries, including responses to Requests For Information (RFI) and Supplemental Information Requests (SIR)
Diligence
Freedom of Information Requests for government and quasi-governmental organizations
Fraud investigations and misappropriations of funds
Technology abuse contravening internal companies acceptable use policies
Cyber-crime investigation
Cyber-breach of network systems internal and external

 
Permanent Analysts within Financial Advisory join our two-year Quick Start development program.  Through Quick Start, analysts receive up-front training covering key topics from across our Financial Advisory practice, including advisory and technical skills, quality/risk processes, engagement lifecycle, and project management principles.  Once the training is complete, our analysts are deployed on client engagements, proposals, and strategic initiatives.  A CPA stream is available for analysts who need to obtain working hours for their designation.

The objective of our Quick Start program is to provide analysts with exposure to a broad range of engagements, projects, and initiatives from across all service lines within our Financial Advisory practice.  By developing core skills across multiple dimensions, the program aims to assist our analysts in building their careers as future advisors and agile leaders.

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in any of the following disciplines (or equivalent): Computer science, Information technology, Information systems, Business Intelligence, Computer security and investigations, Cyber Fraud or Cyber Investigations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (French would be an asset).
Excellent customer service demeanor in a professional environment
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team
The ability to elaborate innovative solutions and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Summary:
Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.



 


Are you up for the challenge of leading at every level, developing a global network of colleagues, and embracing endless opportunity? Join the Tax and Legal Practice at Deloitte.





About the team


You will be a part of the world's largest professional services network working to provide clients with the confidence to make good decisions in a rapidly changing environment and to create the future of Tax & Legal. Tax & Legal is the most global of all Deloitte businesses and recognized as one of the leaders in our industry by the top reporting and ranking agencies and as one of the best places to work. 
At Deloitte, your career path is flexible. You will support organizations of all sizes and in different industries to help them structure business transactions and perform better. Your initial role will provide you with a variety of experience in many aspects of the Tax practice:

Business Tax (Private & Corporate Tax): Our Private Services include entity income tax planning and compliance services, individual tax and wealth planning matters, and family offices. We specialize in assisting small to mid?sized businesses with their expansion and succession plans. Our Corporate Tax offerings deliver a comprehensive, practical approach to tax planning that helps multinational businesses meet their worldwide tax and statutory responsibilities.
International Tax: Provides Consulting and Planning Services, Business structuring and financing in Canada as well as abroad. Assist clients with structuring and financing of their foreign operations. 
US Tax: Focuses on providing advisory and compliance services to our clients to achieve their various U.S. corporate tax compliance obligations. They need advice from experts who understand U.S. federal and state taxation laws and their interaction with Canadian tax principles.
Global employer services: Global workplace and unilateral actions of various jurisdictions working to fast track their sovereign objectives has brought risk sensitivity for both employers and employees. We help guide our clients through a myriad of complex tax and regulatory laws.
Global Investment & innovation incentives (GI3): Our Gi3 team supports clients in deciphering what has become an elaborate system of financial incentives aimed at fueling companies' innovation, hiring, expansion, and sustainability investments. These incentives often cover many industry sectors and require a mix of financial reporting, cost accounting, regulatory and tax framework interpretation, and technical documentation in order to be successfully accessed.
Job Responsibilities:
What will your typical day look like?


In your role as a Tax Analyst at Deloitte you will:

Develop experience in a broad range of fully integrated tax service lines
Team in an open, creative, dynamic, collaborative environment, where leaders listen and good ideas are welcomed
Work in a flexible and friendly setting
Engrain yourself in a culture that fosters excellence ? a place for you to learn, to grow, to create, to lead
Learn on the job, online and in the classroom and from professionals and inspiring leaders

With this said, no two days are the same. Our clients evolve and so do we.
Required Skills:
Enough about us, let's talk about you


In this role, the expected qualifications are:

Working towards completing a post?secondary degree or diploma and pre?requisites for entry into the CPA Professional Education Program. You also have the intention to pursue a CPA designation.
Demonstrated leader, who takes initiative in and out of the work environment by having strong interpersonal and team?building skills
Analytical and problem?solving skills
Outstanding communication skills, flexibility, humility, integrity and professionalism
Experience with MS office suite

Job Title: Analyst, Financial Crime, Risk Advisory - Winter 2022 (Toronto)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
If you're ready to help tackle the complex and ever-changing world of financial crimes prevention in Canadian, it's time to join Deloitte's fast-growing Financial Crime practice and make a difference.   
 
What will your typical day look like? 
 
No two days are the same within this group, but some of the key duties and responsibilities of this role will include assisting in different areas of project management, including client engagements and internal initiatives, delivering high quality engagements and working collaboratively to analyze clients issues and prepare/participate in client presentations.

You will be part of a diverse cross functional team that works on policy, controls as well as process and data improvements and a variety of analytical techniques to prevent, detect and investigate financial crimes.
Job Responsibilities:
About the team 
 
Deloitte helps our clients to protect their brand and reputation by proactively advising on their exposure to fraud, corruption, and other financial crime issues. Drawing on our global network of seasoned financial crime experts, intelligence analysts, technologists and advanced analytics, we can quickly and efficiently gain an understanding of our clients' various Financial Crime exposures. We provide expert advice and solutions to address our clients Financial Crime Management needs across the organization from strategy, implementation, to remediation.

Ability to develop and present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions

Exceptionally organized with a strong team and work ethic, comfortable with change and challenge
Demonstrated  strong  project problem diagnosis, keen attention to detail, high level of proficiency with all Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint,),  excellent communication skills.

Job Title: Analyst, Cyber Intelligence Centre - Winter 2022 Intern/Co-op (National)
Job Summary:
Our Purpose
 
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
 
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
 
Deloitte is on a mission to build smarter, faster, and more connected futures through the management of cyber risk. Are you in? 
 
What will your typical day look like? 
 
As a member of our Cyber Intelligence Centre, you will interact with clients both locally and globally to assist with managing their cyber risk profile. You should be comfortable managing timelines; be able to travel (on occasion); following established methodologies; and creating clear and concise deliverables.  Other responsibilities may include but not limited to:

Supporting the team on security/controls and risk management solution development and system integration
Supporting the group in identifying risks and controls within business and IT processes for various initiatives
Performing security related technical implementation-based activities on systems implementation projects
Assisting with the development of security strategies, policies and standards
Researching and resolving complex issues and developing innovative solutions for clients
Job Responsibilities:
About the team 
 
There are various work activities in different industry sectors available in Deloitte's Cyber Intelligence Centre Managed Security Services portfolio such as, but not limited to:
 

Security Operations. Possess strong security analytical/technical skills, a deep interest in information security and knowledge of current/evolving cyber security threats and trends, security technologies, security operations processes, incident management.
Security Systems and Engineering. Focus on service design, transition, operation of the platforms/controls. Understand IT risks and business implications, identify weaknesses and recommend solutions. Knowledge of systems administration, technical controls, service management with strong troubleshooting experience in Enterprise production IT environments.
Security Reporting. Generate precise, error-free recurring operational threat condition reporting to meet client requirements.
Cyber Threat Intelligence. Deep interest in open source research, investigative and analytical problem solving skills to pro-actively detect malicious behaviour using intelligence from multiple feeds to provide real-time monitoring and gather information on vulnerabilities/exploits related to the client.

 
Within Cyber Security, there are different personas that exist, and you may be able to identify yourself with one or multiple of these personas. To gain more information about this, please navigate to Deloitte's report on "The changing faces of cybersecurity".

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in an appropriate field
Able to obtain Government of Canada Secret level security clearance
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions.
An effective verbal and written communicator with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions.
Able to travel within Canada and occasionally internationally.

Job Title: Financial Analyst - Controllership - Financial Accounting - Co-op/Intern Winter 2022 - Toronto
Job Summary:
Our Purpose

  

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.   

  

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.   

  

What will your typical day look like  

  

This incumbent will assist with Deloitte's finance and controllership activities and financial reporting at each period end.  The Controllership team is pre-approved training office for CPA students who are enrolled in the program to obtain practical experience as part of obtaining their CPA designations. Some of the tasks will be to prepare financial statements and documentation, prepare journal entries and reconciliations, design and test controls, provide compliance projects support, access/process control, work in Blackline reconciliation tool to implement new modules and design new process, and provide a future focused outlook to identify issues and opportunities for improvement in the reporting process.   

  

About the team    

  

Deloitte is one of Canada's leading professional services firms, providing audit, tax, consulting and financial advisory services across Canada. At Deloitte, we combine industry insight with a deep understanding of today's local and global business challenges to give our clients the intelligent, practical and principled solutions they need to resolve both today's and tomorrow's challenges.  

  

Enough about us, let's talk about you  

  

In this role, the expected qualifications are:  
 

Working towards completing a post-secondary degree or diploma in accounting / business / commerce 
Proficiency in Microsoft Suite of Office Products (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Excel proficiency, functions and working with large volumes of data  
Ability to draw insights from information and convey complex information in a straightforward manner 
Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize work in a demanding environment  

  

Our shared values

  

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.   

  

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.   

  

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:   

  

Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.   

  

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.   

  

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.   

  

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.   

  

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.   

  

The next step is yours  
 
Sound like The One Firm. For You
 


  

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.   

  

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!   

  

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.   


Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Summary:
Unfair Investing - Delphia is a new kind of investment company that turns your data into an unfair investment advantage. We predict which companies, brands and trends are headed in the right direction, so that we can invest in them before others catch on. Together, this lets us earn you the returns you deserve. We are building a new kind of company that re-thinks the value of privacy, data rights, and fiduciary responsibility in order to ensure your data is always working for you - just like your money. Whether we're educating you on how your data can be used to make better investment decisions, or identifying future trends, people at Delphia are socially-minded creatives at heart. 


Our teams are continually iterating, solving hard problems, and collaborating to generate new forms of value and economic returns for our users (we call them "members", in fact). Working together, we want people to realize the true value of their data - and we're just getting started. Delphia is a growing (~32 people), multi-disciplinary team located in the heart of downtown Toronto. We began in January 2018 and are graduates of Y Combinator (SF) and the Creative Destruction Lab (Toronto). In 2018 we raised a Seed round (led by Lerer Hippeau & Golden Ventures) as well as a Series A (led by Real Ventures) in 2019.

Job Summary: Delta Elevator Company Ltd is a Canadian company that designs, manufacturers and installs Electric and Hydraulic Elevator and Handicapped Lift systems in Ontario.  The successful applicant will be part of the Mechanical Engineering department working with the Engineers and Technologists on current and future lift installations.  Since Engineering and Manufacturing are in the same location, the student will have the opportunity to see and work with the finished design parts throughout the work term.  Delta also provides opportunities to visit existing and in-construction sites for additonal learning and assessment of designed parts.
Job Responsibilities:
Reporting to the VP Supervising Engineer, you will be responsible for:
 

Designing components and all related drawings and specifications to enable Delta's manufacturing to produce both prototypes and field installed equipment.
Creating and updating AutoDesk Inventor 3D Models and Autocad drawings, details and standards for both the Elevator and Handicapped Product lines.
Producing approval documents and specifications for Delta's standard products and custom designs as required.
Assisting the mechanical engineers and technologists (e.g. schedules, spreadsheets, etc.)
Creating and update procedures/methods/ instructions for manufacturing, in accordance with the requirements of internal and external customers

Other project related/daily activities may be assigned depending on ability and production circumstances.
Required Skills:
This position offers you the opportunity to gain design experience in the unique industry of elevating equipment. You will be exposed to hydraulic design, formed and structural beam analysis (using Inventor and/or ANSYS FEA software), manufacturing techniques of laser cutting, punch press manufacturing, sheet metal forming, welding and assembly at a minimum. 


We are looking for an individual with an interest in design. You must have proficiency with 3D Parametric Design and Modelling and additional experience with AutoCAD is preferred. Knowledge of materials, fasteners and some welding is desirable, but this knowledge can be learned on the job. Experience with basic beam stress design principles and forming is an asset.   


Delta Elevator Co Ltd also uses MS Office products and familiarity with Excel, Word, and Outlook etc. is required.  Delta also uses an in-house designed ERP system that will be taught during the work term.

Job Summary:
The Global R&D Software Organization within Dematic is responsible for delivering standard software products to support a wide range of conveyor and sortation solutions, warehouse automation, and distribution operations. Dematic has distributed development teams across multiple locations in Germany and the US, as well as Waterloo.
This is an exciting opportunity to join our Centre of Excellence for Dematic Virtual Facility development team in Waterloo. We are building a software platform that is used both internally and externally by Dematic to virtually substantiate the physical warehouses. You will have hands-on responsibility for helping define the services and functionality to allow our platform customers to deliver the ultimate experience within their applications.
You will have the opportunity to work with bright minds to create applications to meet our customer needs.  You will be hands on in all aspects of the development cycle and will get to see directly how your efforts directly influences the customer's experience.
You must have a passion for understanding customers, coming up with innovative ideas, and working collaboratively with other talented people to turn those ideas into products.

Job Summary:
The Data, Innovation, Analytics (DIA) organization has the mission to provide the Department of National Defence (DND) and the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) with the expertise required to make data-driven and evidence-based decisions. A major part of our mandate is to provide strategic leadership, governance and guidance to successfully transition DND/CAF to a modern digital organization operating as a more agile and innovative enterprise, through data integration and analytics support. 

  

The Data Science Directorate at DIA works at the cutting edge of the organization's mission. Tackling problems that carry the potential for large-scale impact across the department, our team employs a data science accelerator approach, linking together mathematicians and statisticians with data scientists and machine learning specialists along with computer scientists and developers. If you are excited about joining a multi-disciplinary team to tackle real-world problems affecting DND, the largest department in the Government of Canada, then you have found the right team! 


--- 


L'organisation Data, Innovation, Analytiques (DIA) a pour mission de fournir au ministère de la Défense nationale (MDN) et aux Forces armées canadiennes (FAC) l'expertise nécessaire pour prendre des décisions fondées sur des données et des preuves. Une grande partie de notre mandat consiste à fournir un leadership stratégique, une gouvernance et une orientation pour réussir la transition du MDN et des FAC vers une organisation numérique moderne fonctionnant comme une entreprise plus agile et plus innovante, grâce à l'intégration des données et au soutien analytique. 

  

L'équipe de la science des données de la DIA travaille à la pointe de la mission de l'organisation. S'attaquant à des problèmes susceptibles d'avoir un impact à grande échelle dans tout le ministère, notre équipe utilise une approche d'accélérateur de la science des données, en mettant en relation des mathématiciens et des statisticiens avec des spécialistes des données et de l'apprentissage automatique ainsi qu'avec des informaticiens et des développeurs. Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de rejoindre une équipe pluridisciplinaire pour vous attaquer à des problèmes réels qui touchent le Ministère de la Défense nationale, le plus grand ministère du gouvernement du Canada, alors vous avez trouvé la bonne équipe !
Required Skills:

The candidate must meet each essential qualification. 

  

Due to the timeline required for security clearance processing, we are only able to consider candidates who are Canadian citizens or Permanent Residents.

- Currently enrolled in 3rd year or above (as of September 2021) or having completed a relevant undergraduate degree program (mathematics and statistics, computer science, engineering or other relevant field). 

- Enrolled in a validated post-secondary co-op/internship program (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/recruitment/students/coop-internship.html) 

  

Experience: 

- Have recent experience working with open-source data science software and techniques (Python or R) 

- Effective oral and written communication skills (written reports, presentations to specialist and general audiences)

Candidates may be assessed based on the following qualifications. 

  

Education: 

-  Currently enrolled (as of September 2021) in a relevant graduate degree program (mathematics and statistics, computer science, engineering or other relevant field). 

  

Experience:

- Experience working with Natural Language Processing (NLP) frameworks and models 


--- 


Qualifications essentielles : 

  

Le candidat doit satisfaire à chacune des qualifications essentielles. 

  

En raison des délais existants pour le processus d'attestation de sécurité, nous recherchons des candidats qui sont des citoyens canadiens ou résidents permanents.

- Actuellement inscrit dans la troisième année ou plus (à partir de septembre 2021) ou ayant complété un programme de premier cycle pertinent (mathématiques et statistiques, informatique, ingénierie ou autre domaines pertinents). 

- Inscrit dans un programme co-op / stage validé.

Job Summary:
The Data, Innovation, Analytics (DIA) organization has the mission to provide the Department of National Defence (DND) and the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) with the expertise required to make data-driven and evidence-based decisions. A major part of our mandate is to provide strategic leadership, governance and guidance to successfully transition DND/CAF to a modern digital organization operating as a more agile and innovative enterprise, through data integration and analytics support. 

  

The Data Science Directorate at DIA works at the cutting edge of the organization's mission. Tackling problems that carry the potential for large-scale impact across the department, our team employs a data science accelerator approach, linking together mathematicians and statisticians with data scientists and machine learning specialists along with computer scientists and developers. If you are excited about joining a multi-disciplinary team to tackle real-world problems affecting DND, the largest department in the Government of Canada, then you have found the right team! 

  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

  

L'organisation de Données, Innovation, Analytiques (DIA) a pour mission de fournir au ministère de la Défense nationale (MDN) et aux Forces armées canadiennes (FAC) l'expertise nécessaire pour prendre des décisions fondées sur des données et des preuves. Une grande partie de notre mandat consiste à fournir un leadership stratégique, une gouvernance et une orientation pour réussir la transition du MDN et des FAC vers une organisation numérique moderne fonctionnant comme une entreprise plus agile et plus innovante, grâce à l'intégration des données et au soutien analytique. 

  

L'équipe d'analytiques avancées de la DIA travaille à la pointe de la mission de l'organisation. S'attaquant à des problèmes susceptibles d'avoir un impact à grande échelle dans tout le ministère, notre équipe utilise une approche d'accélérateur de la science des données, en mettant en relation des mathématiciens et des statisticiens avec des spécialistes des données et de l'apprentissage automatique ainsi qu'avec des informaticiens et des développeurs. 

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de rejoindre une équipe pluridisciplinaire pour vous attaquer à des problèmes réels qui touchent le Ministère de la Défense Nationale, le plus grand ministère du gouvernement du Canada, alors vous avez trouvé la bonne équipe !
Job Responsibilities:
We are currently seeking a DataOps engineer. 

  

Why This Job is Right for You: 

You will contribute to meaningful projects for use across DND and the CAF to make data-driven and evidence-based decisions. 

You will assist data scientists with taking their models from development to production, using containerization and other cloud-native technologies. 

You will support data scientists by provisioning and maintaining cloud resources for advanced analytics and artificial intelligence (AI) experimentation. 

You will learn DevOps best practices to implement a scalable data science operation, such as by implementing a continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline. 

You will contribute data engineering expertise to advanced analytics projects. 

  

Additional Benefits: 

You will be eligible to complete an additional work term with us as a casual employee, paid at the same rate as full-time employees. Subject to position availability (ask us about "casual work terms" for more details). 

You will be eligible for full-time hiring opportunities throughout the public service that are only available to former co-op students (ask us about "student bridging" for more details). 

  

Given the uncertainty regarding COVID-19, successful candidates should expect to work remotely for the duration of their co-op term. Depending on how the situation evolves, a hybrid (in office and remote) work schedule may be possible. 


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 


Nous recherchons actuellement un(e) ingénieur(e) DataOps.  

  

Pourquoi ce poste vous convient : 

Vous contribuerez à des projets significatifs utilisés par le MDN et les FAC pour prendre des décisions fondées sur les données et des preuves scientifiques.  

Vous aiderez les scientifiques des données à amender leurs modèles du stade développement à la production, en utilisant la conteneurisation et d'autres technologies originaire du nuage informatique (Cloud).  

Vous soutiendrez les scientifiques des données à travers l'approvisionnement et la gestion des ressources infonuagique (Cloud) pour des analyses avancées et à l'expérimentation d'intelligence artificielle (IA).   

Vous apprendrez les meilleures pratiques de l'industrie pour les applications DevOps afin de mettre en œuvre une opération scientifique de données évolutives, par exemple l'intégration continue et la livraison continue d'un pipeline. 

Vous contribuerez au progrès de l'expertise en ingénierie des données dans des projets d'analyses avancées. 

  

Avantages supplémentaires : 

Vous serez éligible à être embaucher pour un stage supplémentaire à titre d'employés occasionnels, payés au même taux que des employées à temps plein. Sujet à la disponibilité des postes (demandez nous pour plus de détails concernant ces emplois).  

Vous allez avoir une possibilité d'être embaucher au sein de la fonction publique en utilisant des opportunités seulement disponible aux étudiants qui ont compléter un stage avec le Gouvernement du Canada (demandez nous pour plus de détails concernant l'intégration des étudiants).

Division: Defence Research and Development Canada - Toronto
Job Summary:
Web Application Developer


Defence Research & Development Canada (DRDC) - Toronto Research Centre is seeking a student with strong programming skills and experience with web development (including API and database) to continue development of a web-based application. The web application supports Department of National Defence (DND) research and acquisition capabilities and allows users to interactively visualize and analyse anthropometric data using the following components: SQL server database, application server using R (for data processing), NodeJS with Angular (for application functionality), and .NET Core for the middle layer API.  The student will continue the development of this application's capability independently as the primary programmer with support from a team of Human Factors experts. Due to the current COVID-19 situation, the student will be asked to and is expected to work remotely. 


Defence Research & Development Canada (DRDC) - Toronto Research Centre is Canada's centre of expertise for defence research and development in human-systems integration, individual readiness, and socio-cognitive systems research.  One of our strengths is our broad-based and multidisciplinary approach to research.  DRDC - Toronto Research Centre is one of nine research centres in Defence R&D Canada (DRDC), an agency of Canada's Department of National Defence. 

  

We are looking for an industrious student to join our team.  Security clearance is required. Preference in hiring is given to Canadian citizens. We prefer those who meet the qualifications of relevant courses and experience as well as excellent academic achievement. We are an equal opportunity employer and promote a harassment/smoke free working environment.  For examples of recent research and development activities conducted at the DRDC, refer to our web page at http://www.drdc-rddc.gc.ca. Twitter: @DRDC_RDDC. 

  

Please note that as a federal government agency, students who work with us on an approved co-op/intern or FSWEP program are eligible to be offered a temporary or permanent position within 18 months of graduation.
Job Responsibilities:
Software development for the web-based application using the following components:
	 
  
SQL server database, application server using R (for data processing), NodeJS with Angular (for application functionality), and .NET Core for the middle layer API.


The candidate will be expected to conduct testing, fix issues revealed in the tests, and expand the functionalities of the tool as needed.
Weekly informal project updates will be expected, a formal final documentation will be required at the end of the term.
Required Skills:
C# programming skills are required for this position.
Working knowledge of .NET Core Framework, Angular, and SQL
Experience with R and server machines would be an asset.
Ability to communicate effectively with colleagues and non-technical personnel (oral and written)

Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering

				MATH - Computer Science

Division: Defence Research and Development Canada - Toronto
Job Summary:
Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) is the research arm of the Department of National Defence (DND). We perform strategic science research and technology development, and provide advice and technical solutions to the Canadian Armed Forces, as well as the public safety and national security communities.  DRDC - Toronto Research Centre is a centre of excellence for intelligence, influence, and collaboration; human effectiveness; operational health and performance.  One of our strengths is our broad-based and multidisciplinary approach to research.  Located adjacent to the Sheppard West Subway Station in Toronto, we are easily reached by car or TTC. 

  

We are looking for an industrious student with an interest in biomedical research and development to join our team for an 8-month term starting in January 2022.  Security clearance is required. Preference will be given to Canadian citizens before non-Canadian citizens - any qualified Canadian citizen will be made an offer before any non-Canadian citizen. We prefer those who meet the qualifications of relevant courses and experience as well as excellent academic achievement.  We are an equal opportunity employer and promote a harassment/smoke-free working environment.  For examples of recent research and development activities conducted at the Centre, see our web page at http://www.drdc-rddc.gc.ca. Twitter: @DRDC_RDDC.
Job Responsibilities: The student will be working on projects investigating combat casualty care, and medical interventions in a cold environment. Specifically, the student will be involved in the development of transfusion algorithms and hemostatic agents for trauma care, investigation of dried blood products for remote hemostatic resuscitation, evaluation of hemorrhage tolerance and control in the cold, diagnostics and treatment of trauma coagulopathy and bleeding, and analysis of biological samples and data. The student will also conduct literature reviews, laboratory and human experiments, and analyze experimental and clinical data using statistics and machine learning tools.  The student will prepare written progress reports and give presentations for project meetings.
Required Skills: Knowledge and skills in computer programming, biomedical sciences and technologies are required. Familiarity with artificial intelligence, machine learning, biomedical materials and instruments, and biochemical analysis is valued.  Experience in mathematical modeling, processing, and analyzing biological samples (e.g., human blood, plasma) is an asset.

Job Summary: The Mapping and Charting Establishment (MCE) is the Department of National Defence's (DND's) primary organization for managing and creating geospatial data in support of military requirements and directly contributing to other government departments. The MCE workforce is a roughly even mix of military and civilian employees. Located at 615 Booth Street, directly beside Dow's Lake, the MCE is in a scenic location. Parking is very limited but several bus lines pass nearby. Between March and July, the entire organization is planned to relocate to 101 Goldenrod Drive which also has limited parking; but it is very well connected to transit as it is located a few minutes' walk from Tunney's Pasture transit station. Work location may change during the term from Booth to Tunney's. This position will require applicants to relocate to Ottawa, as there will be a combination of work from home, and work in the office. Due to the nature of the work, this is unavoidable.
Job Responsibilities: Working in the headquarters of MCE, the Communications and Graphic Design Officer will use software tools and artistic talent to enhance the visual appeal and clarity of various communications products. Some will be highly standardized with rigid templates requiring technical aptitude, but others will be unstructured problems requiring a creative approach within the boundaries set by the organizational culture and norms.
Required Skills:
Job requirements: 

  

The following essential qualifications are required for this position: 

-Experience in graphic design; 

-Excellent communication (verbal and written skills) 

-Time-management, deadline-oriented 

-Experience in working with cross-functional teams 

-Ability to prioritize and manage expectations, as well as being able to take initiative; 

-Ability to conform to imposed standards 

-Demonstrated ability to create and maintain a consistent and audience-appropriate standard of graphic design across web, print and multi-media materials 

- Ability to relocate to Ottawa to work in-person

  

The following asset qualifications are valuable to this position: 

-Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Corel Draw, Photoshop, InDesign and printing process 

-Experience working or studying from home 

-Military experience, including cadets; or Public service experience. 

  

  

In accordance with Section 39(1) of the Public Service Employment Act, priority for hiring will be given to Canadian citizens.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Digital and Graphic Media; Web Site Design and Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Fine and Performing Arts

Job Summary:
The Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) is powered by great people who provide security for Canada and help shape the world. With over 14,000 members and 250 aircraft of all types, the RCAF is responsible for all aircraft operations of the Canadian Armed Forces, enforcing the security and sovereignty of Canada's airspace and supporting the Royal Canadian Navy and Canadian Army. 


Every day the RCAF operates all over the world to support domestic and internationals operations. The RCAF is constantly reinventing itself to be able to meet the challenges of tomorrow. The recent creation of an Innovation Lab at Communitech is a perfect opportunity for the RCAF to connect with a thriving ecosystem and do just that. 


This job posting pertains to the RCAF Innovation Lab called the RCAF Flight Deck which is located at the Communitech Hub in Kitchener, Ontario. At this lab, you will support the defence of Canada, you will be provided unique learning and development opportunities, and you will work in an open and inclusive environment.
Job Responsibilities:
At the RCAF Flight Deck, you will be given a unique opportunity to develop innovative solutions for the RCAF and work in an open and highly collaborative environment. We have a casual work/dress environment where you can work from a desk, the comfort of a couch and we enjoy keeping everyone wired on coffee. As a member of the RCAF team, you will work in the Communitech Hub alongside other organizations including Interac, TD, Deloitte, Manulife, WSIB, Thomson Reuters, City of Kitchener, Canadian Digital Services, Sonova  and many start-up companies at various stages. 


Every day in the Flight Deck you will work with fellow coop students to brainstorm and develop new ideas into functional solutions. As a Business Development Coordinator, you will have a chance to support RAWC innovation projects and help design a business plan and process to engage industry and start-up relationships. You will have an opportunity to participate in learning workshops, visit RCAF installations and work with various members of the RCAF team during your work term. The RCAF Flight Deck is a fast paced and agile environment that will provide you with a unique experience and several technical opportunities. Discover how the RCAF keeps our country safe and take ownership of business and technical solutions from inception to delivery. 


As a Business Development Coordinator at the Flight Deck, your role will be to assist the Lab Director to help manage all facets of the Innovation Lab activities such as basecamps, industry partnerships and start-up ecosystem engagements. You'll drive innovation through collaboration with other Communitech tenants, start-ups and RCAF staff to determine their requirements and provision the best solutions possible. More precisely, you'll work on projects that aim to empower RCAF members to innovate at the fastest possible pace, to learn best practices from industry partners with common areas of interest and to expose the RCAF to many more local corporate partners and entrepreneurial opportunities, increasing the benefit to the RCAF presence within the Communitech ecosystem. 


If you are a self-starter, like to think outside the box, challenge the status-quo and believe that everything is possible, the RCAF has a job for you!
