Job Summary:
As a full stack developer for The Flight Deck, located at the Communitech Hub, you'll be responsible for delivering impactful solutions using the latest web, mobile and data science tech. You and the development team will be at the forefront of innovation within the Royal Canadian Air Force with thousands of users at your disposal. We use fast-paced iteration to deliver prototypes and get feedback as early as possible, with the goal being to produce the most value in a short time frame. 


If you are a self-starter, like to think outside the box, challenge the status-quo and believe that everything is possible, the RCAF has a job for you!
Job Responsibilities:
During your 4 month term you will lead the development of a new software service from ideation to production usage. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of the project including: customer discovery, prototyping, development and operations. 


Each day you will work closely with the other co-ops, with support from the technical lead and military staff, to deliver a meaningful business impact to our air force.  


Full Stack Developer Responsibilities: 
• Managing the complete software development process from conception to deployment. 
• Managing your products CI/CD pipeline. 
• Developing front end website architecture. 
• Designing user interactions on web pages. 
• Developing back-end applications. 
• Creating servers and databases for functionality. 
• Ensuring cross-platform optimization. 
• Ensuring responsiveness of applications. 
• Designing and developing APIs. 
• Discovering and meeting both technical and customer needs. 
• Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.
Required Skills:
Primary Requirements 

• Strong organizational and project management skills. 

• Proficiency with Git and GitHub, including GitHub Issues and Actions. 

• Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. 

• Familiarity with front end frameworks such as Angular, React, and VueJS. 

• Proficiency with server-side languages such as Java, Go, C#, Python, and Ruby. 

• Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL, SQLServer, Oracle, and MongoDB. 

• Design ability: Including knowledge of UI/UX and basic prototype design. 

• Excellent verbal communication skills. 

• Good problem-solving skills. 

• Attention to detail. 


Desirable qualifications 

• Previous experience in start-up environment 

• Experience shipping a product from inception to production 

• Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud 

• Server experience working with Nginx or Apache servers with a solid background in Linux. 

• Experience with Containers such as Docker, Cri-o, and Containerd 

• Experience with UX/UI design methodologies 

• Experience with hybrid / native mobile application development (Cordova, Flutter, React Native) 

• Experience with machine learning platform (Anaconda, Tensorflow, Keras)   

• Experience with machine learning libraries (OpenCV, Scikit-learn, Pandas)

- Design and implement features from the user interface through to the database

- Proactively refactor legacy code - Contribute to a high-performing team that loves to learn

- Design and operate the development and production cloud environments

- Stay on top of the latest in technology and be excited to explore how new technologies can help our users

Job Summary:
What We're Building

Designware is an editing platform for the creation of apps and websites. This isn't your 

average webpage or e-commerce solution; our mission is to enable easy assembly of fully customized 

digital products and platforms, in a creative workflow free of all coding. It's Photoshop for software applications. 


Your Impact

You will be joining Designware at a pivotal moment in our journey. We're in the wild and keenly focused on improving our product for a waitlist of new users from startups to multinationals who are looking to us to disrupt the limitations of how their software is created. You'll be joining our team full of high performers to contribute and help us build the product that will amaze our customers!
Job Responsibilities:
Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Co-op Developer, you'll get hands-on experience contributing to new Designware features, from design through to production and commercial release. We like to maintain a quick pace with bite-sized features coming out all the time, and you'll be exposed to a variety of experiences for your career development. 


Our goal is to provide a glowing reference for a job well done. To that end, you're a curious self-starter who loves to dive into assigned tasks, and who will ask thoughtful questions when stuck. You have a working knowledge of development and are very comfortable programming; Prior experience with our stack is not necessary, but preferred. Your ongoing goals will include completing sprints on time, releasing polished code to an eager audience, and learning lots from experienced peers led by our CPO along the way. 


To give you an idea of some of the types of tasks you could work on: 

·         

1. Helping to improve our dynamic data interactions between our customers published products and the data streams that they'd like to input/output from/to (involves work with Docker, Kubernetes and Golang) 


2. Introducing new features to help our customer experience level up, i.e.: · A Design Sandbox · Real Time Notifications · Roles and Access Permissions · Analytics (both user facing and internal) · 


3. Key bug-fixes and improvements that help unblock our customers experience. 


If we've described you and the tasks sound like work you'd like to engage in, we won't be the only company interested in your work term. Why us, in a nutshell? Designware is a unique opportunity to work on a ground-breaking Canadian-made SAAS platform available worldwide. Due to economies of scale, we've been able to maintain a relatively small team that delivers big things. Our platform can automate the production of other software, and we believe this to be a game changer worthy of placement on any CV. To recognize the talent required to contribute to this legacy, our co-op salaries are competitive and match your skills and experience.. 


Effective communication skills are needed, both verbal and written, If you are quick to learn and eager to make an impact, this is the placement for you!
Required Skills:
Our Stack

- AWS and DigitalOcean Cloud Services 

- Vue.JS 

- Express.JS 

- PostgreSQL 

- Kubernetes with Docker 


Languages 

- Javascript 

- Golang 

- HTML5 & CSS 

- SQL 


Software Development Tools 

- Bitbucket (Git) 

- JIRA (Weekly Sprints) 

- Confluence

Job Summary:
Desjardins recognizes and draws upon the talent, work, and skills of each one of its employees. We value and respond to the many competing priorities in your lives so you can focus on what you can do best - putting clients first! 
 


Do you want to play an integral role as part of an Insurance Powerhouse? 
 
If so, we are currently looking for: 
 

*Actuarial Co-op/ Intern Students*

We currently have 4 Actuarial Co-op/Intern opportunities available in our Mississauga, Toronto or Calgary* office for the Winter, January to April 2022 term. 
 

(*Seats are available in all offices and we will try to accommodate preferences where possible. Please be prepared to discuss the preferred location.) 
 
  
 
Working arrangements will be provided in the event the COVID-19 pandemic situation continues. While this is an unprecedented time, we still ensure our co-ops make the most of their terms and grow their network in the insurance industry. We hold bi-weekly virtual group meetings so co-ops can meet other actuarial team members and fellow co-op students in an informal setting to play games, ask for advice, or simply hangout. 
 
  
 
In addition to a competitive salary, Desjardins is also offering a $1500 scholarship to co-ops with exceptional performance 
 

Desjardins is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Desjardins encourages applications from all qualified individuals and provides reasonable and appropriate accommodations during the recruitment and selection process as needed.
Job Responsibilities:
What you can expect to do:

Provide support to the Property and Casualty Actuarial Department including assisting in rate analysis, cost benefit analysis, research and modelling, reserving, and other analysis supporting key business partners such as marketing, business development, claims, underwriting etc.
Assist with the management of the actuarial databases.
Assist with the regular production of internal reports on product/market results, auto and property quote success rates, market position, renewal/lapse experience, and net profit margin.
Each student will be responsible for working on one or more projects independently.

Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in either Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Science
Knowledge of Property and Casualty insurance is an asset
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Eager to learn and be a team player
Analytical person capable of taking initiative
Strong problem-solving skills
Knowledge of MS Office Software (Excel, Word, Access)
Knowledge of SAS is an asset
Completion of 1 or more SOA/CAS exams is an asset

6835 Railway Street SE, Calgary 


Your talent is what moves us forward! Did you know that Desjardins is recognized as one of Canada's top 100 Employers and one of Financial Post's 10 Best Companies to work for? Job Summary:
DG Volo & Company delivers transformative growth strategies to private equity portfolio companies seeking breakthrough performance.  We specialize in driving measurable results by providing focused commercial strategy support at all stages of the investment lifecycle.  Our client engagements are typically 8-10 weeks in duration, generating positive economic returns within 6-18 months of project completion. 


While we seek to deliver transformative growth to our clients, DG Volo & Company also aims to create that same growth for our staff. We strive to create a highly ambitious and entrepreneurial working environment where you gain experience and knowledge faster than the conventional corporate environment (or "Pathway"). Our staff desire to see themselves in a management role, be self-directed in their work efforts, and thrive in a fast-paced work environment. As well, with a growing team, to foster a corporate culture that supports individualism, creativity, and enjoying the time spent with each other. 


Role Summary: 


The primary role of the Analyst is to contribute high quality research and analysis in support of client case work.  While the role is demanding in the volume and intensity of effort required, it also provides significant opportunities for professional growth.  Skills development is primarily accomplished with "on-the-job" training, through direct interaction with other members of the DGV advisory team. 

  

The Analyst position is an entry-level role, designed to expose individuals to the key commercial drivers of business performance across a broad range of B2B products and services companies.  Analysts work collaboratively with Associates, so that the Analyst can develop project management skills and take on progressively more and more responsibility for planning and delivering client case work.  In this way, the Analyst role is essentially an apprenticeship program for future Associates within the firm.

Job Summary:
ABOUT DIGITAL EXTREMES


Founded in 1993 by James Schmalz, Digital Extremes ranks as one of the world's top independent video game development studios. Originating with the co-creation of Epic Games' multi-million unit selling Unreal® franchise including Unreal and Unreal Tournament, Digital Extremes went on to develop Dark Sector®, BioShock® for the PlayStation®3, the BioShock 2 multiplayer campaign, and The Darkness® II. The studio has reached its greatest critical and commercial success with the free-to-play action game, Warframe®, boasting a global community of 50 million registered players on PC, PS4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch. For more information about Digital Extremes, visit www.digitalextremes.com. To sign up for Warframe, visit www.warframe.com. 


WHY WORK AT DIGITAL EXTREMES


Our culture is centered on providing great opportunities to our employees so that everyone feels they are making a meaningful impact. Developing new and existing talent is our long-term focus. We are honored that our work environment has been consistently recognized as one of "Canada's Top 100 Employers". We summon you to join our elite team!
Job Responsibilities:
Contribute robust, maintainable code to some of our major systems such as Gameplay, AI, Physics, Graphics, Audio, or Tools. 
Tackle challenging technical problems along with a highly experienced team of game developers. 
Design intelligent and effective code architecture for key components of our game engine.
Required Skills:
Expertise in C++. 
A passion for video games and understanding of the fun factor. 
Working towards a bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or a related discipline. 
Comfortable working on projects with a large code base and long development cycles. 
Strong communication skills, work ethic and motivation. 

Bonus: 

Previous experience with game development either professionally or as an amateur. 
Experience with a scripting language such as PERL, Python or LUA 
Academic or professional experience with any of the following areas of computer science: AI, networking, distributed systems, concurrency, or graphics.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Who are we? 

Dogico is a small Canadian Software and Data Pipeline Development company in operations since 1998. Over the years, Dogico has taken responsibility for the planning, development, maintenance, and evolution of groups of Applications and Data Pipelines. 

Our mission is to seize opportunities to use our competencies, processes, and creativity to continuously create value for our clients. We are a creative and focused team that values work-life balance and teamwork. 

  

  

What is the project? 

We are developing a software product in the mining industry that uses computer vision to monitor a complex conveyor operation. This project includes processing multiple video streams from multiple cameras of a surveillance systems, and monitoring application for complex conveyor systems. 

  

  

What are we doing?  

Building an infrastructure to Extract, Transform, Transport, Aggregate and Analyze operational and strategic data for a complex multinational organization. This infrastructure requires tools to:  
 

Generate parts of the ETL packages based on functional descriptions of the required extractions and transformations. 
Dynamically evaluate user-defined expressions to locate data sources and data inside these data sources. 
Automatically generate user-oriented documentation based on technical components and functional requirements descriptions. 
Monitor the operations of the system from a central "support console" to ensure anomalies are readily identified and corrected. 
Produce dashboards on the health of the infrastructure. 
Monitor the analysis and use of data extracted from 100 live cameras. 
As the infrastructure is maturing and including more and more data and user dashboards, the tools supporting the infrastructure must be improved as well.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?  

 

Assist in the development of a new generation of tools to support the Data Management infrastructure of the client. 
Design, development, and testing of new features in the applications. 
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C# code. 
Use MS SQL Server to assist in application development, troubleshoot production problems, and generate custom reports. 
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems. 
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization. 
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. 
Update software documentation (i.e. Requirements, Design, and User's Guide) as needed. 
Oversee unit and integration testing. 
Create, manage, optimize the application, security, and cloud architecture. 
Write and review test procedures for changes to the application. 
Use version control and manage all software revisions using company repositories. 
Responsible for regular communication with others involved in the development process. 
Assist support and QA in resolving customer issues. 
Participate as a team member in fully agile Scrum deliveries. 
Use the Power BI to monitor and analyze system options.
Required Skills:
Who are we searching for? 

Undergraduate or Graduate in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Technology or any equivalent field. 
An active student currently enrolled in relevant programs at University. 
Significant experience in SQL Server, including constructing SQL queries, stored procedures, and optimization techniques. 
Strong understanding of the .NET Framework and Experience in either C# or Java development. 
Experience in JavaScript, HTML, CSS (Web-Development) is required. 
Knowledge of ASP .Net is a plus. 
Excellent verbal and written communication with the ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment. 
Ability to cooperate with each other and work within a development team, as well as operate independently. 

  

Other Requirements  

 

Experience with working in an Agile environment is an asset. 
Reasonable experience with MS Office Products (Excel, Word, Visio, PowerPoint).

Targeted Clusters

				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

In addition, our firm is commited to mentoring your skills and knowledge, and challenging your abilities in all aspects of the job.  if you are highly interested in structures and construction, are a self motivative individual who enjoys challenges, this position should interest you.

gathering field data during the inspection of bridges and the completion of inspection forms or reports documenting the observations,
assist in the preparation of Contract Doccuments including drawings and specifications,
calculations relating to reviews of bridge designs and related structures,
computer analysis using SAP2000 and similar software,
cost estimating / quantiity take-off,
report writing,
assisting with the preparation of proposals,
preparing presentation material for meetings,

visits to construction sites
a variety of other tasks. 

Because we are a small office, you will be exposed to many office management tasks as well.

demonstrated an more than average interest in structures

Job Summary:
Are you looking to kickstart your User Experience Design career? Are you interested in the world of start-ups where you can be part of launching new ideas and disrupting an entire industry? Join us at DOZR, where we're taking the world of heavy construction equipment by storm to make it faster, easier, and fully digital. 


Founded in 2015, DOZR is the world's first intelligent comprehensive search for heavy equipment and the largest online equipment rental platform. We're changing the way hundreds of thousands of contractors and rental companies rent heavy equipment and we're at an exciting stage where we're scaling an entirely new fleet of products aimed at bringing more and more rental companies online. 


We're looking for an ambitious UX Designer to join the Design Team and help shape this new fleet of products with a focus on simplicity, efficiency, and delight.
Job Responsibilities:
On the DOZR Design Team you'll work closely with two other designers, the marketing team and the engineering team to bring web-based software to market. This will include: 
 

Creating low fidelity and high fidelity mock-ups and wireframes
Communicating design concepts clearly and consisely with product stakeholders and the engineering team. 
Managing feedback from design reviews and ensuring iterations appropriately address needs. 
Interview customers in usability testing and generative user research projects. 
Creating visual design assets such as illustrations and other graphics.

Organization: Dr Mahsa Shekari Optometry Professional Corporation
Job Summary:
Dr Shekari and Associates, located in the Pearle Vision store at Square One  is currently seeking hard-working candidates to join our team as an Optometric Assistant.  The ideal candidate will have strong interpersonal skills and bring positive, interactive experiences to our clients. Prior experience in customer service, reception and/or administration would be an asset.   


The Optometric Assistant's essential function is to ensure all patients receive the highest quality Optometric care.  

  

Dr. Shekari and Associates is proud to be a partner of Pearle Vision, caring for and educating our valued clients on vision and eye health. 


About Pearle Vision, our partners: 


Caring for eyes and the people behind them is at the center of everything we do at Pearle Vision.  We believe in delivering genuine eye care with clear answers and personal attention.   Created by Dr. Stanley Pearle in 1961, Pearle Vision has brought the convenience and expert guidance of an eye care professional to your neighbourhood, fulfilling prescription eyeglasses on-site and offering the biggest selection of designer frames in town.
Job Responsibilities:
Working with Patients and Customers:
 

Providing excellent customer service and patient care
Display a professional image, greet patients promptly with a smile.
Ensure pre-exam test is performed with accuracy and attention to detail; take initiative to explain all measurements and answer patient questions.
Assist with various optometric testing methods, such as visual testing, eye pressure, refraction, corneal thickness, retinal imaging, and optical coherence topography.
Monitor and maintain inventory of supplies and contact lenses in exam rooms.
	 
  
Place contact lens trial orders, ensure there are no expired contacts, and maintain the contact lens room in a neat, orderly fashion; free of clutter.


Responsible for the maintenance and disinfection of equipment; provide clinical support to the optometrist as needed
Advising patients on lenses based on their prescription and needs
Coordinating referrals to specialists, as well as working closely with other administrators in our network of specialty medical offices
Ensure smooth continuity of care for clients


Administrative Duties 

 
 

Answer phones, schedule appointments, recall patients
Input customer/patient data, insurance information, and eye care services with appropriate fees.
Enter prescription information with accuracy and attention to detail.
Handle and file all patient records in an organized and efficient manner
Maintain a safe working environment for all associates, customers, and patients.
Perform work accurately and thoroughly, despite time pressure and patient volume
Identify situations involving unsatisfied patients and act quickly for effective resolution.
Consult with Optician, Managing Doctor or Retail Management when necessary.
Additional duties may be assigned for students who exhibit strong performance (such as working with escalations, engaging with insurance companies, trouble-shooting, etc).
Required Skills:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 

Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree and enrolled in the co-op program (health or science preferred, but open to all disciplines).
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to communicate clearly and listen carefully. People-oriented and enjoys interacting with the public
Superior organization skills; ability to assess priorities, address multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work autonomously and problem-solve. Exhibit adaptability, flexibility, curiosity, and dependability.  
Takes initiative to suggest improvements.
Knowledge of office environment, is detail-oriented and maintains a high degree of accuracy
Strong basic math skills



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
 

Experience in retail or optical
Experience in healthcare



This work term will require you to work on-site at our clinic and retail store.  This is not a remote work term.


Shift work may be required.  Students may also be required to work on weekends.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Research Computer Programmer In Deep Learning
Job Summary: Opening for a research computer programmer to develop a novel computer surgical navigation system for total knee replacement. Deep learning and computer vision will be used for augmented reality applications to assist in total knee replacement. A computer-vision based tracking system will be built to identify anatomic structures and position during surgery. This system will allow surgeons to perform total knee replacement more precisely and to enhance patient safety. Student will be integrated into a team based environment working with surgeons, residents and engineers.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop and implement deep learning alogorithms to identify and track anatomic structures using Microsoft HoloLens 2
"Unity" and "Tensorflow" will be used as development platform
Students will be asked to design and develop applications for Microsoft HoloLens 2 for surgical navigations for total knee replacements
Specific components of the software development include: bone registration, tracking and identification of bony anatomy, segmentation of video images
Required Skills:
Enthusiastic
Ability to work independently
Good communication skills
Proficient in the following programming environment:
	 
  
Unity
Tensorflow 
C++ 
Python

Job Summary: Develop embedded software for a prototype analog-to-digital data sampling and collection system, to be used in low-power sensor nodes for an IOT product.  Starting with low-level sample code and evaluation hardware provided by a chip vendor, modify code as required for the target application.  Investigate the impact of various design choices on data quality,  and evaluate the suitability of the system for the application.   Additionally, if time permits, the candidate may assist in optimization of parameters for a commercially available radio modem for use in a proprietary RF data communications link.
Job Responsibilities:
Configure development environment consisting of chip vendor's eval boards and software tools (IDE, SDK)
Find and read documentation and sample code from chip vendor's website, relevant to use of the on-chip analog-to-digital converter
Modify code as needed for the target application - may require changes to: ADC configuration, amplifier configuration, signal routing, DMA configuration. interrupt handler, etc
Export acquired data to PC, analyse quality.
Required Skills:
Familiarity with embedded systems and low-level device drivers with DMA.
'C' programming 
Familiarity with analog-to-digital conversion and sampling an asset
Familiarity with audio analysis tools (eg Audacity) an asset 
Independent research skills - ability to figure stuff out by reading documentation and experimenting

We are always looking for the best and brightest to join our thriving community and the Dream Impact team is looking to hire an Accounting Co-op for the 2022 Winter & Spring term to support our Corporate Accounting team 


Who are we? 


Dream is a leading Canadian real estate company with over $12 billion of assets under management in Canada & the US. We develop, manage, and invest in master-planned communities, income properties, and urban intensification. We proudly build communities from the ground up: from land development to buildings homes and condominiums, and from providing retail centers and driving renewable energy projects to managing assets across the country. 


Our attitude and approach set us apart from our competitors.  We are guided by our entrepreneurial spirit: we seize unconventional opportunities and try new things, approaching every project with passion and purpose. Our culture is important to us, so we make sure to bring on people who enhance it.

In addition to being able to showcase your collaborative mindset and positive attitude, you need to be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program, with a focus on Business or Accounting.

Job Summary:
Drop is on a mission to inspire individuals to live their optimal lives by empowering them financially. Drop has built a personalized rewards experience for millions of consumers from over 500 partner brands. To date, Drop has over 4 million users and has rewarded over $30 million to consumers. 


Drop is backed by a group of world-class venture capitalists who have funded companies such as IndieGoGo, MasterClass, Robinhood, Dollar Shave Club, AngelList, and SpaceX. Our team has worked for Fortune 500 companies that include Amazon, Eventbrite, Microsoft, Merrill Lynch, Deloitte, and more. 


As a member of the Data Science team, you are primarily responsible for influencing the decisions made by stakeholders across the company in order to drive the most impactful problems and solutions. 


You will have the opportunity to collaborate with the Product, Marketing, Partnerships, Engineering, Data Engineering teams and other Data Scientists. You will collaborate with stakeholders to clearly define problems we want to tackle, brainstorm solutions, conduct quantitative analysis, data mining, and present the findings to stakeholders in order to achieve the goals together. Your work will have a direct impact on Drop's growth trajectory and future success. 


You will be responsible for technical implementation and ensuring that the code and tools developed by the team function as intended and are scalable and sustainable. You will promote a culture of data informed decision making at Drop. You will do so by supporting and driving initiatives hands on, and also by democratizing data access across the company.  


You can learn more about our Data & Engineering team's work by visiting Drop's Engineering Blog, which includes a blog post about the experience of an Software Developer co-op at Drop: My Experience as an Eng Intern at Drop.
Job Responsibilities:
Work closely with Designers, Engineers, Data Scientists & Product Managers on building impactful product features used everyday by our growing user base
Develop complex SQL queries to gather informative data
Design experiments and come up with scientifically sound recommendations
Leverage visualization tools to tell impactful data stories
Deliver technical data concepts to non technical stakeholders in an easy-to-understand fashion
Required Skills:
Required skills

Experience querying and transforming structured and semi-structured data sets, using SQL
Strong analytical and problem solving skills; you are able to transform data into actionable product and business insights
Strong communication skills; you are able to gather requirements from stakeholders, translate them into an analytical problem, and share results clearly and concisely
A passion for product development, enjoying autonomy and end to end ownership

Bonus points if you

Experience with Looker, Redshift, Postgres, Athena, Python or R
Experience with product and business analytics
Experience with financial, loyalty, or rewards systems
Worked at a startup before

Job Summary:
Why work for Echelon?

  

Get ready to drive your career forward. Life at Echelon is fast paced, performance-driven and rewarding. We value our Associates' career growth and ongoing professional development - and we regularly recognize their achievements and outstanding results. 

We are caring. We are leaders. We are innovators. We are collaborative. 

We work hard and play hard. We're about doing what's right and feeling good about it. 

  

As a leading Canadian Specialty Insurer, Echelon works closely with its broker partners to protect families and businesses across Canada with our property and casualty insurance products. 

  

Echelon is a member of the CAA Club Group of Companies, and is an equal opportunity employer who offers a professional environment that champions collaboration, trust, and growth to drive success. We cultivate a great working dynamic to help us deliver what is best for our associates, Brokers, and Customers. 

  

  

Reporting to an Actuary Manager, the Actuarial student will work closely with other Actuarial Associates, Senior Management and other stakeholders in our Toronto and Montreal offices. This position will provide the candidate with exposure to one of the following disciplines: Pricing, Corporate or Business Intelligence/Analytics.
Job Responsibilities:
Work term responsibilities will vary depending on the department you will be working for: 

  

Corporate:

Quarterly analysis of reported claims within each quarter and evaluating the ultimate value of those claims
Understand the group's database structure of reported claims
Run our applications for data extraction as well as for the analysis of the information
Prepare a first line estimation of the liabilities to be reviewed with senior management
Assist in quarter-end financial reporting, which can include conducting reserving movements, and analyzing profitability
Contribute to special projects such as IFRS 17

 Pricing:

Evaluate and communicate profitability for pricing reports
Assists with monitoring our portfolios, analyzing results, identifying trends, impact on new business portfolio, changes and/or assumptions and communicating insights
Assist with actuarial indications and/or underwriting analysis
Contributes to special projects such as Rate filings

 Business Intelligence/Analytics

Build and maintain profitability/growth/segmentation models to predict customer cost and behavior
Update/Improve/Maintain Data relied upon by the Actuarial Department
Help in the development of tools and intelligent reports to other teams, allowing for better decision-making throughout the company
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business units' needs, and regulatory requirements
Required Skills:
Who are we looking for?

Talented, curious and analytical minded individual who is ready to take on challenges
Ability to balance multiple priorities while delivering quality work
Strong communication skills - verbal and written
Enrolled in a post-secondary educational institution in an accredited co-op program with a focus on Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics or any other related program.
Must have an intermediate to expert level of familiarity with MS SQL, Microsoft Excel, VB.Net in MS Visual Studio, Tableau
Must be adaptable, proactive and autonomous

Job Summary:
At Eckler, we know it's our people who make us great at what we do. We are looking for a talented and hardworking Actuarial Analyst to join our team of actuaries and consultants. We need a self-starter who is eager to roll-up their sleeves to get the job done. A typical day in the life of an Actuarial Analyst involves performing data activities and actuarial calculations for a wide range of clients to support the valuation process and ensure compliance with plan and government requirements.
 
If you are looking for the opportunity to learn more about the financial services industry from one of the top consulting firms, then this may be the right role for you!

What we offer

Collaborative and engaging atmosphere
Working with colleagues across Canada
Generous actuarial study program
A collegial, comfortable work environment with a "dress for your day" dress code
A modern new office conveniently located on the Yonge subway line


Who we are 
 
Eckler is Canada's largest independent actuarial consulting firm. Our purpose is to care and to do right by people so that together we can achieve a brighter, more secure future. Based in Canada and the Caribbean, we're a team of committed and highly skilled professionals in the areas of pension, retirement, financial wellness, investment, group benefits, change management and communication, along with insurance and technology consulting. Owned and operated by active Principals, the company has earned a reputation for service continuity and high professional standards. Eckler is a founding member of Abelica Global ? an international alliance of independent actuarial and consulting firms operating in over 20 countries.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Interpret plan documents and administrative policies
Examine and verify trust financial statements
Program and develop liabilities using actuarial principles and valuation technology and processes for a variety of valuation types (going concern, solvency, windup, accounting, conversions, projections) and a variety of funding methods, prepare gain and loss analysis and test cases
Use proprietary technology to determine employer contributions, accounting expenses, and draft reports for review by other team members
Complete commuted value calculations, produce employee benefit statements and file annual government reports and forms
Adhere to established quality processes and standards.
Required Skills:
What you offer

Pursuing a post secondary degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or related discipline
Minimum 1 SOA professional exam
Superior analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to follow established standards/procedures
Ability to work in a team environment while managing multiple priorities
Excellent interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills
Attention to detail and strong organizational skills

				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Summary:
Hi. We're ecobee. We introduced the world's first smart Wi-Fi thermostat and since then, we've helped millions of people transform the way they save money and conserve energy. With each new release, we introduce technology that brings the ease of automation and peace of mind to the home, allowing people to focus on the moments that matter most. We're proud of what we've done so far, but we're not about to rest with lots more on the go and big things on the horizon for us! More recently, ecobee launched a Smart Camera and a home monitoring service, Haven.  

  

We're a rapidly growing tech company located in the up-and-coming tech hub on the Toronto waterfront. We look to hire talented people who care deeply about our ever-changing environment and excel in their areas of unique expertise; from software and product development to marketing and sales.? We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting connected home revolution! 

  

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY   

  

Changes we've made to ensure our employees are safe: We are doing our part to ensure that our employees (and future employees) remain healthy, safe, and at home to reduce the spread of Covid-19. In doing so, ecobee has made the decision to be a remote-first work environment until at least January 2022 - this role does not require in office work, so it will likely be hybrid of in office and work from home (on a voluntary basis) 

  

How does this affect hiring and onboarding? 


Our interview and onboarding process has remained relatively the same, except that interviews and on boarding sessions are conducted through video. New employees will be starting remotely, and all necessary equipment will be shipped to them.  


The Role:  

  

You will work in partnership with the Product Manager from the eco+ teams to analyze the performance of our features, to solicit feedback from potential users, evaluate our design intents to iterate on these features, and support development teams with the right tools for the right job. 

  

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our team for the Winter 2022 work term!
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

Determine what metrics to track to enable decision making
Analyze the incoming data (quantitative and qualitative) and share it with the team in order to build consensus and recommend a path forward
Assist in the analysis, user research, design, development and execution of the product.
Work on a project that is at the intersection of many teams and platforms (Android, iOS, Machine Learning, Firmware, Backend, QA, User Research, User Experience, Marketing, Sales)    to help deliver world class products.
Work on the project that has the most impact on the environment at ecobee. You will start work every day knowing that you're having an actual impact on the planet.
Required Skills:
What You Bring to the Table:

  

You are a design and technology enthusiast who likes to obsess about the nuts and bolts that make a product. You are a self starter that describes yourself as a tinkerer with a learning mindset. You are data driven: you understand the importance of data to make decisions and apply it every day.  You will be an advocate for phenomenal user experiences, frictionless design and simple approaches to complex problems.
 

Keen interest in pursuing Product Management as a career ? any internships, co-ops or projects displaying this, an asset!
Pursuing an education in Engineering
Understanding of simple programming languages. Experience in SQL an asset.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Self-motivated and capable of working independently 
A deep interest in smart home technologies
Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

Convinced you'll be able to make an impact? 


We'd love to hear from you.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering

With each new release, we introduce technology that brings the ease of automation and peace of mind to the home, allowing people to focus on the moments that matter most. Changes we've made to ensure our employees are safe: We are doing our part to ensure that our employees (and future employees) remain healthy, safe, and at home to reduce the spread of Covid-19. In doing so, ecobee has made the decision to be a remote-first work environment until at least January 2022. 

  

How does this affect hiring and onboarding? Our interview and onboarding process has remained relatively the same, except that interviews and on boarding sessions are conducted through video. New employees will be starting remotely, and all necessary equipment will be shipped to you.  

  

Due to the hands-on nature of Test Fixtures, there may be some expectation to be in office for access to the Hardware Lab.

  

The Role:


We are looking for an Embedded Co-op to join our team for the Winter 2022 work term! 


As an Embedded Engineer, you will be responsible for helping develop the software that powers our hardware products.  These devices run on a multitude of platforms from small, battery operated microcontrollers to full-blown multicore embedded Linux systems.  


The embedded team is in a unique position as we own a wide breadth of the technologies that get built into our devices making each day a unique challenge. You may be working on portions of the low-level software/hardware interactions, but equally important is the development of the user applications that run on device.  Everything from network protocols, to control algorithms to building enticing graphic UI's.  


The embedded team is also responsible for developing the test fixtures used to validate the functionality of each device manufactured.  These devices are truly products on their own and no less complex considering the hardware and software systems they must interface with. 


Aside from the in-house technologies, the embedded team is often also responsible for integrating third-party services.  For example, we developed the device software stack that allowed us to become one of the first Apple HomeKit accessories on the market as well as more recently one of the first third parties to integrate Amazon Voice Services for Alexa functionality built right into a thermostat
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

Develop objected oriented software primarily in C++
Ability to work problems ranging the entire computer stack. All the way from low level driver support and OS upgrades to high level GUI and application development
Opportunity to work closely with Third party vendors and integration in order to bring new experiences to our platform. Examples: Spotify, Amazon Alexa, Apple Homkit, etc...
Contribute to the hacker spirit at ecobee by taking part in quarterly hackathons
To accomplish all of this you will be working closely with your mentor. At any given time you may also be working closely with developers from other teams as well as our Hardware, Product Management, Manufacturing teams and third-party tech companies on integrations.
Required Skills:
What You Bring to the Table:

Some of the skills and interests we've seen in Embedded Developers and Test Fixture Development at ecobee:
 

Computer Science, Software, Computer, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering student
C/C++ development experience.
Object-oriented design and coding skills with knowledge of data structures and design patterns.
Exposure to writing code in C++ and C for complex projects
Experience creating software architecture and design documentation
Just so you know: successfully matched candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

Convinced you'll be able to make an impact? We'd love to hear from you.   

  

What can you expect as an ecobee student?

The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space 
The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses 
The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts! 
Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab 
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Bi-monthly all company town halls
Monthly Lightning Talks, and the opportunity participate in them
Quarterly hack-a-thon, work on whatever you want!

We are looking for a Backend Developer to join our team, which will provide an amazing opportunity to contribute to ecobee's impact and learn from some strong Engineering Talent.

We use leading edge technologies to innovate highly concurrent, Java-based server applications that directly impact ecobee's success. You may work on deploying applications within ecobee's infrastructure as well as AWS and Google Cloud Platform. 

  

As a Backend Developer you'll use leading edge technologies to innovate highly concurrent server applications that directly impact ecobee's success. We encourage the freedom to investigate and evaluate new technologies to solve complex problems. As a result, your input will have a significant impact on our company and objectives.

The Role: 

  

You will work in partnership with the Product Manager from the eco+ teams to analyze the performance of our features, to solicit feedback from potential users, evaluate our design intents to iterate on these features, and support development teams with the right tools for the right job. 

  

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our team for the Winter 2022 work term!
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

Determine what metrics to track to enable decision making
Analyze the incoming data (quantitative and qualitative) and share it with the team in order to build consensus and recommend a path forward
Assist in the analysis, user research, design, development and execution of the product.
Work on a project that is at the intersection of many teams and platforms (Android, iOS, Machine Learning, Firmware, Backend, QA, User Research, User Experience, Marketing, Sales)    to help deliver world class products.
Work on the project that has the most impact on the environment at ecobee. You will start work every day knowing that you're having an actual impact on the planet.
Required Skills:
What You'll Bring to the Table: 

  

You are a design and technology enthusiast who likes to obsess about the nuts and bolts that make a product. You are a self starter that describes yourself as a tinkerer with a learning mindset. You are data driven: you understand the importance of data to make decisions and apply it every day. You will be an advocate for phenomenal user experiences, frictionless design and simple approaches to complex problems.  


·       Keen interest in pursuing Product Management as a career - any internships, co-ops or projects displaying this, an asset!  

·       Pursuing an education in Engineering

·       Strong written and verbal communication skills

·       A deep interest in smart home technologies

The Role:

  

As a software developer with a primary focus on security, you'll be working with our development teams to improve the security of our products at every layer of the stack. As an IoT company you'll get exposure to a rather broad scope in the security field, including physical security and embedded code analysis for our devices, web security and applying OWASP best-practices to our web applications, and networking and data security for our various hosting environments. 

  

We are looking for a Security Co-op to join our team for the Winter 2022 work term!
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

You'll use your software development skills, your passion for thorough analysis, and your ability to collaborate and teach other developers to accomplish this. In this capacity, you'll get to experience a wide range of security-related responsibilities.
A typical day might entail everything from:
	 
  
Analysis (trying to expose vulnerabilities in our applications using pen-testing and static analysis tools)
Education (setting policies and building checks and pipelines to ensure our data science team follows our data privacy and security guidelines)
Development (working directly with our codebases to address vulnerabilities).



  

At ecobee, we work in a fully agile environment. You'll be working directly with a software development team focused on the ongoing security and analysis for a specific product but will also get to participate in company-wide initiatives like security education, policy creation, and tool selection to improve our overall security posture. You'll get the opportunity to bring your areas of interest to life at ecobee through hack-days and a culture built around grassroots ideas.
Required Skills:
What You Bring to the Table:

A current Computer Science, Software, Computer or Electrical Engineering student.
Experienced with using Linux systems.
Enjoys the craft of developing software.
Just so you know: the hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

Convinced you'll be able to make an impact? We'd love to hear from you.

The Role:


ecobee has some unique challenges - being both a hardware and a software company, there are often many different and independent moving pieces that make up a project. You'll work closely with the Hardware engineers, Firmware department, Program Managers, Manufacturing and QA teams to help those moving pieces through the development stages of each project. 


We are looking for a Hardware Engineer to join our team for the Winter 2022 term.
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

Develop custom hardware to test, characterize and validate systems
Create powerful test plans to ensure robust hardware
Use of RF equipment including VNAs and Spectrum Analyzers to test, tune and validate antenna networks
Exposure to Design for Manufacturing (DFM) techniques for successful mass production of consumer electronics
Test fixture design and support
Required Skills:
What You Bring to the Table:

Current student in Electrical, Computer, Systems Design or Mechatronics Engineering
Schematic entry in OrCAD Capture and/or Altium Designer
Multidisciplinary experience integrating mechanical and electrical sub-systems
Projects that show you've gone the extra mile to develop elegant solutions to complex problems
Relevant coursework including but not limited to digital circuit design, sensors and instrumentation, thermodynamics, real-time operating systems, power electronics, robotics, materials science, fluid dynamics and/or control systems
Just so you know: successfully matched candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

The chance to meet and work with co-ops across all teams at ecobee
The opportunity to work in a fresh, dynamic, and ever-growing industry that is the SmartHome and IoT space 
The visibility into a company that has an interesting mix of hardware and software consumer-facing businesses 
The ability to make an environmental impact, both in your day job and outside the 9-5 with programs like ecobee acts! 
Opportunities to learn and grow with our in-house learning enablement team, #ThinkLab 
Small collaborative teams where you can impact both product and culture
Bi-monthly all company town halls
Thursday board game nights
Monthly demo days, and the opportunity participate in them

ecobee believes all people have equal value and we are committed to providing a safe space for everyone. We welcome all applicants with diverse races, genders, ages, religions, identities, experiences, etc. and we will provide accommodation to all applicants throughout our hiring process.

Changes we've made to ensure our employees are safe: We are doing our part to ensure that our employees (and future employees) remain healthy, safe, and at home to reduce the spread of Covid-19. In doing so, ecobee has made the decision to be a remote-first work environment until January 2022. This co-op term will likely be hybrid of in office and work from home. 

  

How does this affect hiring and onboarding? Our interview and onboarding process has remained relatively the same, except that interviews and on boarding sessions are conducted through video. New employees will be starting remotely and all necessary equipment will be shipped to them. 


The Role:

Our Data Science team analyzes data from all of our ecobee products and uncovers hidden meanings behind the various points of data. 

  

We are looking for a Data Science, Co-op for the Winter 2022.
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact:

Participate in building complex and intelligent features in our ecosystem of smart home devices that combine a variety of sensors with machine intelligence to provide an omni-present assistant for a smart home. 
Contribute to a small and growing team that makes big impact in the life of thousands of people and enables technologies that saves energy and the environment.
Play with the latest and greatest in big data tools and technologies
Required Skills:
What You Bring to the Table:

  

Maybe you're creating software or tools to simplify the lives of others?  Or rather analyzing how they work and the meaning behind their data?
 

You are currently a full-time student in a technical or quantitative discipline - Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math etc.
Experience with programming languages Python, Java, C++
Experience using data and machine learning to solve real-world problems
Basic familiarity with SW Engineering best practices
Experience with data engineering tools like Dataflow/Spark is a plus
Just so you know: the hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.

Convinced you'll be able to make an impact?  We'd love to hear from you.

Job Summary:
Hi. We're ecobee. We introduced the world's first smart Wi-Fi thermostat and since then, we've helped millions of people transform the way they save money and conserve energy. With each new release, we introduce technology that brings the ease of automation and peace of mind to the home, allowing people to focus on the moments that matter most. We're proud of what we've done so far, but we're not about to rest with lots more on the go and big things on the horizon for us!?More recently, ecobee launched a Smart Camera and a home monitoring service, Haven.  

  

We're a rapidly growing tech company located in the up-and-coming tech hub on the Toronto waterfront. We look to hire talented people who care deeply about our ever-changing environment and excel in their areas of unique expertise; from software and product development to marketing and sales. We take pride in making a meaningful difference to the environment, all while being part of the exciting connected home revolution!??  

  

For more on ecobee: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RR4rKtkf1SY   

  

Changes we've made to ensure our employees are safe: We are doing our part to ensure that our employees (and future employees) remain healthy, safe, and at home to reduce the spread of Covid-19. In doing so, ecobee has made the decision to be a remote-first work environment until at least January 2022 - this role does not require in office work, so it will likely be hybrid of in office and work from home (on a voluntary basis) 

  

How does this affect hiring and onboarding? Our interview and onboarding process has remained relatively the same, except that interviews and on boarding sessions are conducted through video. New employees will be starting remotely, and all necessary equipment will be shipped to them.  


The Role:  

  

You will work in partnership with the Product Managers from the Home Monitoring team to analyze the performance of our features and the large (anonymized) data sets we gather on alerts, incidents, and activity from our customer homes.  You will then work with the data science team and support the enhancement of current ML models that exist as well as build new ML models to help us offer advanced & safe automation to our customers. 

  

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our team for the Winter 2022 work term!
Job Responsibilities:
How You'll Make an Impact: 

Determine success metrics for an ML model
Analyze the data, and map it to customer needs, to recommend what areas can be solved with more automation 
Assist in the analysis, user research, design, development, and execution of the model
Work on a project that is at the intersection of many teams and platforms (Android, iOS, Machine Learning, Backend, QA, User Research, User Experience, Marketing, Sales)  to help deliver world class experiences
You will start work every day knowing that you're helping millions of ecobee customers with peace of mind and a heightened sense of security
Required Skills:
What You'll Bring to the Table: 

  

You are a design and technology enthusiast who likes to obsess about the nuts and bolts that make a product. You are a self starter that describes yourself as a tinkerer with a learning mindset. You are data driven: you understand the importance of data to make decisions and apply it every day. You will be an advocate for phenomenal user experiences, frictionless design and simple approaches to complex problems.  


·       Keen interest in pursuing Product Management as a career - any internships, co-ops or projects displaying this, an asset!  

·       Pursuing an education in Engineering 

·       Understanding of simple programming languages. Experience in SQL an asset.  

·       Strong written and verbal communication skills   

·       Self-motivated and capable of working independently?   

·       A deep interest in smart home technologies   

·       Just so you know: The hired candidate will be required to complete a background check.  

  

Convinced you'll be able to make an impact? We'd love to hear from you.

Job Summary:
About eCompliance 
eCompliance safety software is the leader for improving worker participation in safety. The eCompliance mobile app connects workers with head office, creating a two-way conversation so safety leaders can make faster, fact-based decisions, and executives gain an unrivalled view of safety risk across their company. With the mission to eliminate 1 million incidents, eCompliance is the fastest growing safety software company in the world with hundreds of client success stories. Offering a real-time safety environment, eCompliance empowers organizations to improve EHS performance and use safety as a competitive differentiator.
We have embarked on a project to define the Health and Safety Industry, building a Platform that will enable rapid development of software products.  Using Inversion of Control concepts, we are developing a configurator of applications and work-flow tools to get products to market faster

eCompliance is seeking a fun spirited, driven and motivated individual to support exciting work on a software product in the Health and Safety space.
Job Responsibilities:
The student interested in learning more about software development will get the chance to learn:

Working in an agile team
Managing source code with Git and Github

Students will be assigned to one of the following areas of focus. Students who are passionate in a particular are may request it. This term we have the following areas available:


Fullstack Development
	
Learn fullstack development by embedding with a team building fullstack applications


Mobile
	
Learn about mobile (Android, iOS and Mobile web) development by embedding with a team building mobile Flutter applications


Data
	
Data Engineer: Learn about data engineering pipelines embedding with a team building data and business intelligence applications using Airflow, Kafka, Spark, Redshift.
Data Analyst: Learn how to conduct inferential and descriptive data analysis. Translate reporting requirement into complex data models and business intelligence dashboard.
Data Scientist: Learn about the Machine Learning development life cycle using NLP and time series analysis and Deep Learning
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate will have the following skills and attributes:
Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science or Engineering or related discipline
Some form of previous work experience - preferably in testing or software development
Strong organizational & communication skills
Adaptable and problem solving attitude
Sound presentation skills
Hard working

Job Summary:
Do you love videogames? Have you been dreaming about making them since you were a kid? If the answer to both of those questions is yes, this is the job for you! 


Eden Industries is a small videogame development company based in Vancouver that is passionately developing games primarily for the PC and console markets. We're just about to ship Toy Soldiers: HD (published by Accelerate Games for PC/Switch/PS4/Xbox One) and we have a few new projects in development currently. Our other previous games include: 


-Citizens Unite! Earth x Space (published by KEMCO for PC/Switch/PS4) 

-Citizens of Space (published by SEGA for PC/PS4/Switch/XBox One) 

-Citizens of Earth (published by Atlus for PC/Wii U/PS4/3DS/Vita) 

-Waveform (four-time nominee at the Canadian Videogame Awards, released for Steam/iOS/Android). 


We have a number of games in development at the moment, including an announced one - Extinction Wars, which is a strategy game that's a bit of a mix of StarCraft and Advance Wars and super awesome! Check it out here: https://www.outerheavenstudios.com/blank-page 


We were also featured in an interview with Waterloo's Co-op Department to talk about what it's like making videogames, check it out! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=quRyLDibyfw 


C++ programming will constitute the bulk of the job, although game design opportunities are also possible for candidates interested in them. Since the team is small, the company culture and development style is very fast-paced, dynamic, and fluid. As a result, the successful candidate will be able to participate in a wide range of development possibilities dependant on the individual skills and interests of the successful candidate and may include such areas as: 

-Gameplay programming. Make characters move, perform actions, AI and state-machine work, etc. 

-UI programming. Menus for information, options, etc. 

-Tools programming. A lot of great pipeline code that supports making great games! There may be a bit of C# and/or Javascript involved here too, if relevant to the candidate. 

-Engine programming. We have our own in-house game engine that we've been developing for over a decade now. Any work in this area will involve the addition or improvement of core systems that support the games we make, but in a game-independent way. If you love low-level systems (memory management, audio processing, rendering, etc.) or are a mastermind of system architecture, there'll be some fun work here for you! 


This position is intended to be performed remotely - the company is comprised of a decentralized group of developers across Canada and the world. Since the majority are located in the Greater Vancouver Area, however, if you happen to be nearby there will be opportunities to meet up for coworking and fun! As a result of the remote nature of the work, it is of paramount importance that candidates possess an outstanding work ethic and are extremely self-motivated. Although the successful candidate will be in constant communication with the rest of the team through a variety of methods (Slack, email, the project tracking server, etc.) there won't be anyone looking over your shoulder while you work.  


As a developer in a small team, you have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the games in development and leave your mark on games that you can be proud of when you show them to your friends and family. Whether that's in designing a new feature and implementing it that you can later play, devising a brilliant new tool to help the artists do their job faster and better (a fact they'll love you for, even if you don't get to directly play that in the final game), or anything in between! You won't just be a cog in a coding machine for this position - you'll be an essential part of bringing awesome new videogames to the world! 


Making videogames is a lot of fun, but it's also a lot of hard work. Especially with the time limitation of the co-op term, you'll have to learn fast and code fast.
Job Responsibilities:
You will primarily be responsible for programming new features in C++ for a variety of areas of game development. You will also be responsible for thoroughly testing any features that you develop and fixing any bugs. 


Since the position is remote, you will be responsible for managing your time effectively and efficiently.  


From time to time you may also be required to speak with artists, sound designers, level designers, and other non-technical staff in the development of tools to assist them in their work or in hooking up their assets into the game.
Required Skills:
Super Important: 

-Experience with C++ is absolutely essential. You don't need to be a master of the more esoteric features of C++, but pointers and dynamic memory allocation/deallocation shouldn't cause you to bat an eye. 

-Passionate love of videogames. 

-Strong work ethic and self-motivation.  

-Experience with C++. Yes it was the first one listed, but it's also the last. Because it's that important! 


Essential: 

-Experience working in a large codebase 

-Good communication and teamworking skills. Although this one should almost go without saying, it's very important given the remote nature of the position.  


Great to have: 

-Strong mathematical foundation (linear algebra, polar coordinates, etc.) 

-Experience with source control systems (bonus for SVN or Git) 

-Experience working in, and especially debugging through, Visual Studio 

-Experience with game development 

-Experience with C# and/or Javascript 

-Creative. Whether that's in thinking of outside-the-box systems to develop or new game design possibilities to implement.

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Full Stack Engineer


Edkent Media is searching for a Full Stack Engineer (with a particular focus on frontend) to join our growing Engineering Team. You will be responsible for development efforts on multiple web-based SaaS products, and enjoy a great deal of ownership over their design and implementation. 


This is an onsite position in our office in Markham, but we are currently hiring this job in a work from home capacity as we navigate the COVID-19 pandemic.
Job Responsibilities:
Technologies/Frameworks/Languages


The position requires a competent understanding of modern Javascript/Typescript, React or similar frontend frameworks, NoSQL (MongoDB) and Express (Node.js). This role expects the candidate to act as a core contributing team member that is able to take part in architecture decisions and also solve challenging technical problems in a scalable manner. Its primary focus is on our React+TypeScript product frontends, but there is also scope for work on our backend REST APIs and internal microservices. The ideal candidate has direct experience with MERN stack framework, a strong understanding and corresponding experience building enterprise-level software products (preferably customer-facing). 

This role requires the engineer to contribute code daily to the project, perform code review (via Pull-Requests), and communicate directly with the product team by helping develop technical and business requirements. 

At PostGrid/Edkent, we place a great deal of importance on quality, and key to that is writing elegant, maintainable code. As such, the team is very open to discussing problems and how we can solve them optimally. Our goal is to build products that customers love, and our engineering team is the best place to have that impact. 


This is an onsite position in our office in Markham, but we are currently hiring this job in a work from home capacity as we navigate the COVID-19 pandemic.
Required Skills:
Requirements:

React Frontend + TypeScript
NoSQL and Document Stores (MongoDB)
Node.JS (ExpressJS)
Object-oriented programming
Experience Building Web Applications (SaaS)
Good technical foundation with ability to pick up new skills and adapt quickly
Desire to learn new technologies while supporting existing codebases
Strong Agile Fundamentals
Bonus if you know: AWS, REST API Design, System Architecture Design, C++, Python

Job Summary:
About You


We are looking for an incredible Customer Success Engineer who is passionate about solving customer problems. You will be responsible for bridging the gap between sales/customer support and engineering, and deliver solutions that meaningfully impact our customers. 


This is a high growth opportunity with equity and stock options available for the right candidates in the future. We are growing and scaling up, they want their core team members to grow with them! If you want to be the next CTO, you have the opportunity here with us!
Job Responsibilities:
The Role

Some of the things we'd love to have you do in your first six months include:
Create complete end-to-end applications using NodeJS, TypeScript, MongoDB and React
Build large scale REST API's serving over 1 million requests a month
Help bridge the gap between the sales and engineering teams
Engage with other engineers to identify root problems and create fixes
Build internal administration tooling to streamline user management, onboarding, reviews and other internal operations
Provide input to product design and help optimize UX flows for our customers
Work closely with customers and identity, debug and help fix their issues
Participate in agile project planning
Work with product management to plan features and estimate their complexity
Manage a portfolio of key clients
Identify attrition risks and develop custom retention plans
Be a voice for accounts internally and other team members to understand product concerns, shortcomings, and missing features that are retention risks.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Required Skills:
You are the ideal candidate if you:

Have a minimum of 2+ years experience in a full stack engineering or developer position, preferably in the tech / startup universe.
Have experience with JavaScript/TypeScript - we're a Node.js, TypeScript, React platform
Have strong knowledge of REST API services and how they are designed
Have experience working with and creating REST API documentation
Have strong written and communication skills, with the ability to explain complicated technical systems in a way that non-technical people can understand
Are perpetually curious and always learning - whether about the latest languages, frameworks, best practices or the tech industry in general
Rise to a challenge and can handle change and uncertainty, at times
Are a team-player: our team is small and mighty, and we collaborate constantly; we want someone who is always willing to pitch in and isn't afraid to ask for help
Are a self-starter, a problem-solver, and a creative thinker

Reporting to the partners of Eggett Tax Services, the Tax Preparer will be responsible to engage with a wide variety of clients to assess, enter and complete personal tax returns. This will include organizing, validating and processing information to create tax returns within the Profile program. 


Duties will include following up for any missing information as well as resolving discrepancies to finalize returns.  In addition, the Tax Preparer will assist with bookkeeping, filing HST returns, tabulating data in spreadsheets and other special projects, as required.

Treat all information with utmost confidentiality and in accordance with privacy laws

Proficiency of Profile tax program
Multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment

Job Summary:
This role presents an opportunity for a driven individual to take charge of the mechanical aspects of our product launch and scale up. Ekidna Sensing currently has a beta version of its potency testing platform but is now in the process of scaling up for market adoption. The successful individual will focus on iterative improvement and consolidation of the product's design during the transition into mass manufacturing (from 10's of products per month to 1000's). Assisting in the mechanical design needs of Ekidna, as well as day-to-day mechanical support of the company. Interacting with our manufacturing partners and troubleshooting mechanical issues in manufacturing will be an important part of the placement. We are looking for a hands-on individual who is excited to be involved in many aspects of the company, as being a small team, you must wear many hats. Involvement in R&D, participation in customer pilot trials, and IP generation are just a few examples of the opportunities Ekidna can offer the successful candidate. 


About Ekidna Sensing

Ekidna Sensing Inc, a biotech startup located in Ottawa, is building technology solutions for the legal Cannabis industry. We have developed a rapid, accurate, and portable cannabis testing solution to help licensed producers eliminate production bottlenecks, reduce operational costs, and bring their products to market faster. Ekidna Sensing mission is to democratize industrial testing so that anyone has the information they need to run their operations. Ekidna Sensing is entering a period of rapid growth and offers an exciting opportunity to be a part of a startup with large potential.
Job Responsibilities:
Design of product parts in CAD for FDM and injection molding
Operation and maintenance of FDM printers, produce prototype manufacturing runs in house
Full-cycle product design and testing. Interact with R&D and marketing team on product design - translate their needs & findings to designs
Test of prototypes with fluids in a controlled wet lab environment
Design, test, author, and maintain manufacturing and QA protocols and technical documents
Work and communicate with manufacturers, suppliers, and other key partners
Required Skills:
Must have experience with the SolidWorks suite of CAD software. A functional understanding of the built-in analysis packages, maintaining BOMs, configurations, and drawings within SolidWorks is necessary.
Proven experience working with and designing for FDM 3D printers.
Experience sourcing components, maintaining BOMs, and writing technical documentation.
