Job Summary:
elastic.io is a young (founded in 2012) company located in Bonn, Germany.  elastic.io is a software company whose main product is a cloud based integration platform as a service.  We are looking to have two co-op students join our pre-sales and professional services team as software systems integration specialists.  This role combines both customer facing aspects as well as software development to meet the needs of those customers. 


You will be working for a former UW Coop student at a company that has hired UW Coop students in the past. 


No German language required.  


Previous applicants are welcome to re-apply.  If you are not selected for an interview this round and the position(s) are not fully filled, please re-apply to the position next round. 


Here is a video a previous Coop student made about his coop experience at elastic.io in Germany: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SMX-BHHHaaQ&feature=youtu.be?


The position can be done remotely however the Government of Canada's global travel advisory might be dropped/relaxed and travel to Germany might become possible. There are pre-screening questions attached to this posting related to German Visa eligiblity so that we can understand what (if any) options might be possible. 


If you have any questions, please reach out to me at jacob@elastic.io
Job Responsibilities:
The job has traditionally had four parts: 

* Writing code to build and extend components for our ecosystem 

* Implementing customer projects for customers that lack the manpower/know how to do it themselves 

* Training external engineers on how to use our product 

* Examining the above three steps to make them more efficient 


This means that your responsibilities would include: 

* Analysis of IT environments and IT processes of our customers 

* Requirements management, effort estimation, solution description and design 

* Advising our clients on the development of their integration strategy 

* Preparation and implementation of POC projects 

* Creation of decision templates and technical concepts 

* Project management of complex integration projects 

* Coding components to interact with various computer systems/applications 

* Implementation of projects for customers 

* Designing training curricula 


Exact job responsibilities will depend on the experience and interests of the hired student and there is lots of room for flexibility.  One of the topics of discussion in the interview would be to identify your interests and career expectations (for this stage of your career) so that we can identify a mutually beneficial role.
Required Skills:
The more of these skills you have, the better.  We can train you on the job for all the skills that are missing.  

* JavaScript (Node.js + async/await syntax) 

* Java 

* HTTP, REST & SOAP (including supplemental tools such as POSTman and webhook.site) 

* Agile Methodologies 

* Understanding of existing integration technologies, their business context and willingness to learn 

* Unit and Integration Testing 

* Git (Learn the basics + get better than typical understanding of how git remotes work)  

* Open source experience is a plus 

* Training or mentorship experience 

* Customer project or customer relationship experience

Job Summary:
Do you want to make a difference in people's lives developing life saving treatment solutions for cancer and brain disorders, and helping clinicians deliver personalized radiotherapy treatment care for every patient? 


Elekta is the leading innovator of equipment and software used to improve, prolong and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders. 


Our QA solutions team in Toronto is seeking a software developer co-op who is passionate about applying their technical skills in medical software.  You will be a contributing member developing AQUA - software platform that centralizes all the end-to-end machine quality assurance activities for radiation therapy at radiation oncology departments in hospitals and clinics.   As part of the software team in downtown Toronto, you will collaborate with other software developers, physicists, product and project managers, and verification & validation professionals, contributing to this product as part of larger software and hardware solutions.   


Elekta - We are Precision Radiation Medicine
Job Responsibilities:
·        Participate in all phases of the software development cycle during development cadence 

·        Be an active team member and take on development work to accomplish team goals and objectives 

·        Realize user stories and deliver value by working with, and under the guidence of, other team members, physicists and product owner 

·        Make sound technical decisions that meets functional and quality requirements, with striving for high quality deliverables 

·        Manage time effectively and be proficient in development process, environment, configurations, and tools 

·        Apply active listening skills in problem identification and decision making 

·        Work with individuals and teams that are geographically separated as required 

·        Bring a passion to learn, grow, and improve as a contributing member of the team 

·        Interact effectively with key stakeholders
Required Skills:
Critical thinking, problem solving and a quality focus is essential for success in this job
You must have an agile mindset, view problems not as obstacles but opportunities for growth and improvement
Good foundational understanding of OO design principles, including technical and non-technical tradeoffs in design decisions 
Proficient with atleast two of the following: Java, C++, C#, SQL, JavaScript
Understanding of web technologies: CSS, HTML, RPC, SSL, JSON / XML / CSV
Must be a team player and adopt a shared ownership of quality and delivery
Experience with build scripting / automation and understanding of DevOps principles is a plus
Image processing knowledge / experience and understanding of DICOM standard is a plus
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Medical Devices and Diagnostics
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				SCI - Physics

Job Summary:
At eleven-x we like to work hard and get things done.  Our team is building a world leading IoT solutions company that delivers quality and value to our customers.  We build Devices, we build the Network, we build the Applications.  Engineering excellence is in our DNA.  Eleven-x operates a wireless network.in over 30 cities across Canada enabling enable Intelligent Infrastructure projects across the country.  From our offices in Waterloo, ON, we are on our way to being a dominant IoT solution provide in North America.  


eleven-x is an experienced employer of student and co-ops. Our goal is to get you quickly to a productive member of the team.   We want to you to learn and grow in the role.  We are big fans of train and retain, so there could be opportunity on the development teams in the future.
Job Responsibilities:
eleven-x provides a wide variety of sensor solutions. We build some of these devices but also source many of these devices from throughout the world.   We are constantly testing and evaluating sensors.    


Our technician will assist us in our procurement, testing and evaluation of sensors.   


This will involve:
 

In identifying sensor from specification sheets
Working with vendors to get information
Obtaining the sensors
Developing test plans specific to the sensor
Evaluating the information provided by the sensor
Evaluating the robustness and performance of sensor
Monitoring power consumption and wireless signal performance
Providing a recommendation
Assist in pilot installation of the sensors

We are looking for someone who can solve technical problems, but this is also a hands-on job with a requirement to work both in and outside the office. Use of hand tools such as drill, screw drivers etc, will be necessary.   


NOTE:  There must be willingness to work outside.
Required Skills:
Knowledge of embedded systems
Able to work with byte coded messaging
Exceptional debugging skills
Exceptional communication skills
Hard working and dedicated

Bonus points for:

 

Knowledge and experience of communication protocols such as IP, HTTP, TLS, and MQTT
Knowledge and experience with scripting such Python
Knowledge of wireless technologies

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
About Lunchclub


At Lunchclub we're helping people relevantly grow their professional network. We use AI to scale data-driven matches to thousands of people weekly, small groups of like-minded individuals, and panels with some of the world's best. We've introduced people who have started companies together, received/given mentorship, received funding, made their next hire, or friend. We're a small, tight-knit, but distributed team, powering connections across thousands of cities around the world. 


About engineering at Lunchclub


We're a small team of generalist software engineers driving big outcomes with a lot of shared responsibility. We often work outside the traditional Fullstack/Backend/Frontend mould to create, fix, and improve Lunchclub for our users and fellow engineers. Our engineers also actively take part in discussions on product, design, user interviews, and more. The fastest way to learn technology is to build things at an early stage startup - we expect you to grow a lot as an engineer during your time here.
Job Responsibilities:
As a software engineer intern at Lunchclub you'll...


Build features from start to finish. Start with research or an idea, work with design to draft up a spec, build, launch, and polish. 

Improve and iterate on existing features through A/B testing, user, or team feedback. 

Build and improve existing internal tools, helping us maintain our team's high impact on our growing community. 

Play an active role in the shaping of the future of the product and business.
Required Skills:
This role could be for you if...


You love problem solving - especially with code. 

You're looking to grow quickly as an engineer and do not fear ownership, even at an early stage of your career. 

You know how to balance building quickly with building well. 


Bonus: You're adept with Javascript/React, Python/Flask, MySQL, Docker.

Job Title:
NEW
									


										Software Engineering Intern - Data Science Platform
Job Summary:
Founded by University of Waterloo alumni, Embark Trucks is America's Longest-Running Self-Driving Truck Program and is bringing autonomous freight mainstream. Embark has announced plans to go public via a $5.2 billion SPAC deal that is intended to provide Embark $614 million to fund future expansion. Currently, Embark moves freight between LA and Phoenix using our purpose-built transfer hubs. Embark has aligned itself with truck manufacturers, shippers, and carriers to integrate our technology into the freight ecosystem, pursuing a business model where fleets own and operate Embark trucks. This is an incredibly exciting time for autonomous vehicles and our team is looking to grow. 


Embark's Product team sets the direction and priorities for our growing Engineering organization. We build close relationships with truck drivers and engineers alike so that we can empathize with them and understand the self-driving problem as deeply as possible. We analyze on-road data with a fine-toothed comb and develop system requirements from first principles. We develop strategies and roadmaps for the team using metrics that we build from the ground up. We understand we have a responsibility to communicate these plans and our progress to the company to keep everyone accountable and ultimately accelerate the deployment of safe self-driving trucks. 


At Embark we strive to support all major decisions with data. As a software engineer working on product metrics, you will be expected to synthesize these needs and develop solutions to enable the team to make informed decisions. Your input and understanding of these solutions will be crucial to the final outcomes.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Work closely with product managers and engineers to brainstorm, prototype and implement metrics for AV systems and subsystems across Planning, Perception and Hardware.
Using both research from industry and a first principles physics or data-based approach, build novel behavioral-level metrics to quantify the performance of our self-driving trucks.
Evaluate, architect and deploy new database systems and data pipelines to extract, characterize and store scenario information from the terabytes of driving data that our vehicles log everyday.
Build APIs to enable advanced queries for metrics and other scenarios of interest for applications like machine learning, project planning and Operations resource allocation.
Understand and communicate the tradeoffs of different measures of performance for the vehicle and its subsystems used to inform Engineering priorities, staffing and timelines.
Build dashboards and visualizations in order to convey the progress of our system to a variety of stakeholders across the company.
Required Skills:
- Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in CS, Engineering, or equivalent real-world experience 

- Experience writing in Python, C++ or Go, or similar in a production environment 

- Excellent communication skills  

- Passionate about community and working with others 

- Impact-driven
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Managing a fleet of self-driving trucks requires excellent real-time telematics systems to monitor our vehicles as they move freight across the country. The Fleet Monitoring team is responsible for building all of the systems that enable us to interact with vehicles driving on the freeway remotely, allowing us to live stream video, monitor sensor data, and send information back to the vehicle.

Experiment with different network configurations to optimize throughput + latency in areas of poor LTE reception

Job Title:
NEW
									


										Backend Software Engineering Intern - Data Engineering
Job Summary:
Founded by University of Waterloo alumni, Embark Trucks is America's Longest-Running Self-Driving Truck Program and is bringing autonomous freight mainstream. Embark has announced plans to go public via a $5.2 billion SPAC deal that is intended to provide Embark $614 million to fund future expansion. Currently, Embark moves freight between LA and Phoenix using our purpose-built transfer hubs. Embark has aligned itself with truck manufacturers, shippers, and carriers to integrate our technology into the freight ecosystem, pursuing a business model where fleets own and operate Embark trucks. This is an incredibly exciting time for autonomous vehicles and our team is looking to grow. 


Data is core to everything that we do at Embark. Our fleet of self-driving trucks generate petabytes of valuable data from the road, and this data powers all of our engineering processes that enable us to deliver on our mission. From training machine learning algorithms, to generating and executing simulations in which we can measure the performance of our virtual driver across a wide variety of scenarios, to extracting insights from road data to drive our engineering decisions, data is fundamental to everything that we do, and the data infrastructure team builds the pipelines, architectures, APIs, and processes that power all of this. 


As a software engineer on the data infrastructure team, you'll help make all of this possible.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities

Maintain the on-vehicle code responsible for data collection, monitoring and real-time communication with our backend systems (supporting use cases such as real-time low-latency streaming of sensors such as camera and LiDAR over LTE) while also building the backend systems that power all of this.
Evaluate, architect, and deploy new database systems and data pipelines to enable our engineering team to gain richer insights into our data
Build scalable data pipelines which operate over petabytes of autonomous vehicle data to extract useful features, enable advanced queries, and power machine learning pipelines and simulation environments
Deploy, build and maintain infrastructure responsible for ingesting and processing data uploaded from our vehicles at centers across the country. This includes the software and hardware, as well as the operational processes that power the system that ingests terabytes of data daily
Required Skills:
- Pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in CS, Engineering, or equivalent real-world experience 

- Experience writing in Python, C++ or Go, or similar in a production environment 

- Excellent communication skills  

- Passionate about community and working with others 

- Impact-driven

Job Summary:
Malaysian Medical Association (established in 1958) is the leading medical doctors association in Malaysia with over 14,000 doctors in its membership.  Koop MMA is the investment body for MMA.  It has currently a joint venture with HS Bio to develop an online healthcare business consisting of a B2B platform where over 2,000 clinics group purchase their medicines, test kits from as well as connect to labs for patients testing service.  The joint venture company, eMedAsia, was formed in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic and has since provided the clinics with the ability to buy medicines and test kits at a lower cost and utilize e-commerce for more efficient transactions. 

  

The official internship employer will be eMedAsia Sd Bhd.  The internship will be a 4 months program, with the ability to meet up (virtually) with the operation team when required.
Job Responsibilities:
To be part of the team to assist in building a transactional Data Warehouse and other applications on platform development (in Joget) for the purpose of developing sales and strategic insights on Malaysian clinics purchase patterns. Sales and transactional data will be extracted from eMedAsia.  This will be the basis for an on-going big data eMedAsia program. 


To assist in the research and development of any other application developed in Joget (application development platform).
Required Skills:
Candidate needs to be a team player
 
Fast learner and willingness to learn to get the job done. 
 
Understanding the Joget workflow platform which emedasia is built upon.
 
Programming skills (in Java and PHP) is an added advantage.  
 
A strong mathematics background is also required to assist in developing the necessary insights for the initial big data analytics project.

Job Summary:
Emerson Canada has an opening for an Information Systems Co-op Student reporting to the IT Manager, Infrastructure. The role will be based out of our office in Elmira, Ontario. This position will be full-time (37.5 hours per week), starting in the Winter Semester. The hourly wage for this position is $17 per hour. This wage is not negotiable. 


We are looking for a person that will fit perfectly with our very talented team of specialists, in an industry that has an incredibly bright future. The right individual will be working with the latest technologies and receive support from a dedicated, knowledgeable and fun group of people that truly love what they do. 


Working Conditions:  

This position will be based out of the Emerson Canada (Appleton) office in Elmira, Ontario. You must be eligible to work in Canada. This role does require some travel to local Emerson sites. A valid license and access to a vehicle are required. 

  

About Emerson (NYSE: EMR)


Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $23.4 billion CAD in sales, more than 20 Innovation, Solutions & Engineering Centers, and 200 manufacturing locations worldwide, is committed to helping employees grow and thrive throughout their careers. We are innovators, question-askers and problem-solvers. We don't settle for good enough or "This is the way it's always been done." Instead, we push ourselves and strive for the "never been done before."  

  

Our Automation Solutions business enables the greatest use of the world's most valuable resources, ensuring the performance and safety of industries that are the backbone of daily life. 

  

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

Job Summary:
Are you interested in social policy? Do you want to join a dynamic team passionate about helping Canadians access post-secondary education, as well as gain the skills needed to succeed in the labour market?  


If you answered yes to the above questions, consider joining the Learning Branch at Employment and Social Development Canada! We are hiring three co-op students interested in developing their research and policy skills by contributing to several initiatives targeted at broadening access to post-secondary education and skill development opportunities. 


Job Description:

We are seeking three Junior Research/Policy Officers who will help us develop evidence-based policy on issues pertaining to post-secondary education and support the development of policy and program objectives for the Branch. The ideal candidates will be skilled in research analysis and writing to help develop evidence-based policy on issues pertaining to post-secondary education. Work duties could include writing a variety of briefing materials, analysing and synthesizing data, and responding to ad-hoc policy and data requests.  


Job Location: Due to COVID-19, we are currently working remotely from home! 


Preferred Programs of Study:

- Public Administration or Policy 

- Public and International Affairs 

- Social Sciences (e.g., Economics, Political Science, Communications, etc.)  


While preference will be given to graduate students from the above disciplines, students from other fields of study with proven writing and research skills are also encouraged to apply. 


Thank you for taking the time to consider us!
Job Responsibilities:
Examples of Responsibilities:

- Research and conduct policy analysis on issues related to: access and affordability of post-secondary education, including for students that face barriers to post-secondary education, youth transitions from high school to college/university and the labour market, and key trends in demographics and impacts on student financial assistance and the broader post-secondary education system in Canada. 

- Prepare various supporting documents to provide briefing materials to senior management, such as research reports, policy reports, and summary notes. 

- Produce visual summaries of key documents. 

- Coordinate research and policy-related requests.
Required Skills:
Essential Skills:

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 

- Ability to conduct independent research, including internet research, literature reviews, etc. 

- Analytical and problem solving skills. 

- Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks simultaneously under tight timelines. 

- Experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. 

- Ability to work co-operatively in a team environment. 

- Reliability, good judgement and ability to take initiative. 


Assets:

- Completion of an undergraduate degree related to the listed programs of study. 

- Knowledge and/or research of post-secondary education issues. 

- Experience writing business documents and producing materials such as: research reports, summaries, corporate planning documents, and briefing notes. Ability to produce succinct and visually appealing presentations. 

- Experience in the use of computer software for statistics such as SAS or SPSS. 

- Secret security clearance.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Public Policy, Public Service and Government Relations 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Political Science
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS - Sociology and Legal Studies
				
			
				ARTS/SCI - Psychology
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
The Policy Unit of the Skilled Newcomers, Employment Integration and Partnership (SNEIP) Division within the Department of Employment and Social Development Canada is looking for a student to conduct policy analysis and research. SNEIP is responsible for the implementation of the Foreign Credential Recognition Program (FCRP). FCRP supports skilled newcomers better integrating into the Canadian labour market, by simplifying credential recognition processes, and by providing loans and employment supports to newcomers so that they can find meaningful employment in their field of expertise. Student's tasks will consist of conducting policy research related to labour market integration and employment, writing information and correspondence documents and analysing/summarizing information and data. 


We are seeking an enthusiastic individual who works well independently and within a co-operative team environment. You will gain experience in analytical skills, research, writing, editing and organizational tasks. The position offers an opportunity to gain a wide-ranging experience in policy analysis and a greater knowledge of Canadian skills and employment policies.

Our focus is to give students engineering design experience, knowledge and support to land any job in the future. Job Summary:
The ITS Solutions Administrator Coop's (ITSA Coop) role is to ensure proper computer operation for end user's daily operations.  This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests and escalating incidents.  Problem resolution may involve the troubleshooting of applications and/or hardware, installations, and imaging of software, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining, and upgrading equipment as required or scheduled. 

The role includes telephone support, remote connectivity, diagnostic and help request tracking tools, as well as requiring that the individual provide hands-on help at the desktop level.  Additionally, it could involve troubleshooting applications and software for all internal customers as well as but not limited to installing, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining, and upgrading hardware and equipment that business users work with to accomplish their daily tasks.
Job Responsibilities:
Strategy & Planning
 

Evaluate documented resolutions and analyze trends for future problem preventions
Alert management to emerging trends in incidents
Research software solutions to assist business users

Acquisition & Deployment

 

Assist in software releases, rollouts, and communication to the end users
Prepare and assist with hardware moves, adds and changes including network and system resources, such as desktop moves, printer relocation, boardroom setup, mobility items and more

Operational Management

 

Field incoming requests to the Service Desk via both telephone and e-mail to ensure courteous, timely and effective resolution of end user issues with devices such as smartphones, desktops, laptops, computers, tablets, smartboards, printer, projectors etc.
Document all pertinent end user identification information, including name, department, contact information and nature of problem or issue
Build rapport and elicit problem details from service desk customers
Prioritize and schedule problems.  Escalate problem (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician or third-party vendors, such as Security fobs and Telephony
Record, track and document the service desk request problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to final resolution
Apply diagnostic utilities to aid in troubleshooting
Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and FAQ resources on the Internet/Intranet to aid in problem resolution
Identify and learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the organization such as applications like Microsoft Office 365 and Citrix
Perform hands-on fixes at the desktop level, including installing and upgrading software, installing hardware, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications
Perform preventative maintenance, including checking and cleaning of workstations, printers, and peripherals
Test fixes to ensure problem has been adequately resolved
Perform post-resolution follow up to help requests
Develop help sheets and FAQ lists for end users
Attend and/or conduct training sessions for end users; creating training materials, as needed, for end users.

Small Projects

 

To the extent possible, the incumbent may be given small projects to work on that will increase their awareness on the use of technology in an operational environment

The number of small projects would be dependent on the workload in the department and the needs of the Operational team
Required Skills:
Required Skills:

Knowledge & Experience
 

Knowledge of basic computer hardware, including monitors, desktops, laptops, and their components thereof
Experience with Microsoft desktop (Win 10), and server operating systems (Win 08-19)
Experience with application support for  Microsoft Office products
Exceptional written, oral and telephone communication skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening and questioning skills
Strong documentation skills
Fluent English language skills.

Personal Attributes

Ability to conduct research into a wide range of computing issues as required
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed
Keen attention to detail
Excellent organization skills due to the multi-tasking nature of the position
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Ability to analyze issues and determine a best course of action
Ability to escalate issues to second level or vendor support when or as needed
Exceptional customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

Job Summary:
Engage Engineering is a boutique consulting engineering firm based in Peterborough, that provides municipal engineering services to both public and private sector clients. We place an emphasis on customer service by developing and maintaining strong relationships with our clients. We believe this helps us better understand our client's needs and deliver unique solutions tailored to those needs. Engage is not just our company name, it's our business philosophy. 

Typical Engage design projects include road reconstruction, lot grading, residential development, stormwater management and commercial site plans. Our scope ranges from Project Design to Project Management to Construction Administration. We work as both the project lead as well as being a member of a multi-disciplinary team, working alongside Planners, Architects, Surveyors, Environmental Consultants, and Electrical and Mechanical Engineers.
Job Responsibilities:
Daily projects will involve the design of civil infrastructure projects, including grading, drainage systems, road, culverts, storm and sanitary sewer systems and watermains. You will assist the design team in preparation  of design drawings, engineering calculations, quantity take-offs, cost estimates and contract document specifications. 

Through this work, you will gain experience with underground civil infrastructure design and construction practices. You will also gain exposure to the regulatory approval process of various agencies including the Convervation Authority, Municipality, and Ministry of Environment and Climate Change.
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate will have AutoCAD (Civil 3D is an asset) experience and a grasp of underground infrastructure and drainage concepts. Being a bit of a spreadsheet whiz gets part marks, and field survey experience is a bonus! 

If the above description turns your engineering crank, then we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for someone who shares our culture and core values and riding a bike wouldn't hurt either!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Sustainable Development
				
			
				- Theme - Visual, Urban & Industrial Design 
				
			
				- Theme - Waste or Wastewater Management 
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Geomatics
				
			
				ENV - Planning

Job Summary: A CO-OP position is available in environment, health and safety for development projects. The job involves document review and analysis of information and supporting other staff in their work. The student will be exposed to on-going hydropower construction and river bank stabilization projects. The role will also support environmental impact assessments (EIA) and review OHS Management Systems, monthly OHS reports, accident/incident and injury and illness analysis, tunnel, road and dam construction, and emergency response and recovery.
Job Responsibilities:
(1) Assist in literature review on EIA and Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) of Construction 

(2) Review OHS Acts in federal and Ontario jurisdiction 

(3) Assist in developing a corporate OHS Management System 

(4) Assist in preparing EIA and Emergency Response Plan 

(5) Literature review in OHS management of tunnel, road, and dam construction. 

(6) Assist in injuries and illness analysis in hydropower construction.
Required Skills:
(1) Understanding international project cases and socioeconomic aspects. 

(2) Enrolled in undergraduate program with environmental engineering and science, health science/studies background. 

(3) Will be able to drive/commute to office from home. 

(4) Good writing skills are required.

Job Summary:
Enlighted is a trailblazing Silicon Valley company in Smart Buildings and IoT and we're looking for the brightest minds out there to join our Canadian team.

We build an end-to-end IoT solution from sensors to cloud-based Big Data and web-based applications with the big mission of helping our customers meet their sustainability challenges while saving both money and time. Our innovative lighting control systems are already delivering energy savings of up to 90% at a large and growing number of Fortune 500 companies. And, once installed, intelligent lighting networks forms the basis for new IoT applications in commercial buildings such as space utilization, traffic flow and asset tracking allowing customers to see for the first time how their buildings and assets are being used.

Enlighted is part of the Siemens family of companies, combining the agility and culture of a start-up with the global reach of an industry heavyweight. As part of Enlighted Waterloo, you will join an energetic, cross-functional team working to seize an enormous market opportunity, backed by all the resources of Siemens, with approximately 4,300 employees across Canada who work together to deliver solutions for sustainable energy, intelligent infrastructure, healthcare, and the future of manufacturing.

As a Firmware/Hardware Developer, you will have the opportunity to apply your skills where they are needed, working on Enlighted's various hardware components, validating design and performance characteristics, isolating problems, finding fixes, and coordinating various efforts with the rest of the firmware team.
Job Responsibilities:
Identify and isolate problems with existing hardware/firmware
Develop novel solutions to identified problems
Clearly communicate findings
Assist in the development of automated firmware/hardware validation and testing
Provide hardware/firmware support and design input as required to Cloud/UI Designers and others
Provide support for Data Science team in the effective and accurate collection of data from Enlighted's systems
Identify opportunities for system improvements that can enhance the operation of the entire end-to-end system
Work as a part of a multi-disciplinary team spanning hardware, software, cloud development and product management.
Required Skills:
Fundamental understanding of digital and analog electronics
Ability to interpret and understand electronic specifications and datasheets
Ability to read and understand schematic diagrams
Understanding of embedded systems, firmware, microprocessors, SOC's
Ability to work with embedded protocols such as I2C, SPI, UART, and the devices that utilize them
Ability to use and interpret electronic lab test equipment
Ability to effectively identify and isolate problems
Ability to develop unique solutions as required
C, Python programming experience
Familiarity with embedded development tools
Experience with Linux, embedded Linux
Ability to learn and adapt to new situations
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Enlighted is a trailblazing Silicon Valley company in Smart Buildings and IoT. We're looking for the brightest minds to join our Canadian team. We build an end-to-end IoT solution from sensors to cloud-based Big Data and web-based applications with the mission of helping our customers meet their sustainability challenges. Our innovative lighting control systems are already delivering energy savings of up to 90% at a large and growing number of Fortune 500 companies. Once installed, our intelligent lighting networks forms the basis for new IoT applications in commercial buildings such as space utilization, traffic flow and asset tracking allowing customers to see for the first time how their buildings and assets are being used. 


Enlighted is part of the Siemens family of companies, combining the agility and culture of a Silicon Valley start-up with the global reach of an industry heavyweight. As part of Enlighted Waterloo, you will join an energetic, cross-functional team working to seize an enormous market opportunity, backed by all the resources of Siemens, with approximately 4,300 employees across Canada who work together to deliver solutions for sustainable energy, intelligent infrastructure, healthcare, and the future of manufacturing. 


As an Algorithms / Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of the energetic Enlighted Research team, which under the guidance of the CTO, is responsible for investigating new IoT applications and building advanced prototypes. You will work with the data produced by a variety of IoT sensors (lighting, vision, human presence, temperature, air quality, among others) to generate unique insights. You will build new algorithms, data pipelines, APIs, and create cutting-edge analytics and visualizations to support the development of customer-facing applications.
Job Responsibilities:
Design, develop and innovate enabled by our IoT stack and data pipelines using data collected from our game-changing sensors.
Employ advanced algorithms and data analytics techniques, such as ML, to gain insights from heterogeneous data.
Build end-to-end prototypes with new IoT sensors placed around buildings and feeding data to advanced analytics. For example, correlating BLE and PIR signals to predict indoor location; analyzing temperature, humidity, CO2, PIR, touch, vision ML, etc. to understand how a building is used, and ultimately provide recommendations about making a building more efficient/greener and generally more pleasant for its occupants.
Work in a multi-disciplinary team spanning hardware, software, and product management.
Required Skills:
Very comfortable working in a Linux-based development environment
Confident coding in python, and/or C/C++ and using tools like git
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch as well as data streaming technologies like Apache Kafka and MQTT is considered a plus
Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Google Cloud Platform) and associated tools considered a plus
Experience and interest in the IoT domain considered an asset
Outstanding analytical skills and an entrepreneurial mindset
Good communication skills in English

Job Summary:
About us

Most businesses pay their monthly electricity bill without understanding the details. As a licensed energy company, we developed a data - driven platform that gives businesses and their trusted partners the insights and tools they need to understand their bill. Understanding their bill helps large businesses unlock enormous savings opportunities.  Last year alone, our customers saved $40 million and reduced 400 tons of CO2e. 


The team

Our core team has built out our Ontario business, and we are now looking to grow the team as we expand into other North American markets. If you are passionate about energy and the environment, and you are looking for the opportunity to own a project, you will fit right in! We are currently located in the awesome Communitech building in downtown Kitchener-Waterloo. The team is working from home for the time being, but we are excited to get back when the time is right. 

  

The role

We are looking for a Business Development Representative to assist in growing the use of EnPowered's predictive analytics in Ontario. This role will give you the ability to understand how a sales cycle works, from first point of contact to closing a deal. In addition, it will develop your communication skills as you interact first-hand with CFOs, plant managers, and controllers.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Reach out to leads through email and phone to convert them into prospects
Rank prospects based off internal scoring metrics
Track sales cycle progress through the HubSpot CRM tool
Visit clients in-person to present our analysis to their senior team (including CFOs, plant managers, and controllers)
Take part in closing large enterprise deals
Develop a firm understanding of the energy market in Ontario
Required Skills:
Who you are

You are working towards a degree in Science, Economics or Business Administration
Enjoy continuously learning
You are comfortable or have experience interacting with customers
Not afraid to give and receive feedback
Comfortable cold calling
Excited to work hard and thrive in an exciting environment
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Energy Production and Distribution
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Sustainable Development
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				ENV - Environment, Resources and Sustainability
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé

Job Summary:
About us

Most businesses pay their monthly electricity bill without understanding the details. As a licensed energy company, we developed a data - driven platform that gives businesses and their trusted partners the insights and tools they need to understand their bill. Understanding their bill helps large businesses unlock enormous savings opportunities.  Last year alone, our customers saved $40 million and reduced 400 tons of CO2e. 


The team

Our core team has built out our Ontario business, and we are now looking to grow the team as we expand into other North American markets. If you are passionate about energy and the environment, and you are looking for the opportunity to own a project, you will fit right in! The team is currently working remotely and we will continue to be a remote first workplace.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do 

Organize new and current legal documents 
Research markets to understand licensing requirements 
Prepare reports to instruct/carry out licensing tasks 
Complete and submit 1 million forms (to get us actually licensed and we're not exaggerating, it feels like 1 million forms) on behalf of EnPowered
This means getting many people to sign forms as you coordinate with multiple team members 
Get EnPowered signed up with utilities which includes following instructions posted online and calling the company to get it done 
Maintain good relationships with any contact we do have because they often assist us in the long term with report and /filing requirements 
Anything you do will require a lot of learning - nothing will be familiar!

Currently enrolled in business or legal studies 
Excellent written and verbal skills, including spelling and grammar with a super strong attention to detail
Exceptional planning and organization skills, and the ability to coordinate and monitor a significant number of simultaneous tasks in an environment of shifting priorities as you will need to be good at keeping track of the many small tasks you have + prioritizing which ones to do first 
The ability to work independently and successfully complete numerous short and long-term assignments simultaneously in a team environment
Learn how  to figure things out on your own - what something means and how it works 
Have the ability to read a lot of really boring documents but know how to grab the main/best points and summarize so others can get the quick notes

Job Summary:
About us


Most businesses pay their monthly electricity bill without understanding the details. As a licensed energy company, we developed a data-driven platform that gives businesses and their trusted partners the insights and tools they need to understand their bill. Understanding their bill helps large businesses unlock enormous savings opportunities.  Last year alone, our customers saved $40 million and reduced 400 tons of CO2e. 


The team


Our core team has built out our Ontario business, and we are now looking to grow the team as we expand into other North American markets. If you are passionate about energy and the environment, and you are looking for the opportunity to own a project, you will fit right in! We are currently located in the awesome Communitech building in downtown Kitchener-Waterloo. The team is working from home for the time being, but we are excited to get back when the time is right.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do


As a member of the bill analysis and code breaking team at EnPowered your work will include a mix of complex problem solving, operations, and strategy. 


Problem Solving:

The majority of your time will be spent trying to reverse engineer electricity bills; you will know the end result (the bill total), and most of the inputs (usage, rates, etc.), but you will need to figure out the combination of inputs that deliver the correct output
This may seem simple, unfortunately the electricity industry loves their exceptions, and so you will often need to find exactly how a utility is calculating a customers' bill in order to accurately reverse engineer it
This is currently done within a complex excel file, but as soon as a subset of customers' bills have reliably been reverse engineered to 99.99% accuracy the product team will automate the process


Operations:

Clearly explain to the product team how to automate the reverse engineering of electricity bills after you have successfully decrypted them
Leverage your knowledge of how bills work to support the sales enablement and customer success teams in answering customer questions about billing


Strategy:

Find unique savings opportunities and billing errors that can be leveraged as new solutions for our customers
Work with other teams to help develop strategies to roll-out automated features faster in new markets and utility jurisdictions
Required Skills:
Who you are

You love to solve problems and riddles; the kind of person who solves Sudoku puzzles to relax, has excel files to track everything, or plays video games with lots of numbers and graphs
You are someone who wants to own their work; when you start you will have a list of to dos, but within 3 months you are expected to be largely independent and capable of prioritizing your own list of tasks
You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and taking on tasks that may not fit your job description
You have the proven ability to start and run your own projects from beginning to end
You have very strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to collaborate across teams
You have very advanced Excel skills, including strong knowledge of managing large files, manipulating Pivot Tables, and using Index functions
Knowledge of the electricity industry is an asset, but not required

Division: Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network
Job Summary:
ABOUT ENVIRONMENT AND CLIMATE CHANGE CANADA


Environment and Climate Change Canada is a department within the Federal Public Service.  Environment Canada's mandate is to preserve and enhance the quality of the natural environment, including water, air and soil quality; conserve Canada's renewable resources, including migratory birds and other non-domestic flora and fauna; conserve and protect Canada's water resources; carry out meteorology; enforce the rules made by the Canada - United States International Joint Commission relating to boundary waters; and coordinate environmental policies and programs for the federal government. 

  

About The Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network

  

The Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) is a non-urban air quality monitoring network with siting criteria designed to ensure that the measurement locations are regionally representative (not affected by local sources of air pollution).  There are currently over 30 measurement sites across Canada including one in the U.S.  CAPMoN provides high quality atmospheric chemistry data for use in determining spatial patterns and establishing temporal trends for the atmospheric pollutants related to acid rain, smog and particulate matter. CAPMoN's data is also used to study atmospheric processes, environmental effects research (aquatic and terrestrial) and for validating computer models used to produce air quality predictions. 


About The Canadian Brewer Spectrophotometer Network


The Canadian Brewer Spectrophotometer Network (CBSN) monitors the total thickness of the ozone layer (known as total column ozone) and ultraviolet (UV) radiation at selected monitoring locations across Canada. The network's objectives are to provide long-term stratospheric ozone data for periodic assessment of the state of ozone layer; use the data for validating satellite ozone data (total ozone and UV); and provide long-term data of spectral UV for biological effect studies (e.g., vitamin D production), ozone data for Environment and Climate Change Canada UV index forecasts, and data for studying current and emerging issues such as climate change (stratosphere).
Job Responsibilities:
This co-op position will support the information management requirements of the Air Quality Measurements and Analysis Research Section (ARQM). You will directly support operations of the Canadian Air and Precipitation Monitoring Network (CAPMoN) / the Canadian Brewer Spectrophotometer Network through the following duties:
 

Create Android mobile applications to transfer data from measurement sites to a data center
Develop and enhance web applications using PHP, Javascipt, jQuery, AJAX, Bootstrap, Visual Studio, Microsoft .NET, MySQL and MS SQL databases
Develop and enhance scripts using Python
Produce and maintain scripts for field and lab operation on Windows and Linux platforms
Undertake miscellaneous field and lab operation IT support as required
Required Skills:
Programming: PHP, JavaScript, VBScript, Python,  jQuery, AJAX, Bootstrap, Visual Studio, Microsoft .NET
Database: MS SQL databases,  MySQL and SQLite
Operating Systems: Windows 10, Windows Server 2016 and Linux
Mobile system: Android Studio

Job Summary:
Background Information

The Canadian Ice Service (CIS), Environment and Climate Change Canada, is responsible for monitoring and providing timely and accurate information on sea ice and iceberg conditions in Canadian waters, as well as maintaining the climate records for sea ice. We rely primarily on the visual interpretation of radar (SAR) satellite imagery, namely the RADARSAT Constellation Mission (RCM) and Sentinel-1. We are one of the largest Government of Canada users of SAR data, with near-complete daily or weekly coverage of our areas of interest, ingesting and analysing upward of 400 SAR images every day. 


To learn more about our work, visit us on Twitter @ECCC_CIS. Did you know that CIS has hired Waterloo co-op students since the 1980's, and that our current manager of Applied Science started at CIS as a co-op student? 

  

We are looking for two co-op students to join our Applied Science and Development section to work on developing an initial capability in deep learning, to support the automation of two ice-monitoring workflows (details below), leveraging existing code and concepts elaborated by our partners in recent years. The two students will work closely with three other Physical Sciences Specialists who are experts in satellite image interpretation and processing, as well as project advisors from our IT and Operations groups. 


Specifically, we are looking for someone studying: 

  

- Computer science with an interest in geography, geomatics, or image processing, OR; 

- Geomatics with a strong computer science foundation interested in programming, OR; 

- Mathematics, engineering, or physics with a strong interest in programming.
Job Responsibilities:
Project

The students and CIS staff will work closely as an integrated project team to propose and implement a proof-of-concept system for automating two important ice-monitoring workflows using deep learning. We will train multi-scale U-Net deep learning models and establish the data connections and pre-processing pipelines for RCM and Sentinel-1 satellite imagery as the main input to estimate two parameters:
 

Lake Ice cover (percentage) as part of CIS's Inland Lakes monitoring program (about 300 lakes, monitored weekly), and
sea ice cover (percentage) and sea ice edge as part of Canada's METAREA responsibilities (daily bulletins).

This project will require knowledge of Python, Git, and libraries such as GDAL, Keras and TensorFlow. 


The two students will work in parallel on complementary aspects of the project, in line with their interests and expertise, interacting (via MS Teams) daily with other team members, and weekly with the entire team where they will present their progress and discuss technical issues. ECCC laptops, email accounts, etc. will be provided. 


Project outcomes will include a term report and presentation, code, and associated documentation.
Required Skills:
Intermediate or advanced knowledge of Python is essential. Knowledge of libraries (including GDAL, Numpy, TensorFlow, Keras or similar libraries) is an asset; knowledge of REST APIs is also an asset. Experience with visualization of satellite images in ArcGIS or other geospatial software is an asset, but training will be provided. 

  

By the end of the term, the student will have contributed the improvement of operational monitoring programs and have gained experience with the following: 

- Principles of automated ice extent classification 

- Retrieval and pre-processing of SAR imagery 

- Interpretation of ice and open water in SAR satellite images 

- Training and validation of deep learning models 

- Programming skills 

- Working with a multi-disciplinary team

Job Summary:
Within the Canadian Wildlife Service, the Wildlife Management Directorate plays an important role in tackling some of the most pressing issues for Canadian wildlife. We offer students a supportive, interactive, and dynamic workplace where you will have the chance to showcase your commitment to the environment, enthusiasm, ideas, and research skills. 

  

You will join a federal government department (Environment and Climate Change Canada) committed to evidence-based decision-making; collaboration with other departments, external experts and key stakeholders; and innovative approaches to protect and conserve our air, water, wildlife and spaces. 

  

Why Work With Us?

We tackle some of the biggest environmental issues
We embrace and promote diversity and inclusiveness
We promote a respectful workplace
We support a healthy work-life balance
We invest in employee learning and career development
We provide the opportunity to develop a wealth of contacts and build your network within the Government of Canada.

Why This Job Is Right For You:

You will have an opportunity to work on contemporary environmental policy and regulatory challenges;
You will gain valuable experience and increase your knowledge of conservation and biodiversity policy and regulations with respect to the Species at Risk Act;
You will develop a better understanding of governmental activities, including the challenges and opportunities of working on interdepartmental issues;
You will work and learn alongside supportive and experienced colleagues and managers;
You will have the opportunity to influence and initiate change within the Government of Canada in the area of species at risk conservation, protection and recovery; and
You will use your creativity in developing innovative approaches to meet the government's ambitious conservation goals.

This is an outstanding learning opportunity for individuals who have an interest in protecting and conserving Canada's biodiversity and species at risk.

Job Summary:
The Emergencies Science and Technology Section (ESTS) of Environment Canada is looking for three motivated students at the post-secondary 2nd-year level or higher studying chemistry, chemical engineering, environmental engineering, or other fields related to studying interactions between materials. Additional work experience in an analytical laboratory is an asset. This is an opportunity for the student to gain hands-on laboratory experience working with various analytical techniques such as fluorescence spectroscopy, gas chromatography, mass spectroscopy, densitometer, viscometer, refractive index, particle size analyzer, etc. in a CALA-accredited laboratory. The position may include some environmental fieldwork at isolated locations. The successful candidate will have good laboratory practices and techniques, work safely and efficiently, manage data effectively, and possess the ability to multi-task. 

  

About ESTS:

ESTS is concerned with understanding how spills of petroleum products and fuels, crude oils, and other hazardous chemicals affect the environment and the best strategies for cleaning them up. For more than 30 years, the section has had a program of research and development related to the properties, behaviour, detection, measurement, and effects of spilled hazardous materials and spill countermeasures' effectiveness and environmental benefits. Research results are regularly applied to real spill incidents to improve spill response and help maintain Canada's environment's quality. 

  

Key Activities:

The positions' primary duties include analyzing petroleum products and crude oil properties and the interaction of these materials with simulated natural environments to assess the suitability and effectiveness of chemical countermeasures to treat spills. 

  

Location of Job: 335 River Road, Ottawa, ON, providing that the COVID-19 public health measures permit. 

  

Particulars:  
 

Jan 2022- August 2022. Specific start and end dates to be negotiated with the successful candidate and her/his educational institution
The hours of work are Monday through Friday from 8:30 am- 4:30 pm
Compensation is based on federal government co-op rates, as determined by the number of work terms completed and level of education.

English essential 

Preference will be given to Canadian citizens. 

The Public Service of Canada promotes Employment Equity, and we encourage candidates to voluntarily self-identify if they are members of a visible minority group, persons with a disability, and/or Aboriginal persons. 

The position may include some environmental fieldwork at isolated locations.
Job Responsibilities: The primary duties of the position include analyzing petroleum products and crude oil properties and the interaction of these materials with simulated natural environments to assess the fate and behaviour of oil and the suitability and effectiveness of chemical countermeasures to treat spills. Working under the guidance of experienced lab staff, the candidate will generate samples under established conditions using a range of techniques, followed by analysis using gas chromatography, rheometry, particle sizing, and others. In addition, the candidate will characterize the oil properties using standard methods on instruments such as densitometers, pour point testers, tensiometers, and others. In addition, the effectiveness of oil spill countermeasures such as dispersants, surface washing agents, herders, and sorbents may be evaluated using established tests. There may also be an opportunity for method development.
Required Skills:
Strong lab skills and experience relevant to a wet chemistry lab 

Good laboratory practices 

Safe work practices 

Data management and report writing

Job Summary:
Environmental quality guidelines are benchmarks that help with the assessment and management of chemical substances in the environment. They are based on toxicology data and represent the level or concentration of a substance in the environment at which there is low likelihood of adverse effects on the ecosystem. Guidelines can be developed for various media including surface water, groundwater, sediment, soil, wildlife diet, fish tissue, and bird egg. 


The co-op student will support the derivation of Federal Environmental Quality Guidelines developed through Canada's Chemicals Management Plan and/or Canadian Environmental Quality Guidelines developed through the Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment. The student may develop a guideline in whole or in part for either a metal or an organic substance through data collection, critical evaluation of toxicity information, data synthesis, statistical analyses, identification of data gaps, report writing, peer review, and revision.
 
The language requirement for this position is English essential. This position is for the fall 2021 semester (September to December) with an option to extend until April 2022. Please indicate your availability in your cover letter.
Job Responsibilities:
As the co-op program is intended to introduce the student to the working environment, the student will be exposed to and take part in other office activities such as meetings, training, and committee work, where possible, required, or deemed necessary. 


The student will develop an understanding of the physical, chemical and biological properties that affect the ecotoxicity of chemicals, as well as principles employed in environmental hazard assessment of chemicals. In addition, the student will also gain experience in how inter- and intradepartmental committees function and how governments at various levels collaborate.
Required Skills:
Areas of study relevant to this position include environmental toxicology, environmental science, environmental chemistry, animal/plant physiology, biology, ecology, soil science, statistics and hydrology. 
 
The candidate must demonstrate:

A good understanding of environmental science.  Specifically, candidates will be assessed on their knowledge of environmental toxicology and chemistry, including effects measured in toxicity tests and the physical and chemical properties that affect a chemical's fate in the environment. 
Competence in the scientific method
Good judgement

 Successful candidate(s) are expected to be able to:

 

work competently in MS Word and Excel
carry out literature searches
perform critical evaluation of scientific papers and extract relevant information
synthesize information and write clear reports

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Atmospheric Boundary Layer Research Assistant
Job Summary:
Introduction

            Environment and Climate Change Canada is interested in hiring one (1) co-op student on a four-month term as an atmospheric boundary layer research assistant. The research assistant will work on analyzing datasets from newly-acquired lidar observations at multiple sites (Windsor, Iqaluit, Whitehorse) in Canada. The co-op student will be supervised by a research scientist and collaborate with researchers in the meteorological research division at Environment and Climate Change Canada - Downsview (Toronto) or, more likely, remotely from home (COVID19-depending). The start date for this role is early January, 2022.
Job Responsibilities:
Research Plan

            Several new cutting-edge technologies have been deployed to locations across Canada, including the Arctic, to investigate their performance and applications for meteorological observation, forecasting, and satellite validation. These remote sensing instruments can be remotely accessed, require no manual operation, and are currently producing a growing scientific dataset. The co-op student will be responsible for the analysis of a novel dataset of lidar observations from multiple ceilometer and Doppler lidar instruments deployed across Canada to investigate the evolution of the atmospheric boundary layer height and winds. Existing scientific analysis codes, written in python, are to be expanded upon and new ones are to be created in order to analyze the lidars' observational datasets and generate results (plots). The ultimate goal of this research project is to develop a robust boundary layer detection algorithm, generate plots, and prepare scientific procedures and algorithms for upcoming field campaigns, with the possibility of publication in a scientific journal.
Required Skills:
Applicant Requirements

Must be enrolled as a full-time student in a relevant field (physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering)
Must have experience writing or editing codes using Python
Must have experience managing large datasets
Must be capable of working independently as well as part of a team
Computer programming skills are considered an asset
Experience with remote server access (via SSH, FTP, etc.) is considered an asset
Experience reading and working with instrument data sets preferred

Job Summary:
The Meteorological Research Division of Environment and Climate Change Canada conducts research in weather analysis and forecasting, thus equipping Canadians to make informed decisions on weather conditions. Freezing rain weather events can have large impact on society (increased number of slip and fall injuries, disruption to transportation, damage to power grid), yet they remain challenging to forecast accurately. Moreover, even the simple distinction between rain and snow can have very different impacts for both hydrology (spring snow melt, rain-on-snow events), meteorological weather warnings (snow storms and blowing snow) and climate change (snow albedo feedback). Within the Observation-Based Research Section, new methods for the inference of the precipitation type (rain, snow, freezing rain, ice pellets, etc.) using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are being investigated. 


The work term project will consist in determining the feasibility of using lidar technology for nowcasting precipitation type using machine/deep learning methods. 


Lidars provide observations of water vapour and temperature at high frequency/low latency which makes them excellent candidates for nowcasting applications (that is, forecasting with a lead time of a few hours). Testing the machine/deep learning algorithms on the lidar observations will help us conclude the feasibility of using lidar observations to predict precipitation type. If successful, this would illustrate one benefit of using lidars in a larger meteorological network. 


It is expected that the work could eventually lead to a scientific publication as well as actual improvements on precipitation type forecasts for all Canadians.
Job Responsibilities:
- Import, ingest and visualize meteorological data sources (e.g. lidar observations, gridded forecasts, weather station observations, airport reports) 

- Pre-process and prepare data using Python 

- Adapt and run pre-trained machine/deep learning algorithms on High-Performance Computing (HPC) platform 

- Perform statistical analysis of predictions 

- Manage and openly share code and data 

- Report progress to supervisors and share results internally and externally
Required Skills:
- Mathematics and statistic prowess 

- Computer programming in Python 

- Capable of independent time management to meet deadlines and to deliver results 

- Good communicator 

- Enthusiasm in tackling challenges and on developing code which will have a positive impact on the society 


Assets: 

- Previous experience in machine learning 

- Previous experience with git, gitlab and/or github 

- Previous experience on Linux and/or HPC environment 

- Previous experience working with time-series data, spatial data and/or geophysical data

Job Summary: To support scientific research on High-Impact Weather (HIW) and Nowcasting, that is, the prediction of flooding rain, large hail or tornado in the next hour, we are currently investigating the use of artificial intelligence to detect and predict HIW events. An essential step to meet this objective is to gather high-quality data for training and validation of machine/deep learning algorithms. The goal of the project would be to assess an internal database of high-impact weather reports collected from various sources (such as social media) for accuracy and completeness by comparing with manual weather observations at airports and HIW proxies derived from lightning data.

Standardizing variables and formatting tabular data

Job Summary:
Co-op student working as a laboratory technician in invertebrate ecotoxicology labs at Environment and Climate Change Canada will: 


- Contribute to various research projects on the effects of waterborne contaminants on invertebrates including native freshwater mussels. 


- Work alongside full-time technicians and graduate students to maintain cultures of live invertebrates, conduct toxicity tests, monitor water quality during experiments, process tissue, water and sediment samples generated in experiments and clean glassware. 


- This position will be lab-based with opportunities to participate in field studies. 


- Environment and Climate Change Canada is committed to health and safety protocols designed to minimize the risk of COVID-19 transmission in the workplace.
Job Responsibilities:
1. Assist with toxicity tests with waterborne contaminants and freshwater mussels and other freshwater benthic invertebrates (i.e., amphipods, chironomids, worms, mayflies) in the laboratory.    


2. Prepare invertebrate tissues for analysis, prepare chemical solutions, sieve field-collected sediment, and conduct measurements using laboratory instruments according to detailed protocols.   


3. Maintenance of live freshwater mussels in a flow-through aquatic animal holding facility (feeding, monitor survival, tank cleaning etc).  Maintain laboratory cultures of live freshwater benthic invertebrates (i.e., amphipods, chironomids, worms, mayflies) including handling, feeding, and water changes. 


4. Preparation and cleaning of glassware according to protocols and contribute to routine laboratory maintenance and cleanup.  


5. Measure pH, oxygen, temperature, conductivity and ammonia in overlying water samples in the laboratory. 


6. Tabulate, summarize, and analyze data using MS Excel and other computer programs.  


7. Assist with other research projects as required.  


8. Participation in field collections of freshwater mussels and other field studies in southern Ontario Rivers.
Required Skills:
Qualifications: 

1. Laboratory experience.  Necessary: Successful completion of the laboratory components of undergraduate courses in biology and chemistry (list relevant courses in cover letter).  Significant Asset: Further experience in laboratory-based research acquired through either work or volunteer positions. 

2.  Experience and/or demonstrated interest in environmental sciences (e.g. biology, chemistry, ecology, environmental toxicology, aquatic science).  

3.  Demonstrated ability to work well with others and work independently. 

4.  Takes pride and care in their work and pays attention to detail. 

5.  Knowledge of computer programs such as MS Excel and Word. 

  

Preference will be given to Biology and Environmental Science students who have demonstrated previous laboratory and/or field research experience outside of thier undergradaute studies.

Job Summary:
Position Title 

Student Program Officer, Plastics and Marine Litter Division, Environmental Protection Branch, Environment and Climate Change Canada


Do you have a passion to advance positive change and take on the pressing environmental issue of plastic waste and pollution? Do you want to learn about environmental protection and public policy? Do you want to work in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment? 

  

If so, Environment and Climate Change Canada's Plastics and Marine Litter Division is looking for two motivated students to join our team. You will have an opportunity to work in a multi-disciplinary team on an important environmental issue, benefit from on-the-job-training of a variety of tasks, and gain valuable experience working with Government of Canada colleagues and other stakeholders.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties could include the following:
 

Review, analyze or prepare materials and provide input to management to support decision making
Write correspondence to the public
Conduct analysis and communicate results on media content and public opinion research related to plastic waste and pollution
Identify, compile, assess and track emerging research and efforts to address plastic pollution and support the development of plastic pollution science framework
Support efforts to engage industry, organizations, researchers and the public
Monitor and report on parliamentary affairs where they relate to plastics and the plastics industry
Support administration and management of funding agreements for plastics innovation and community-based projects aimed at reducing plastic pollution.

You are familiar with environmental and plastic related issues and policies
You have completed at least 2 years in an undergraduate science or environment program or are enrolled in a related master's program
You have strong research and analysis abilities, excellent attention to detail, and can communicate effectively orally and in writing
You are able to work independently and effectively with colleagues and stakeholders
